Reviews.Title: “Don't let the good location to parks fool you.”
Reviews.Author: D T
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed with this property. The pool grounds are nice, but the rest is old and nasty. Small number of the staff try really hard, but they are the exception. I am a Hilton Gold member and loyal for many years. I used points for this stay and felt cheated. Seriously considering taking my future travel elsewhere. Below is a list of items my family and I experienced. If I knew to expect these, I would have chosen Florida. Expect your room not to be ready on check in. (5:30 in stead of advertised 4pm) Expect to be sent to voicemail when calling for services from your room(48 hr response times) Expect your room service tray to sit in your hallway for days. Expect to call maintenance at least once a day for something not working (toilet would not stop rumming, bathtub would not drain, cordless phone never worked.) Expect smokers in the rooms below rooms 521 and 523 which prevents you from using the balcony in any way. Expect to pay an excessive amount for parking. Expect to pay cash for the yellow cabs contracted to the hotel (even though there are stickers in the window showing credit card logos.) Expect unannounced tree maintenance at the pool the day you decide to stay on the property. Yes, this property is close to sea world. But my advice is to stay clear of this Hilton. It is not what you think a 4 star property should be. Sea World has lots of parking and shuttles from the other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: makingmemories09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March for a family wedding - our family had booked quite a few rooms. The front desk was very accommodating when we needed to check in early and also when we needed to print out our boarding passes for our return flight home. The staff was very efficient in meeting our every need. The Olive Lounge is a great place to hang out at the end of the day - the fire lamps and fire pits are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and The Bad (Garden Villa Suite)”
Reviews.Author: pleasetakemewithyou2
Reviews.Content: The Good: *Beautiful property and pool * Nice decor *Gardenview Villa had a very nice patio with chairs and lounge *Villa had wet bar with microwave *nice fitness facility The Bad: *Tiny Bathroom *No verizon or T-mobile service (including hotspot-couldn't use the hotspot for wifi) *Coffee shop was not open all day, and was closed at 11 for lunch (and then for the day at 1) *Not close off property restaurants-cab cost $25 each way to Ocean Beach and the Gaslamp *Rollaway cost extra $25 a night- no pull out couch in the villa suite (it really was just a regular room with a wet bar-shouldn't be called a suite as there is no sitting area other than the patio) We paid $680 for 3 nights; I would not stay here again in the same room unless I paid less that $100 a night

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Business and Family”
Reviews.Author: east2westandback
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our recent stay at the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. We travelled with two young kids, mixing business and family stay. We chose a garden view twin room, in one of the villas. Very happy with the room - good size, very comfortable, had a fridge microwave and sink which was good for looking after the kids' needs. Our view was over the back garden which was basically a fence, so that was not so hot, but we didn't mind. The resort itself is very good. It's not Dubai, so don't expect a never ending buffet and marble pillars, but the resort does itself justice. The pool is heated, and the depth is 3 - 5 feet so the kids could touch the bottom in areas. There are two wonderful hot tubs just off the pool, a table tennis table and a giant draughts set. It's very picturesque and the sunset over the bay is an attractive sight. There's a motor boat, jetski kayak rental on the beach, which we didn't use as the weather was not great. The beach is a manmade looking one, but it's fine for the kids. Jogging or rollerblading along the bayfront is fun, and there are bikes to rent. There's a very good children's playground about 7-10 mins walk along the waterfront. We travelled downtown to the convention centre, to balboa park and the zoo, as well as to seaworld - all by taxi, very easy short trips. Fashion mall is much better the name sounds, and has some good toy shops as well as a wide range of clothing. Food choices in the hotel are good, for both adults and kids, and the room service choices are good too. it's fairly gourmet and the quality is quite high. As it's off season now, we didn't have the full choice of dining as some of the venues were not open. The best thing about the hotel is the staff - exceptionally friendly and happy to please - Larry in the restaurant and Ramon on the front desk were great, but all the staff create a happy, easy going and helpful environment. The only annoying thing about the hotel is the lack of in room wifi - we went to the onsite convention centre to login to free wifi. Amenities - a very good hotel shop, helpful reception and conceriege, business centre, fed ex package handling, hotel shuttle - very helpful and individualised service, great value on zoo and sea world tickets (prices similar but many additional perks included esp sea world multi entry) Why not 5 stars - well it's just a little old, the choices are just a little limited compared to modern resort hotels esp in the Middle East and Asia, but the staff make up for all of this - it deserves a 4.5 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property---great value!”
Reviews.Author: DiamondGirl419
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline on a $79 per night bid. We weren't sure what to expect because of some of the reviews on Trip Advisor, but I can say that I was pleased with this property. We were assigned a room on the 6th floor tower across from the lobby and had wonderful views of Mission Bay and beyond. The balcony was furnished with a table and 2 chairs and made for quiet mornings as the sun came up. Our room was beautifully appointed--the room and bathroom appeared to have been the result of a recent remodel. Very comfy bed with a nightlite attached to the headboard for those who want to read if your traveling companion wants to sleep. Check-in was very easy and quick. We purchased coffee and yogurt every morning and both were delicious. Lunch at poolside was great---we had waitresses so you could order adult beverages and foods such as grilled chicken sandwiches or burgers. The prices were about the same as any other resort we've been to. We took a taxi service to this hotel from the airport rather than rent a car. Not worth renting a car since you have to pay for parking here as well as the cost of a rental. We were only staying here 2 nights as a layover on our way to Maui. The hotel does offer a shuttle service to Old Town San Diego and SeaWorld for free. Other destinations are available for a fee. This property is well landscaped and cared for. I loved it because I felt like we were on our own island area...very private even though you could look out past the property gates and watch all the joggers, walkers and runners on the paved path along Mission Bay. Hilton also has bike rentals and I believe boats of some sort too ( I saw a dock with Hilton's name on it).. When we were here, it was off-season, so the cabanas were free to sit under...Nice touch...69-72 degrees all day...just perfect! The only thing I can address with concern is that the hot tub was MUCH too hot. Most guests here complained about it. Yes, it should be more hot than warm, but this was very, very hot (and I CAN take a lot of heat)....So if I'm sayin' it's hot...it's WAY hot. I do not recommend immersing yourself for more than 30 seconds-whew! Would I stay here again? Absolutely! This was my first time to San Diego, and this resort left a favorable impression on us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location. Room looked great but smelled moldy. Do NOT rent the quad bikes!”
Reviews.Author: AlohaElle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the villas. I requested the bottom floor to be able to walk out in the garden and lounge on the round love couch. Nice! Room was nice except for that moldy stink for being too close to the water. Do not rent the 4 person bike thinking you will have a leisurely ride. The 4 of us (in shape) huffed and puffed sweating and jumped out to push it up the hills. The tires were somewhat flat :( when we complained to the rental guy, he patronized us by saying stuff like "you tried really hard, I was sure you could do it. good job." Umpf

Reviews.Title: “Acqua.... Great restaurant! Excellent service, amazing food, overall a very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: Hautehostess
Reviews.Content: Kevin Sharpe is managing a very good staff at the Hilton's Acqua restaurant. I was seriously impressed by the politeness and congeniality of the staff. Have gone back day after day for an excellent dining experience. Five stars all the way around! Amazing espresso martini as well. Nice work!

Reviews.Title: “Potential To Be Great!”
Reviews.Author: Shelleeee
Reviews.Content: I just recently had the opportunity to stay at the Hilton Resort and Spa for a conference I was attending. Typically when I travel on business, or for a conference I stay at a Marriott and commute or walk to the other location. Because the Hilton is out on its own, and is a beautiful resort property we opted to stay onsite. After reading reviews about the price of parking we decided it'd be more cost effective to use a taxi to get from the airport, and to visit other areas. For our 3 night stay we ended up spending about $100 on taxi fares. This was to get to and from the airport, as well as round trip taxi service to and from Old Town, and Pacific Beach. I believe this was still much less expensive than the cost of a rental car, along with gas, and $32 a day parking which is highly excessive! Unfortunately San Diego is a driving town, and not having a car made us feel trapped. There are no restaurants, are markets even remotely close. You are pretty much required to only eat, drink, and buy any odds and ends you may need at the hotel. We needed sunscreen and paid $18 for it! Our room was located in the Tower on floor 4, and overlooked the lobby and driveway area, so we did not have a view. The rooms are decent, and the bed is pretty comfortable. However I think the rooms were designed by a man, as there was no full length mirror or decent lighting, something I desire when staying at a hotel. The room felt like a Vampires Liar. Another issue that did not affect us but did cause difficulty for other conference attendees was the cost of the internet, apparently not wireless in the room, and $15 a day. We had a 3G iPad, Thank Goodness! Now that my complaints are out of the way, I do think it's important to address the positives of this hotel. First and foremost is the service. The hotel staff is wonderful! Everyone is so nice and helpful. I did not run into one discourteous representative of this hotel, and I was there for almost four days straight so this says a lot. While I didn't get to use the pool area, it looked amazing! Luckily I was able to use the running path around the bay, which was great. The west side of the property was beautiful! I think this resort would be a great place to stay with your family, in one of the condo/suites on the bay side of the hotel. They appear to be fully equipped with kitchens, so you could prepare your own meals, pending you had a car to go to the market. I personally don't think I'd stay at this property again because of the parking. It's very expensive at $32 a day, and I just would never be willing to pay that along with a $200 plus per night room cost, and I'd never go to suburban San Diego again without a car. If they lowered their parking cost to say $15, I'd highly recommend this place for families. I'd also recommend it to you if money is no object. Which unfortunately isn't the case for me. ;-/

Reviews.Title: “One word best describes this resort...TIRED.”
Reviews.Author: RicFlair_10
Reviews.Content: If not for the location and the pool area, there would be no reason to stay in this property. The restaurants are decent but the service was atrocious. I too thought the $32 daily parking fee was ridiculous. The rooms, common areas and grounds all need to be updated. I'm glad my kids are younger (11 and 6) because they think it's a great place. If they were older, they'd realize this place is old and tired...

Reviews.Title: “Hilton on the Bay”
Reviews.Author: ryanwest
Reviews.Content: This hotel is laid out in a park style with a number of buildings making up the hotel. The grounds had lovely landscaping, with birds of paradise surrounded by a low purple flower. The lawns are rolling and well maintained. We were cheerfully greeted as we pulled up to the front of the location. We were greeted a second time by a bellhop as we entered the lobby. The desk hostess continued the warm welcome. We had booked two rooms online using a discount website. The hostess told us the hotel had given us adjoining rooms. One room had a king size bed while the other had two queens. Because we were traveling with another couple we asked if we could have two rooms with king size beds. Even though we used the discounted website, the hostess cheerfully changed our rooms and quickly reassigned us two king size rooms. One room overlooked the freeway while the other one overlooked the bay. The room overlooking the freeway had several minor issues. The paint in the room was chipped just above the desk. The carpet was pulling back and frayed where it met the tile. The cold water did not work at the sink. The room was large and very comfortable overall. The other room had a nice view of the bay with no issues of which to speak. Both rooms were reasonably clean, with some dusting issues. Besides the wear in places, the other drawback was the $32 per night self parking fee. The hotel was about one mile from SeaWorld, two miles from Old Town, seven miles from Petco Park. This is the type of hotel where you bring the family for a family vacation. We didnâ€™t have any time to make use of most of the amenities but everything looked inviting.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shenadia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend with boyfriend and 5 year old daughter. Booked a bottom suite with patio overlooking garden and beach. Hotel room was clean and very spacious. Bed and pillows were super soft and comfortable. Loved the heated pool and jacuzzi, with easy access to beach walkway. front desk provided excellent and friendly service. Will stay here again at this beautiful clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Fun Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Michael J
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weekend. The weather was really nice and it's right on the bay. The staff were really friendly. I asked for extra pillows and toiletries and they delivered it quickly and seemed genuinely happy to help. The room was really nice. We had a waterfront room with a fire pit so it was nice sitting on the patio with a fire and some beer. The resort is really well kept. very clean and modern. The pool was really nice with a lot of bright orange umbrellas and cabanas. Definitely one of the nicest Hiltons I've ever stayed at. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great stay-great resort”
Reviews.Author: JS2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the resort for 2 nights as a mini getaway while visiting family in the area. Other than my check in expierience, it was fantastic. Let me explain, I'm a Hilton Honors member so I always stay at Hilton properties. My flight in was delayed and I knew I would be checking in late so I called the hotel to verify that a king bed room would still be available for me. They assured me it would. When i arrived i was unapologetically told by the front desk clerk "2 beds is all that is available". I explained that I called, Honors memeber, etc. Nothing. I even asked if I could pay for an upgrade. No response. Finally, I was just given a room key and bellman and was told they would take me to my room- didn't know what to expect or what I was getting. Fortunately, I was upgraded to a 2 bed "villa" at ground level so I was satisfied, but a little customer service and explanation would've gone a long way. All of the other staff"s service was great. It's a beautiful property and you can tell it has been updated. Pool area is great, only complaint is that you can only get drink service by the pool during season. This is a resort that is not close to much at all, plan on staying on the grounds or have transportation! I did find it a bit pricey overall, food especially, but that is to be expected at a property like this. The spa area is fantastic, I highly recommend getting a service there. Overall, it was everything I wanted it to be!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and great location.”
Reviews.Author: PA97
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a couple days at this hotel and left very happy. It started off wonderfully as we were greeted when we pulled up to the hotel by the manager Matt and he walked us into the lobby to be checked in. Check in was quick and easy (aside from the 32 parking charge which many people have already mentioned here). The entire staff was really friendly and helpful with any questions or suggestions we asked from them. William recommended a great restaurant in Bachi's just a short drive away. The hotel itself is a little older so it isn't as prestine as some of the newer hotels, but I didn't see anything that would make me cautious about returning. No wifi in the rooms was a little disappointing though. All in all the staff was fantastic and the location was perfect. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars was the parking fee and the upkeep of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Hooray for Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Kirsten H
Reviews.Content: My son and I traveled to this beautiful area last week and we were looking forward to a terrific experience and we got one. We were so impressed with the amenities and surrounding grounds of this property. When we arrived we were greeted by exceptional staff who were so helpful and friendly! Our room and bath was spacious and very clean, and the beds were so comfortable. The room was quiet and private and we had beautiful views. Eating fantastic meals at this hotel was a pleasure! The hostess remembered our names every morning which created a lovely feeling for us and the waitstaff served us with a warm smile. The front desk and management were always extremely professional and answered all of our questions and were so eager to help us make awesome memories in this wonderful location. We can't wait to return to Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa again!!

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: James P
Reviews.Content: Our overall experience was a good one but with a few too many hick-ups for what I would expect. First, when we checked in and got to our room we found our bathroom was still dirty. When I tried calling the front desk to inform them I kept getting an answer machine (I attempted to call at other times during our stay with the same problem). The good news was the upgrade price; for $50 dollars more we were moved to a room right on the water, this made my wife very happy. The down side to that was the area leading to our room was kind of dark and looked more like an ally way than a resort and spa. Most of the guest service was wonderful. We ordered a late dinner and had it brought to the room and the next morning went to the restaurant for breakfast. The prices were a little high but that was to be expected. One downside is that my wife and I were forgotten at breakfast. People that came in after us were served before us and a separate waitress than the one assigned for us ended up taking care of us, this was frustrating but she was pleasant and redeemed the morning. One thing I did witness was a waiter drop some packets of jelly coming from the kitchen to set up tables and just throw them back in the basket to eventually end on someone's plate next to their food. I'm pretty sure that's a health code violation. The hotel was good but I'd give it 3 stars. I've had a better time at some 3 star restaurants that's to include staff, food quality, and of course prices.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good 'Hilton' value at all”
Reviews.Author: Michael H
Reviews.Content: Wow! Nice location setting, the main staff including the valet/bus speak clear English, maid service is great and what a beautiful room (773)in the tower with 'bay view'. We came here for vacation and had great weather. That is the end (unfortunately) of the positives, and I'm a very well traveled 'older' professional and stay at many places. So here now for 4 days, I clearly see I spent too much money on a 5 day/night vacation stay considering what I'm experiencing for that money. Never mind $32.day for parking. The rooms are over priced...period. The add-ons, should you want some are priced beyond belief. Example: I thought the room had a microwave. When I learned at check in that the rooms don't include one, they offered to send one up to the room AT $30 PER DAY. Walmart up the road sells them for $38. Do you need to use a few "business services" like internet, printing, scanning a document or use of a small room? FORGET it. They'll tell you they have rooms specifically to do your work in, right before they admit "but they don't have any furniture in them". Though they boost a confernce center, they have NOTHING to support it except for a few big rooms and many chairs. So I asked the front desk (you HAVE to go there if you need to ask them something...they DON'T answer their phone but 1 out of 8 times so far). Their wireless system is ONE router for the whole complex so you have to find a place to sit close to the center of the resort. I frequently see people gathered in and outside the lobby with their laptops. Our room is on the 7th floor directly across from the main entrance and the signal strength is 10-20% when I am able to connect at all. There is only ONE restaurant which is way, way, overpriced with adjacent bar that has a separate menu. Since this was our family vacation away from Boston, we did Sea World. The gift shop here said they discounted tickets. Oh they do...normally the tickets are $73. they discount them $1, so we spent $72 per. There was a lot of walking that day, so we'd thought we'd relax and splash around after a late dinner and activities. Wrong!... the pool area closes at 10 so we couldn't unwind in the hot tub or float around in the pool like you can at most other resorts/hotels of much lesser class. There are no rooms really close to the pool, so I don't know why they close it so early. I just don't get it. This place could, but just does NOT live up to the Hilton brand at all.

Reviews.Title: “A dated property with charm”
Reviews.Author: Boywhocouldfly21
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this property and had mixed feelings. The staff was very helpful and I was upgraded (because of my HHonors diamond status) to a pretty nice room. The resort was pretty cheap because itâ€™s the off season but they really get you on the parking. $32 a night for Self-Park. Iâ€™ve paid that much for valet parking in NYC. The buildings are older and the rooms are reasonably updated. The pool area is actually quite nice and the bar was very trendy and quaint. The restaurant was just your average hotel restaurant, nothing fancy. It should have been a bit nicer for a resort of this (alleged) caliber.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Carl M
Reviews.Content: What a nice surprise. I made this reservation based solely on mapping services trying to get a Hilton close to the airport. What a beautiful location. Though I was on a quick business trip, I wish I could have stayed longer. Trip back to the rental car providers was quick. Had the breakfast buffet at the onsite restaurant. Very good low carb and protein options. I was also literally within 2-3 miles of my business appointment

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Sea World”
Reviews.Author: lorihas2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really well maintained there was always a gardener or staff buzzing about. When we arrived the front desk offered us the chance to upgrade our room to a bayfront room...duh yeah! The room #225 was very nicely appointed comfy bedding and a great view of the bay...we could walk right out on to a walking path or enjoy the patio lounge bed. The rooms next to ours offered fire pits...very nice touch! The only major issue was parking! The parking area for our set of rooms was maybe 8 spots with 2 handycapped in a cal-de-sac, my husband would drop us off then search for a spot... every time we used the car....and for this we paid a hefty $32.00 per day for self parking! Minor downfall the ice machine near the room wasn't in order,walls were pretty thin (I hear the neighbor getting sick all night) and if you want to sleep in choose a room that is not next to the walking path...early morning joggers....oh and Sea World is 2 minutes away...please don't be discouraged by the negatives the hotel is very nice, I just wanted you to be informed.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel with the location being both a positive and negative”
Reviews.Author: tpinet
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time in San Diego and staying at this resort. We would catch happy-hour and take our drinks down to the pool and sit with our feet in while looking out at the beach and the gas-fire pit beside us, surrounded by well kept gardens and palms. The pool area is really well kept and they have a towel service right on the pool deck and lots of chairs. This hotel would have been perfect but it was soooo far from everything. The only thing in walkable distance was SeaWorld and that took 1 hour one way. Expect at least a $10 cab to get to the closest point (probably Old Town) then you can metro from there. I am complaining about the location but at the same time you are in an nice park area in Mission Bay completely secluded and right on the bay beach. The meals at the restaurant were great, both breakfast and dinner, but a little on the expensive side. We did find that they had a great Butternut Squash and lobster soup :D

Reviews.Title: “A great get-a-way!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: As a professional conference planner, I've stayed at many properties over the years for business, but rarely travel for pleasure. When friends approached us about a weekend in San Diego, I knew exactly where we should stay! I had site toured the Hilton last year for a large conference and knew our attendees were going to love it. What better way to know for sure than to stay there myself as a guest, with no business to worry about! We arrived a little early and our room on the bay was ready for us. Great view with a covered patio leading right out to the beach. The bathroom was huge and had all the amenities. We had a rental car and drove to Old Town for dinner and came back for drinks at the Olive Lounge. The berry martini was amazing! The next morning we ordered room service, which was great and then headed to Spa Brezza for Swedish massages. It was beautiful inside, again with all the amenities. And the massages were wonderful! Our friends chose to work out in the fitness center. While I'm sure they enjoyed using all the equipment, I'm happy we went for relaxation instead! Not living near the ocean, it was nice to stay right on the bay. I would take that over staying inland any day. If you do your homework and plan ahead, getting around is not a problem, and we never drove more than 10 mins to get anywhere and there is amble parking throughout the city (we paid $3 to park while we walked around Old Town). Parking at a resort anywhere in a large city is pricey, but we enjoyed our stay immensely and would recommend it to anyone wanting to enjoy San Diego. I'm glad I was able to experience the hotel as a guest and am even more excited to bring my conference attendees to this beautiful property!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but could be better”
Reviews.Author: postrawb
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and restaurant however; the service is poor. An example is they have no pool service but a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: alana_terrizzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. What a wonderful way to celebrate my birthday. We stayed in a studio suite with a waterfront view. The room was absolutely spectacular. The front desk was phenomenal. And the service was amazing. Could not have asked for a better hotel room :)

Reviews.Title: “Not for business or personal”
Reviews.Author: jennir70
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton for two nights during a busness trip (not a conference). The hotel looks big and beutiful with the pool and spa and haveing a nice trail around the bay but there are too many cons that i would not stay here again. Pros: nice looking at the bay but in the middle of no where, nothing nearby that you can walk to. pool and outdoor firepits look nice, they were not on when i went Staff was friendly Room was clean mini fridge in the room for keeping a few drinks cold nice patio off of bedroom Cons: parking is $32/night for self park, no valet Restaurant is kinda off to the side and very very expensive. not many TV channels No WiFi in room, there was a cord stuck to the desk that was dark and had a chair too small for the desk, uncomfortable plus $15/night. bathroom ventilation was poor, i had to constantly wipe the mirror of steam, there was no remote control, the clock was broken and when they fixed it they set it to PM so the morning alarm did not go off correctly. i went to the 'cafe' to get coffee and i bite to eat and all three time it was closed.

Reviews.Title: “RENOVATION, RENOVATION, RENOVATION”
Reviews.Author: enofile1
Reviews.Content: While the adage in real estate is location location location, it seems during this exhausting recession, hotels need to adopt the adage renovate renovate renovate. This Hilton Resort has a wonderful location and the lobby, dining, and reception rooms are beautifully done in that Southern Californian Mission style that is utterly charming. However, our room had that 1970s modern look that is pretty cool when fresh, new, and clean, but depressing when dark, musty, and damaged by the ravages of time. It was begging for a renovation.On the positive side, the room was large and the bathroom ample. Sleep came early and lasted long due to the good beds. The resort had a fairly nice gym, but the weight machines were not the best and were surprisingly cheap for this kind of resort. The locker room was sumptuous compared to the workout room. I also received the "California lassez faire" approach by the staff at the "Spa." As I approached the front desk, the staff person was on the phone engaged in a personal conversation and when I tried to ask her where the gym was located, she continued to talk and simply waved me to the left. I guess I'm "old school," and expect better service. I will say, the person who took our bags up to our original room, we switched rooms searching for better, was engaging and absolutely helpful. The San Diego Hilton Resort & Spa could provide a memorable holiday experience with an influx of money to foster what the hotel needs to meet current standards. Let's hope this recession ends soon and the rooms can get that renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to rate it higher, but just couldn't...”
Reviews.Author: bchgrrrl
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of the property. Located on Mission Bay, the ocean front property offers a nice pool, ocean access, a great beach path to walk the bay, nice grounds and conveniently located to a large number of San Diego's tourist attractions. I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights for a conference. The conference facilities were fine, but the the nice decor, linens and artwork in the rooms couldn't disguise how old the building is. It showed its age by having ill fitted doors(closet door wouldn't stay closed), few and poorly located outlets, and other inconveniences that newer properties don't have to worry about. Several(if not all, not sure) of the accommodations buildings are only stairs and accessed from the outside. Makes it challenging when you have a lot of luggage or event related items to pack in and out. The food in the cafe was really good, and overall service seemed fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, great pool area, and nice but pricey resturants”
Reviews.Author: kctravellers3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we stayed in the bay front villas, they are very nice, had a bit of a musty smell but I think it was an overall smell of the area not particularly the room. The area is nice, but not really within walking distance to anything...so make sure you have a rental car. There is a great park nearby and the hotel sits on a very wide running/biking/walking path that winds around by the bay. This is nice, but it is very busy, with people using it almost all hours of day and night. To get to the pool, you had to walk on the walkway and us a key card to get into the hotel pool area. The pool had a nice attentive staff, but it can take forever (10 minutes plus) to get your drinks when it's busy....as well the prices are a bit high for drinks and the restaurant is also a bit pricey. All in all, we'd probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Seaworld”
Reviews.Author: Luckster777
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and got a great rate. We were told about the $32/day parking rate when we called to request a specific type of room. For some reason we were not charged for the parking when we checked out which was a great surprise. The hotel is right off the I5 on Mission Bay, and is literally 5 minutes from Sea World. There is a free shuttle to Sea World that the hotel offers and we took advantage of it to save on the $17 parking fee at Sea World. The room was a nice size and included a fridge and a large flat screen tv, however the tv signal is still not High Def. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The pool area is great, and the pool is heated. The only complaint I have is there was no wifi in the room, there was an Ethernet cable for internet but it was useless with an ipad. There is free wifi in the lobby, pool and conference area and the connection speed was good. The staffs were friendly and accommodating. I would recommend this hotel for families looking to be near Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: mbear78
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in San Diego and we booked this place directly through Hilton on a December "sale" rate. Pros: Beautiful location right on Mission Bay Pool and grounds are well maintained Central to many attractions (minutes from Seaworld) Staff was friendly Room was clean There was a 'mini fridge' in the room for keeping a few drinks cold There is an in-room small safe Cons: PARKING!... OMG $32/night!... no joke (for that rate there should be valet parking in a locked area...which there is not...it is simply self-parking in an unlocked area....) Only one (nice but expensive) restaurant on site and no other options within walking distance. Older resort is showing its age. Very limited TV channels No WiFi in room. WiFi was available in the lobby only. Overall, our experience here was good. Kids liked the pool and hot tub. The hidden parking fee is a big detractor. $32/night is ridiculous and they can charge this because there are no other options nearby. Mission Bay Park has lots of parking, but there is a 'no parking' bylaw from 2am - 4am preventing anyone from over-nighting there. The fact that there is no WiFi available in the rooms kind of sucks too... It is 2012 afterall. It was "off season", so the grounds were very quiet, which was nice, and the staff was very good. We really only needed a place to lay our heads, so next time we come to San Diego, I am not sure that we would return to this place, especially if they don't correct the cost of the parking. That being said, it was a nice place to relax after a busy day at the surrounding attractions.

Reviews.Title: “PROFESSIONAL SERVICE ULTIMATE CLASS”
Reviews.Author: R P
Reviews.Content: Setting up for our annual meeting was so easy with the help of Maribel and the staff. The hotel accommodated our specific needs and was on top of everything. Great staff on hand and wonderful to work with.

Reviews.Title: “This place is GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: eap123
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this resort to anyone, especially couples and families. My spouse and I spent two nights at this resort. It completely met our expectations. We choose a bay view room in the tower building overlooking the bay and pool area. Although the room itself was a bit on the smaller side it was nice and perfect for the two of us. The room was very clean, had a private balcony, fridge, nice bathroom and tasty in room coffee. The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The pool area was gorgeous with private poolside cabanas. We had a perfect stay and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “â€œPatheticâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Busytraveler067
Reviews.Content: I wrote a scathing review about a horrible experience at this poorly run, dirty, "bait and switch" hotel. When I went to check out the review, it disappeared. Wow. There was a reply by a hotel executive that white washed my complaint. I checked in, via Sniqueaway, had paid the two night stay up front, and checked out 15 minutes later after seeing the room that was offered. Lost my money, but it was worth more NOT to stay than to stay. I was not given the room I was promised. A true bait and switch scam. I am not so sure that the employees of this hotel are writing all of the superlative reviews. Either that or this hotel is attracting people who need to get out more.

Reviews.Title: “This is a remodel??? The original version was better.”
Reviews.Author: D J
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with most, if not all of the negative reviews. In contradiction to a previous hotel response, the hallway doors have NOT been fixed. They still remain ajar, they do not self-close/securely lock. What good is a door if it doesn't do its job? This is a serious safety issue for all guests. The halls and rooms are dimly lit and the paint is old/chipped. The wallpaper is peeling and the bathroom tiles don't match. The shower rod was not securely fastened to the wall and the curtain itself was missing hooks. The rooms are musty and I saw water damage on the ceiling - it was bubbled. Because of the smell and the water damage, I was worried about mold. I don't know if that is in fact the case, but it still made me uneasy so I called for a bottle of Febreze to keep in my room. The fact that this place seemed unclean, I felt like I should buy a UV black light and brought Lysol wipes. I made sure not to walk barefoot on the carpet and was leary to lay on the comforter. Housekeeping is only allowed to give one bottle of shampoo, etc. (which doesn't smell so good), unless otherwise specifically requested by a guest for more. This used to be a Hilton Hotel but it sold in 2005 to LaSalle Hotel Properties. Therefore, this is NOT Hilton Standard. This is NOT a Hilton Hotel. Google it.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve fun”
Reviews.Author: Drew N
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I wanted to get away for a little staycation and play and didnt really want to do the whole crazy downtown experience durring new years eve, so we picked this hotel as it was right on the bay and still in the middle of San Diego. Overall I have to say it was a great expereince. The hotel is beautiful, while you can see its a little on the older side, I think it give it a certain charm. Checked in with the staff that were very friendly and accomidating, and booked a room in one of the villas, they kind of have a Hawaii feel. I do have to give a special thanks to the concierge Whitney, she was very helpfull at finding a great spot for us for dinner during a busy weekend. When we got back we decided to hang around the property for the night, and were pleasently suprised to see the restaurant was doing something for NYE. They had a very nice set up, we stayed for drinks and music and really enjoyed the atmosphere. We even spoke with the restaurant GM who was extreamly gracious, you could tell that he was enjoying his time as much as we were. All and all a great time and spot, as a local I will deffinatly be back with my girlfriend when we want a little get away time...

Reviews.Title: “Have the best relaxing time of your life along with extra special staff”
Reviews.Author: jasonsueart
Reviews.Content: For the past twenty fives years we have been coming to the Hilton in Mission Bay and loving everything about it. We began our vacation by checking in with Ramon, who has always been extremely helpful and professional. He welcomes us as if we were in his own family. He is awesome!! It is a pleasure to see all of the wonderful front desk staff, and the bellman who always have a great story or two to share. We had dinner at the Aqua restaurant, and were thrilled with the service and the prefix dinner we ordered. Don't miss the Butternut Squash Soup (the best I ever had). Also, don't forget the water sports that Wolf has to offer. He is located directly across from the restaurant on the bay waterfront. Wolf not only was patient but gave us a few pointers on the kayak journey we took across the bay. This is a beautiful resort. Don't miss it. The Rosen's.

Reviews.Title: “This place is awesome”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the sailing and stand up paddle boarding on the bay. Ryan helped us with all of our boating rental needs. He was great with site seeing suggestions as well. Breakfast coupons were great for the buffet. Terry from the Bronx was our server the first day and we became regulars. He was so great with the kids and caring with our family. He is the best. I was shocked that even the housekeeping staff was friendly. I believe it was Amanda and loberto that greeted us every morning and made sure we had everything we needed. The whole staff was friendly and attentive. The location was perfect. Close to Sea World but on its own stretch of Mission Bay. William at the front desk sent us off with well wishes at check out and invited us back. We will definitely take him up on his invitation. We are planning to make this an annual event. The villa room we were in was large, had a huge flat screen, microwave and fridge. It was spotless and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “This is San Diego's Best”
Reviews.Author: natalie c
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this wonderful hotel last year and knew that this is where I would return when visiting again. We have been inviting to a wedding in the Spring and look forward to enjoying another stay. I mentioned this to friends that are attending and they had previously heard about how nice it is and have booked the hotel as well, even though it is not terribly close to the wedding venue. This is a beautiful and comfortable hotel with all of the amenities one could ask for. The spa is lovely and professionally appointed. The guest rooms are spacious and clean and there is nothing additional that was necessary to request. The entire staff from Management level to ancilliary staff was very welcoming and always available to us. The hotel is also very conveniently located to shopping restaurants and Sea World. I highly recommend The Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa to anyone that is visiting the area.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Resort”
Reviews.Author: jmr_12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for a few nights and had a wonderful overall experience. The rooms, the pool area, the fitness center, the dining and the staff were phenomenal. The front desk was able to upgrade us to a room with a view. The property is in a lovely location next to SeaWorld, great for morning walks along the boardwalk of mission bay. We cannot wait to come back and hopefully stay for a longer period of time.

Reviews.Title: “Room Quality was "Gross"”
Reviews.Author: MomEof2
Reviews.Content: My wife , 12month old, and I checked into our "villa" bay view room on 12/30 for some relaxation and change of pace. We've stayed here before for a wedding, circa 2009 and we loved it. So, when we saw the awesome deal on Expedia we jumped. Well, here is our story: We checked in around 4:30pm, I was tired from driving 3hrs, so I settled in for a quick 30 min. cat nap. Fast forward 1 hr. and I wake up to my arm being literally "glued" to the comforter and the duvet style blanket. I was disgusted, my wife jetted down the hall to get ice as a means to get the gum off my fairly expensive shirt. Fifteen minutes past, and the final outcome was a RL shirt with remnants of pink bubble gum still stuck on the shoulder. My wife called the front desk, then was transferred to housekeeping. I spoke to housekeeping, and they said they would send someone up. Thirty minutes go by, nothing. Forty minutes... and then I called to remind them to pick up the items. A gentlemen finally did come, and he said he will redeliver the items with fresh ones. I understand things happen, so I tried to cut some slack to the housekeeping "oversight". The family went out to dinner, we returned at 9:45pm still nothing.I called and they said it was still be cleaned, what? no extras at a 300+ room hotel. My wife said she wasn't that cold, so we gave up and went to sleep with just the sheets. In the morning I spoke to the guy at the front desk, and all he said was "sorry about that". It was disingenuous at best. Pros: The pool was beautiful and it had a 1 ft pool for the kids The bay view was super nice. No charge for cabanas usage. Beautiful grounds Running and biking area within 100 feet of bay rooms Cons: Gross housekeeping in our room (hopefully an isolated event) Peeling wallpaper in the bathroom $30 for parking Lackadaisical staff

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your $”
Reviews.Author: DoBetterPls
Reviews.Content: Staff clueless. Beds small (queens? Don't think so). Near nothing. Beach just a jetty really. Rooms older, missing things. Room service failed us more than once. Not a 4-star experience whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “World's worst?”
Reviews.Author: Dan H
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot and this is by far the worst hotel I have had the misfortune to come across. I reserved what was advertised as a "Tower View King," with a picture of this great room looking out over the bay. When I checked in, I was taken to a dark little room with a view of a grassy area, looking at another wing of the hotel. When I complained, I was given the very same type of room and view from the second floor. The patio was filthy and the view of the grassy area was pathetic.IT WAS THE OLD "BAIT AND SWITCH" program. In addition, they want $28 a night to park in a motel type parking lot. What a rip! I check out 30 minutes after checking in. The staff? A bunch of kids who don't have a clue about customer relations. Stay away from this one.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: arnofio
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in January 2011 and had originally booked the Hotel Solamar in San Diego and due to snow delaying our departure from New York we were offered the Hilton resort as an alternative. Given the choice I would have stuck with Solamar because the Hilton is about 15 minutes drive from central San Diego and the Hilton is looking and feeling a little run-down. Having considered that the location is beautiful and I can imagine a family holiday in the warm California sun being very enjoyable there. I highly recommend a GPS navigation device to help find the resort and to keep you moving through some of the less appealing neighbourhoods on the way to the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly”
Reviews.Author: TFSmith1970
Reviews.Content: GOOD: 1. Staff helpful, courteous and friendly. I had a very positive encounter in every instance (except one in the "ugly" section). 2. Especially great was Fernando in the Acqua Restaurant. I ate there four evenings. He was exceptional in his service, friendliness and knowledge of the wines and menu (and sorely missed the last evening). Food was excellent, but I think a little overpriced. E.g. dinner for one with a glass of wine was b/w $60-75. 3. I had a nice room - ground floor, bay view which was great for the mornings, and watching sunsets. Since I am a Hilton Honors Gold Elite, I got a free upgraded room, free continental breakfasts, and free internet. That was a great value on this property, and it's why, in part, I have brand loyalty to Hilton properties. Bed was super comfortable. 4. I had two chaise lounges outside my sliding doors that were very comfortable and perfect for enjoying the sunshine and watching people walking/running/enjoying the bay. 5. The property was quiet, restful and well-designed. It was nearly empty when I was there, so if it is packed at other times of the year, maybe the serenity would be lost. 6. Great looking pool area (although cool weather made it unusable for me, not their fault obviously), but in different conditions, I would have used it much more (there are jacuzzis, a larger pool, table tennis, etc. 7. You can rent a bike and other water sport equipment right at the resort. I did that twice, and took a ride over to Fiesta Island or along Mission Bay. Very nice. 8. Room was clean and cleaned well each day. Again, I want to emphasize the staff were all first rate, professional and courteous. BAD: 1. No wireless in rooms (a hotel of this scale should have wireless in the rooms, being tethered to an 8 inch ethernet cord on the "desk" was a real hassle). 2. No business style desk. Very small surface space with an uncomfortable chair. They would do well to cater a little more to business travelers (wireless, a decent desk and comfortable desk chair would go a long way). A couple of other minus: 3. The door entering my building would never lock closed, so anyone could walk off the beach and into the building without a key card, didn't leave me feeling very secure. 4. Overnight parking for guests is $28 per night (pretty ridiculous for a location that isn't downtown), it effectively doubles your rental car costs. 5. Ducks were in the pool most of the time I was there (pretty gross), pool area unstaffed. 6. There is a Marketplace onsite for snacks, but be prepared to pay a lot, i.e. $2.50 for a Dr. Pepper, $9.00 for a bag of chips and a Naked Juice, $15 for a small bundle of wood for my fire pit. 7. Other charges to be aware of, wired internet access is $11.95 per day (unless it is comped b/c of your Hilton Honors status). That, plus paying for overnight parking adds $40 a night to your price, good to keep in mind if you are following a budget. BTW, $11.95 is per device. UGLY: My one negative experience with a staff decision was when I took the complimentary shuttle to SeaWorld when I had a free morning. It is advertised as leaving every morning at 10. I scheduled my short time at SeaWorld and the shows as exact as I could to maximize my time, knowing we were 5 minutes from SeaWorld. Once we were on the shuttle, the driver announced he was going to take someone to the airport and we would "get a tour of San Diego" So, once underway, instead of turning right for a 3 minute drive to the Sea World entrance (again, very close to the hotel), the driver decided to turn left and drove me and two other guests who also got on the shuttle to go to SeaWorld, all the way to the San Diego airport to drop off a fourth passenger who wasn't in any particular hurry to get to the airport. Instead of a 5 minute drive to SeaWorld we took a 35 minute drive to SD airport, missing the first morning show at the park. Very disrespectful of the three passengers going to Sea World and unnecessary, by the admission of the fourth passenger who was going to the airport, and hadn't requested a rush. OVERALL: If you have a family, its a nice central location to SeaWorld, LegoLand, Zoo, etc. and located on the beach. Potentially romantic location for a couple, esp. if you get a bayside with the two chaise lounges and fire pit. The rooms/overall space isn't really designed for business people, but could provide a wonderful respite for them, if the room design and amenities would cater more to business clients vs. just vacationing guests.

Reviews.Title: “My Third Visit to the Hilton Resort & Spa on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: Ed G
Reviews.Content: I had a fun and relaxing stay this week, my third visit! Special thanks to TC and Ramone for helping me find Shamu for my three-year-old :-) .

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Peaceful, Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: FreddyTX
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 6 days over the Thanksgiving week, and we both thoroughly enjoyed the peace, quiet and beautiful sunshine of the great Hilton resort. The rooms are designed nice and modern, in a truly San Diego-style. We were moved twice from the villa buildings (not the tower) because of overall maintenance being done (yes, resorts and hotels actually have to maintain their rooms, you know like painting, deep rug cleaning, bathtub refinishing). Our rooms were peaceful and in great locations looking out onto the bay. There is the wonderful and sunny park located next to the resort on both sides of the property. Perfect for walking or jogging. Plus it's relaxing to just watch the kayakers, rowers, and boarders. The property was beautifully maintained- pool area (beautiful with the clean and updated cabanas), and hot, clean hot tubs. Everything was just great. The staff (all of them, front desk, restaurant folks, front desk manager, maintenance people) were extremely nice, helpful and professional. We dined twice in the beautiful California-style restaurant. Just great!! The patio dining was perfect, beautiful weather, etc. We did not want to leave! Yes this is a resort, and yes resorts are typically more expensive than regular hotels. There is a spa onsite with beauty and massage services, and there is rental for bicycles and other fun stuff. Parking is expensive but yes that keeps out people who can't afford things like this. That's why it is a resort.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown”
Reviews.Author: YanksFanJen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights from 11/14 - 11/16 for a conference for work. The check in staff was average- not overwhelming friendly or looking to go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. My room was a short walk from the lobby area. The hallway in my building was musty smelling and just felt old and damp. My room was just ok. It was on the ground level facing the parking lot and several others in my group noted that they almost didn't feel safe. There was no overhead lighting in the room, which was not convenient. There were 3 lamps, but it never felt bright. The bed was fine. Too many flat pillows. A few more fluffy ones would have sufficed. There was a hair in my sink in the bathroom when I checked in. I did not report it to the staff because I barely had time to change and get to my meeting on time. The breakfast and lunch were average. Nothing to rave about. We ate offsite both nights. The meeting room was large and able to fit our group comfortably. There was some sort of convention going on at the hotel while we were there. I did not get to use any of the facilities. The internet charge for the room was $12 and it was not wireless. I would say the plus is that it is very close to the airport and Sea World. For a Hilton property, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “An okay resort”
Reviews.Author: samara33
Reviews.Content: This resort was okay. $8.00 for 10 minutes to use intranet is a bit cheeky. Rooms were spacious but a bit dated. Our room was located a fair distance from the reception and we werent offered any assistance with our bags. The staff seemed disinterested and unfriendly which is surprising compared to other hotels we have stayed at in the US. The pool area was great and the food in the restauant albeit expensive was very nice (you didnt really have any other choice as hotel not located in walking distance of other restaurants).

Reviews.Title: “5 star property complimented by 5 star service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Ray M
Reviews.Content: Great property, service and location. Right off the 5 easy to reach downtown, old town, Zoo ect On site restaurant is very good. Nice gift shop, knowledgeable staff, look for Patricia for great insight for things to do around to town

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice looking aged in places, expensive parking, slow internet, no HBO”
Reviews.Author: BritGuyUSA
Reviews.Content: Hotel consists of a tower and some condo style rooms. Stopping in building 500 we have a top floor condo room. Room itself is very nice, fridge, microwave, large flatscreen tv, balcony with garden view. Seems strange, but no HBO - i guess they want you to spend the $16 on a movie instead. The walls in the hallway could do with a touch of paint in places and the tiled floor areas at both ends of the building were dirty. There is no buffet for breakfast and the coupons are good or a continental breakfast which is very limited in what you can get. Otherwise prices seem to be standard. Hotel grounds are very nice as is the pool area. It is heated, but all that really means is that it is not cold, so its too cold to be using this time of year. Happy hour at the olive is great, cheep drinks and food too. The pizza we had last night was good and was much larger than expected for the $10. Parking: i dont know why they are charging people so much for parking... Its not like people are going to come here witout a car - just seems like a hidden fee. This s why they get a low rating in value for money. Overall, nice place and would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING in every way!”
Reviews.Author: AuOphir
Reviews.Content: We went down to San Diego to see the Packers vs. Chargers game, and had such a wonderful weekend! The staff at this hotel are completely amazing; the room service was stellar and the cuisine in the restaurant was beyond compare. It would be impossible to find enough superlatives to describe the quality of our stay. Chef Jimmy and his staff provided the most wonderful dinner (pumpkin ravioli, a creme brulee trio) the night before the game! After the game, we treated ourselves to room service, and enjoyed far too much food (pizza margherita, a chicken sandwich, bruschetta, etc.) served with excellent care. I cannot give a high enough recommendation for this hotel; needless to say, I will be back many times, if this is any indication of how guests are treated at this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Trip RUINED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A
Reviews.Content: We will never stay at this location again. This trip was for our wedding anniversary and recovering from extensive cancer therapy. Fire alarm went off at night and it was laughed off as a prank. No emergency services were dispatched when there was smoke coming in through our bathroom vent. The restaurant on site had no menu posted. The food was horrible and over priced. The concierge was not supportive in our inquiries to certain attractions. He acted as if were interrupting "his day!" The front desk help were nice but when we mentioned our displeasure or concern - no- solutions were given. The young lady in the coffee shop very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: JAMES B
Reviews.Content: There is more to a hotel than just a clean room. It starts at the front desk for me. The second I entered the lobby, William and TC made us feel welcome. This goes a long way for me. I wish more hotels that I stay at have more front people like these two. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome housekeeping staff”
Reviews.Author: 853jlb123
Reviews.Content: Can't really go wrong with a Hilton. I was on a business trip in and out in three days. I usually don't write reviews but I just had to in this case. The staff was very friendly and accommodating; however, Rosario in Housekeeping was fabulous - so friendly, polite and you can just tell "first class service runs in her blood."

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience overall”
Reviews.Author: kevatotts
Reviews.Content: TC and William front desk agents very helpful and professional. Give them a raise. Room attendants were very acommodating as well. Restaurant service was just ok. Food was excellent but very limited menu. Loved our room 503 with great view of mission bay and Sea World. I will recommend this hotel to family and friends. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: Colleen C
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel way too expensive. The dining room cost us $45 for breakfast and $100 for dinner for just two of us. The parking fee was hard to swallow and I've never stayed at a hotel where there was not a computer for guests to use. When we tried to get our discount tickets for the zoo, no one at the front counter could help us, and we didn't want to pay to go online and try to find it ourselves. Finally Patricia from the giftshop (bless her) found the passes on HER computer and allowed us to purchase and print them. Is it Hilton policy to charge for internet use? If so, we will steer clear of Hiltons.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Parking for $28/day!!”
Reviews.Author: Andy H
Reviews.Content: I want to try and talk about the positives. The room was fantastic. It was nice size, it had a fridge and microwave. Having a fire pit on our patio was great and when you were out on the patio you had a good view of the beach. Jeff the bell man was very helpful and provided some great tips on getting around. The property is very nice, especially the pool area. We went there one evening and had it all to ourselves. The fire pit was on and it was nice to sit by after spending time in the pool and hot tub. There is also a secluded adult hot tub area, separate from the main pool area. Our room was always clean when returning from a day of activities. I am just appalled that this property was charging $28/day to park your vehicle. Maybe I didn't read it in other reviews, but this would have changed our decision to stay here. So if you're driving to this property just be aware. I would recommend possibly parking on Mission Bay Dr, but there is no parking from 2AM-4AM. There is a nice gift shop and coffee shop on property and the concierge was very helpful on finding a location to watch the Pacquio-Marquez fight. If parking wasn't such a joke I would give this 4 stars if not 5.

Reviews.Title: “This is a run down "resort" and should not be a Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Longmeadow15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on points (120,000+ for two nights) and not do that again. A waste of points as other Hiltons in the area are less expensive. The room was dated and had an odor and this was a higher priced bay view deluxe. Thd patio screen door was falling off and thd patio curtains were falling off. There was trash and left over room service in the hall for days. I had to call at 4 because my room was not maid up. The pool area was unmanned and no where to get a drink or lunch at the "resort" pool. The chaises were mostly broken and pool towels were never available. I've stayed at both downtown Hiltons and they are much better quality and service. I left here and went to the Hotel Del Coronado. Now that's a resort. I wish I knew better as you do now do I didn't waste my valuable points!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Moore1818
Reviews.Content: We originally booked two queens (only room available upon booking) with the hopes of getting a king upon arrival. The staff was awesome, offering us a suite upgrade! Thanks T.C.! You were the cherry on top of our romantic weekend! Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fred A
Reviews.Content: Had a GREAT experience at this Hilton! It started with the help of William and T.C. from the time we checked in. Also had great customer service from the entire staff, as well as Wolfe in the boat rental area. Next trip to San Diego is a must to book here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Setting”
Reviews.Author: RLMartin
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to this hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed both of them. The check-in person was very nice and helpful and got me a nice room looking out on the water. Both visits I stayed in this same building. I thought my first room was nice, but looking out on the water made it even better. The downside of the location is there's no restaurants any where close. You are kind of captive without taking a cab. The hotel grounds are bordered on both sides by a very large park. The pool area is very nice, though I didn't use it. The outlet on the work area did not work when I checked-in, but they sent a person right out and he worked until he fixed it. The restaurant is a little pricy. There is a market near the lobby to get some munchies. I was here on business and we had a couple receptions out by the pool which was nice. The staff seemed very helpful in all respects. I would certainly consider recommending this place for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms, a great restaurant and spa all in one!”
Reviews.Author: TnEShlaes
Reviews.Content: This resort location is great for couple and families. A huge pool area and near the bay. A great trail to walk or skate on and it is next to a large park. The restaurant has great food and the services is impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent first impression...”
Reviews.Author: Dr P
Reviews.Content: Recently went on a work trip to San Diego and had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa. I had the good fortune of working with William, T.C., and Paige at the front desk. I have nothing but positive things to say about this team! These three individuals represented their company very well as they were very efficient, and professional. Among the other luxuries in this hotel, their staff made my first stay a extremely pleasant one. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: KiminDen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights (using points) with my daughter on a college trip. Beach location is great and the pool is beautiful. Unfortunately, we had bad weather, so didn't get to enjoy much of either.... Room was nice, just smelled strongly of cleaning products. Breakfast was good. I would definitely consider this hotel again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Getawayguy20
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here twice with our younger girls. First time was about 4 years ago. The room we were given was looking a little 'tired' and in need of some updating, but the pool area and common areas were excellent. The fire pit by the pool was a great touch (this whole area has been renovated since our last visit). Getting to other areas like Old Town, Mission Beach and La Jolla was super quick and easily. You need a car though to get to any of them. We found the service adequate but not overly friendly, which was surprising for the price we paid, plus the fact that it's a resort where you'd expect people to spend more time there compared to a regular hotel. Overall, a very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, however mixed review..”
Reviews.Author: mandjw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a nice room overlooking the beautiful green grass the the bay. On a positive note, it was just a one minute stroll to the beautiful bay and the rooms were nice and comfortable. However, only got one tea bag. When I called for more milk and sugar, they took 45 minutes to deliver some more. Note - they will charge you for everything here - $28 to park your car yourself per night (not even valet parking!!) and the food is waaay overpriced for what it was. Also, the business centre is expensive to use.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ME_from_IIT
Reviews.Content: Patricia in the gift shop went out of her way to help us

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kailee L
Reviews.Content: I've lived in California for about six years now and never been to San Diego on vacation. My boyfriend surprised me with a vacation to the Hilton Resort & Spa for our one year anniversary. The entire experience there was amazing - we stayed at one of the suites overlooking the water and had its own firepit, which was a great bonus. The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful. One of the sales managers in particular, Marc Francois was a great help and we could not have planned or asked for a better trip and it's because of his excellent customer service and willingness to go the extra mile. If you are looking for someone to help you with any service sale needs, Marc is the guy to ask for! We will definitely be coming back to this Hilton again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mallorie M
Reviews.Content: I had lived in San Diego for about 3 years and had come across this hotel many times. A couple years later we came back for a visit and decided to stay here, it was quite disappointing. First the restaurants seemed to close quite early so we went out to dinner somewhere else. Second we purchased firewood from the gift shop and were need of more firewood but the gift shop decided to close 45 minutes early that day.The firewood is $14 by the way if you are going to stay here I highly recommend going out and buying your own firewood. The concierge didnt seem to want to help us light the fire, when the woman in the gift store assured his assistance. We were able to use the fire pits until the sprinklers turned on putting out our fire and soaking everything and everyone in the process. There should of been a sign stating sprinklers turn on so make sure to move patio furniture and belongings. The patio furnuture had little tears and scratches all over them also.We were also told to be quiet at 9:30pm when there were only three of us not being loud. We called the front desk to ask about hot tub times and were told that they were closed but when the security guard came and told us all to be quiet(very nicely by the way) he told us that the hot tub is open till midnight and that we could go use it. There was also no WI FI access which is absurb for the updated property. Our room itself wasnt that clean also: sheets left under desk, trash behind nightstand, and towel behind tv. I was expecting much more from somewhere like this and it turned out to be very disappointing. Wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jpdo81
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely fabulous. From the resort itself to the staff everything was perfect. Ideal for a family vacation or my romantic getaway with my wife, I was very pleased with the special help of the manager Mr N. Villarino. Thanks for is extra care and kindness our honeymoon was a success.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a night away”
Reviews.Author: jenjaye
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night recently as a quick getaway - we live in San Diego and wanted some escape from the kids and got an excellent last minute rate. Had a King Garden Villa room - it was spacious, a little dated, and not far from the lobby and parking. No wireless, but our stay was short, so it wasn't a problem for us. There were several weddings going on that night, so the place was busy - functions near the pool, etc. We had hoped to have a drink near the pool in the late afternoon, but that was not happening - we were surrounded by wedding guests. Some noise from the hallway at night, but not too bad. I'd stay again if i got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “It's 2011, Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: Travellingnurse50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting this week. There is NO wireless access in rooms. Huh? The hotel is sprawled over the grounds and the first night I was stuck far from the lobby which is the only place I could get a signal. The next morning I was moved to another room closer to the lobby. Staff were friendly but the public areas are worn and scruffy. And in both rooms, the bath didn't drain and I showered with my feet and ankles in soapy water. Ugh. And the cafe was only open till 1 pm so no chance of a snack or hot beverage after that. There were coffee makers in the rooms - but only 2 tea bags provided. Conclusion? Would not stay here out of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience-Fantastic Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Megan K
Reviews.Content: William and M. Ruiz and the other management was great! I was there on business for a conference and although the staff was accommodating, the food was tasty and the room VERY clean - I have a specific story to share. The last day of our stay there, I was getting ready to leave and packing up my things when my heart drops to my knees as I CANNOT find my wedding ring! My co worker and I start tearing up the room in search for the ring. We hear house keeping and ask these workers to start help as well. The staff did not think twice and dropped what they were doing and started to help look. The ring is not in the room?? We decide to go checkout and go to the front desk to talk to the staff. The management staff was so concerned and immediately took my info, asked me questions and took the time to talk to me. They then advised me to go to security and do a report as well. We go to security, describe the ring and the security personal goes in back and comes back up with a white envelope. He opens the envelope and pulled out the ring!!! Once I collected myself and my heart goes back in my chest, I grab the ring and put in on my finger. He explained it must have some how fallen off my finger (has never done this in the 2 years I have worn it) and the cleaning crew found it under the conference table. In leaving for the airport, the management saw me leaving and took the time to make sure it was found and followed up with me. WOW!! What service and care. I was very impressed and felt so taken care of. The hotel is beautiful but the staff is even better!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service a few minutes outside of city! Need transportation to see sites.”
Reviews.Author: VKaloidis
Reviews.Content: I would go back when I have children because it is a close to zoo and city at same time making it easy to accommodate parents and children

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: sscc0404
Reviews.Content: Surprise that they allow families with 2 kids in deluxe rooms. We had 2 queen beds and a roll-in bad: the room was full! No space for laggages, nor for us! And despite it, not even enough space for a good night sleep. The common spaces were acceptable. The view on the bay depressing. Breakfast is good, but we were faced with an extra charge as we were together with friends (it is the "party of 6 or more" extra.) All in all, I will never go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, location and Food”
Reviews.Author: Jkiene
Reviews.Content: As a business traveler, I look for a good location, nice comfortable room, food and service. This hotel has all the above! I forgot my credit card and left for the airport. The Manager contacted me and drove to the airport to deliver the credit Card! This was above and beyond and I would highly recommend this hotel to business and family vacations!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and basics are fine”
Reviews.Author: ChrisEandFamily
Reviews.Content: Good standard hotel with nice pool and area - a relatviely classic Hilton. If you have a car then location is great. Parking per night is very expensive, which is enough for me to strike this off a return trip. That's a shame.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect to relax - watch out for location”
Reviews.Author: smash413
Reviews.Content: recently visited this hotel, and it's a gorgeous hotel in a beautiful setting. the pool area is fantastic and it has everything you need on one site. the only down-side i would say was the location, we hadn't realised it was so far from downtown and being on holiday from England we did not have a car, so it was a taxi journey to Mission beach or downtown. the dinner service was expensive and although the food was good, it was no better than other restaurants we went to so we felt this was overpriced and ate from the pool bar the other nights. there is also some building work going on, which we were not notified of before our visit and caused some noise disturbance when we were around the pool. overall, for a relaxing trip and to stay by the pool it's definitely worth going, but if you want to be out and about I would choose somewhere closer as there isn't much going on around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flexibility”
Reviews.Author: Pam S
Reviews.Content: I was checking into the hotel on business. I arrived early and the room I was assigned was not ready. Angie and William were flexible enough to get me in a great room after a short wait. My only disappointment - I was not on vacation with my family to enjoy the room and property. It was a nice experience and a great place for an outdoor walk/run.

Reviews.Title: “My review from Sept. 2011”
Reviews.Author: Ev S
Reviews.Content: Overall somewhat disappointed. However the staff were wonderful. TC was great!!! The lady at the coffee shop was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort! Great Service! Perfect Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela M
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel and I have to say it was an amazing experience. From the beautiful sunsets over the bay to the great food to the welcoming staff...everything seemed to fit just right. I was there on a family trip recently and there couldn't have been a better place for us to stay. There was always something to do for everyone. Whether it was going for a run around the bay, paddle boarding, riding bikes, laying by the pool, jet skiing, playing tennis, going to the spa, or making smores over the bon fire overlooking the bay. Never a dull moment! When we wanted to explore the city the concierge was very informative and sent us to some of the best restaurants and areas in the town. Thank you to the staff for making this a memorable trip! We will definitely be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful peaceful setting”
Reviews.Author: Jere H
Reviews.Content: We've been staying here for years. The ocean view from the second floor of the 2 story suites is great. Service and food & overall ambiance excellent!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel & Resort”
Reviews.Author: dalyaspn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been spending a couple of months a year at this hotel. Fantastic staff. Lets start at the front desk. Edit, TC, Matt, Nick, Ramzi, And Mr. Personality: William. Pool Bar: Lindzee, JV and Jonathon. Housekeeping: Rosa, Slyvia and Maria. A special thanks to Elizabeth. Carol & Glenn Daly Aspen, Colorado

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Bokehbro
Reviews.Content: I have had the pleasure of staying in lots of nice hotels. The ones that stand out the most are the ones with a caring and appreciative attitude from the staff. William at the front desk, has impeccable customer service skills and knows how to make guests feel welcome and want to come back as a repeat customer.
