Every time, I have visited, I have been fortunate enough to receive his excellent customer service attitude. He is kind, courteous, accommodating and very positive. Next time you are in time, stay at this resort and experience Williams gracious attitude!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: laura h
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two week stay at the Hilton San Diego resort and spa 5.9.11-19.9.11) where we had a ground floor bay view studio suite. We were very disappointed with the hotel, having been impressed with the hotel website and photographs. Where to start.... location is poor as there is very little else nearby, aside from the bay. We did not have a car rental and had to rely solely on taxis. You could not go anywhere by foot. Every aspect of the hotel and it's operation is designed for you to spend your money within the hotel. The hotel shuttle bus is very expensive, and most times it was cheaper to use an ordinary taxi. The bus does not leave until 10am earliest therefore forcing you to pay for breakfast at either the restaurant (also very expensive) or the coffee shop (also expensive). The coffee shop bizarely closes at 1:00pm, obviously as a ploy to make sure you buy your lunch and drinks from the poolside (unsurprisingly, expensive). The reception and concierge staff (with the exception of william who was superb) were generally unhelpful and on one occasion I was completely ignored whilst waiting to speak to reception. I sat down with one female concierge for help with our holiday such as sight seeing etc and she just wasn't interested or helpful and didn't even bother giving us any information. We struggled until William helpfully gave us a restaurant list, leaflets for Seaworld etc which surely could have been given to us by the previous concierge- she basically just didn't want to help. The pool side staff were rude and on one occasion didn't bother bringing back our change having paid our bill- she just assumed we were leaving her an 11 dollar tip even though we only had one sandwich and two sodas. When we asked for our change she appeared shocked and then 15 minutes later(!!) finally brought over our change (all in 1 dollar notes to be sure we were able to leave her a tip of course). The hotel is old and looks dingy save for the fact that a small fortune appears to have been spent on modern furniture to spruce the place up. The room was nice but the bathrooms were outdated. The rooms were very dark with poor lighting. Hotel and pool cleanliness was poor, especially the hot tub in the adult area. There had been milk spilt on the pavement on of the pathways that hadnt been washed and it smelt very badly for days. All in all a very disappointing hotel and certainly won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, bit dated”
Reviews.Author: JoseLuisContreras
Reviews.Content: Room was OK, a bit dark despite the 'garden view'. No wi-fi, only cable at $12+ per day. Parking is also $28 a day so these two essentials add quite a lot to your final per day stay. Hotel facilities are dated and need a overhaul. Hotel map is illegible--tiny--which makes going around the facilities a challenge on day 1. Finally,

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lakrhot
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the room we had asked for did not fit our needs. We requested a change and within minutes we were settled in. The customer service could not have been better. Special kudos to Whitney, our concierge, who helped us find some specialty type of restaurant outside of the normal areas. She printed maps, showed us menus and kept on smiling. The only thing that was in short supply was handicapped parking near the villas. All in all, very relaxing and enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: PatDSalemOR
Reviews.Content: We were treated very well from the minute we arrived. They upgraded our rooms to ocean view without an extra charge, provided tips on things around the resort, gave us free bottled water, provided written driving directions. Nice pool area. Good full-service restaurant with seating both indoors & outside. Friendly service in coffee shop both mornings. Bar pretty expensive, but they do have some specials at Happy Hour. Our housekeeper, Rosario, was fabulous. Easy on/off I-5. Close to Sea World, Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “A bit dated, but nice updates and great facilities!”
Reviews.Author: corbyandjen
Reviews.Content: We just finished a three night stay at this property. It was the third hotel on our vacation in the San Diego/Palm Springs area and we would say our favorite. While you can tell the property has been around awhile from the outside style, they have done a great job of updating the interior and most of the facilities (coffee shop, pool-side dining, fitness and spa facilites). However, what makes this property is that it truly is a resort in San Diego that can keep you busy with options for your entire visit. We went jet skiing twice (check for coupon for AM that gets you extra time free), enjoyed the pool area, rented bikes, used the tennis courts, and enjoyed both meals in the room and in their restaurants. Our king room, in one of the two story villas was spacious with a private balcony and a view of the bay. Other than the noisy kids at the pool in the afternoon, we enjoyed a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location....mediocre room....”
Reviews.Author: danac_10
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I stayed here for four nights in August. We had a "suite" room, which is a slight exageration. The suite area was two steps below the bedroom and was completely unusable area of the room. The coffee maker sits nicely on the little wet bar, but there was no plug for it unless you wanted to pull the mini fridge out and see if it would plug behind that. The patio was never swept, nor the outdoor furniture cleaned of pine needles the entire four days, so you could not sit outside. We were looking at a slight water view if you didn't mind the metal fence. The room had horrible lighting...i.e there was none. The grounds though are beautiful, pool was nice, great walking area for daily strolls and many close places to dine. So overall, I would stay again, but I would not upgrade the room unless I saw where it was located within the complex.

Reviews.Title: “great way to end our crazy trip across southern California”
Reviews.Author: packupupandaway
Reviews.Content: We had booked another hotel but due to over booking we were told we could use Hiton San Diego. We were very happy we some how ended up in this great hotel. My daughter and I were very happy with all the staff and everyone that helped us while we were there for the short two nights. I would come back and stay here again, if given the chance. The Red Marlin was prices but the view on the water was breath taking, we only had breakfast but I have to say the food was very good. We enjoyed the large pool and hot tub. Location is great if flying in and out of the airport. We took the back roads and we were at dollar rent a car in 15 minutes. Almost forgot hotel is near Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Yessitalinda
Reviews.Content: A young lady named andrea who attended me she was very nice and helped me very well in the markt place. Even though she didnt talk spanish she helped us. She was friendly ,nice, loveable, attendable. If all the employees were like her this would be the best hotel of all san diego

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: samleeds
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in early August 2011 as part of our Summer Holidays touring California and chose to stay here as wanted to visit the nearby sea world park. We found the hotel restaurant excellent, the food was expensive but good. The problem with this hotel is the noise and the cleanliness of the rooms, we seemed to get high levels of background noise from other guest rooms and the bathroom needed a good scrub. Also on our first evening, the hotel had hosted a wedding and we were woken twice during the night by drunken wedding guests fighting in the hotel courtyard. Would not stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Great Place to Stay for a Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Steven T
Reviews.Content: The service we received from the time we arrived to the time we left was outstanding. Please give special thanks to William Mathews for making out trip so wonderful. The room we received was fantastic in a great location with a fire pit. Breakfast was great! We wished we had more time at this Resort to try out more of what they offered. My wife and I did try the bicycle ride which felt great and used the pool quit a bit. We defiantly will return and stay at this facility. Thank You Steve Turmala Diamond Member Turmalasc2@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With the Family”
Reviews.Author: 2001elan
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this hoyel in August 2011 with husband and 9 year old son. From the moment we arrived everything went perfectly. This is truly a resort with all of the bells and whistles. The kids evening activities were great. Friday night it was free movie night around the pool with free popcorn. Saturday night it was free smores by the fire pit. You are right on the beach witha a beautiful pool. Great happy hour specials at the pool bar and live music each night 5-7 pm. Jacuzzi is fabulous. The gym was great. All the basic machines you need. Fabulous jogging path in back of hotel that stretches for miles along the beach. What more could you ask for. Okay yes the only true bummer is that darn $28.00 per night parking fee. It does add up and it is an important consideration when staying here. Also - the $11.00 optional room internet fee. I took my laptop to the lobby each day it was fine and free:) The rooms in the tower are lovely. We were on the 7th floor (Room 776) with a view of the bay. We could see the fireworks at Sea World every night. The bed linens are soft and fabulous. Only feather pillows are in the room so you may want to bring a pillow from home. Shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, body gel provided. The Acqua restaurant breakfast buffet was great and cost $20 for adults and $10 for kids. You can always order off the menu if you do not want the buffet. Jet ski rental is $99 per hour. Staff are pleasant and professional. We had a minor television problem and the TV repair men were so sweet and kind. I wish I knew thier names. Top notch. Room is $110 per night with government rate!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for Business & Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: spruill1348
Reviews.Content: The Staff is responsive from the time you arrive. I have to travel to San Diego at least once a month. This is the place to stay. Beach is close by. Great place to work out and entertain as well. Easy Access to all locations North and South William Matthews is there to greet you every time

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lovetokayak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton, San Diego for 2 nights. From the moment I arrived until the time I left, I felt pampered, and comfortable. All staff were freindly, helpful and pleasant to interact with. The room was extremely clean and luxurious. The pool was warm and the hot tube was hot and bubbly. The band rocked and the drinks were strong. The Hilton at San Diego made my short visit to San Diego extremely pleasant. The Hilton even had planned activities for guests such as free tube rides, kayak races and more.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, free room upgrade, beautiful pool area”
Reviews.Author: mattk76
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort for two nights. Great location. It's very close to activities on the bay and old town shops and restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the pool area was great for the kids. Restaurant food, room service, and parking we're a bit pricey but would stay there again regardless. Don't hesitate to ask for a room upgrade. William hooked us up with an awesome upgrade to a larger suite when we arrived. Seems like they are willing to accommodate if they have better rooms available. Would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Front desk supervisor William Matthews comes through again”
Reviews.Author: billorangecounty
Reviews.Content: We recently completed what has become a regular trip to San Diego with our daughters family, including our 4 small granddaughters. This has become their favorite trip of the year, but they aren't responsible for any of the planning and coordinating. All they know is they love everything about the hotel, from the breakfast buffet in the morning, all the way through the Sea World fireworks before bed. Being the one responsible for the planning, this trip has become my favorite also, almost entirely due to the helpfulness and efforts of front desk supervisor William Matthews. On a previous trip he stepped in and handled a problem, and followed up during our entire stay. This time I called in advance. Although he was off the day we checked in, he had everything set up perfectly. With 4 small girls, something seems to come up every 15 minutes. Without exception, during the rest of our stay he handled everything. It makes the trip for me stress free. Due to work I stay at a dozen or so 5 star hotels during the course of the year, and although all are very nice, none provide the level of service that William does. My biggest concern with this hotel is that another competitor steals him away. Needless to say, we wouldnt consider staying at any other San Diego for our family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and definitely recommend..didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: charlene o
Reviews.Content: Hello, this was our first visit to San Diego, Ca and we had no idea what hotel to choose. There were four of us two adults and two children, ages 4 and 11. Based on surveying the area...WE CHOSE THE BEST HOTEL...especially for family...very adult friendly as well. We were centrally located to all attractions, such as Sea World, Zoo, Mission Bay, and Old Town. We were greeted by Marlon and Jeffrey - they both provided a very warm welcome. Jeff was a great help as well. TC also known as Talisha was awesome, very friendly, and helpful with detailed information. William was a great help as well and was full of laughs and smiles. Also, the manager of Aqua remember us by our name for breakfast...that made us feel special. We enjoyed playing ping pong - table tennis, checkers, making s'mores by the fire pit, riding bikes along the water front. The hotel was room itself was a little above average but you truly received five star service with all the other amenities....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Rance R
Reviews.Content: One of the most pleasant experiences of any vacation. The staff is second to none and I especially have to comment on William and TC at the front desk. They went above and beyond to ensure a minor billing issue was taken care of!!! Thanks a ton!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, not up to standard”
Reviews.Author: schmusimausi73
Reviews.Content: We spent a whole week at this hotel. It is presented as an upscale resort style hotel and we splurged for a garden villa, expecting a true Hilton experience. I am sorry to say, we were disppointed and felt misled by the resort presentation on the Hilton website. First of all, the hotel seemed to be trying to squeeze money out of its guests at every turn. The website says each room features high speed internet. Nowhere is a mention of this being not free. Only when you click on individual rooms' info, do they have a tiny notice saying there might be additional fees. By the way, the internet connection is per cable (no wireless) and costs $11.95 per 24 hours. The breakfast is not included in the price of the room and adds up quickly, as does the parking charge of $28 per night. There is an outdoor pool on the property, with a small paddling pool for toddlers next to it. There are lounge chairs around the pool, free of charge, and then shaded cabanas that need to be rented and reserved in advance. I didn't ask how much they were to rent, but considering that there was no mention of the actual price anywhere in the hotel add or the notice at the pool, AND the outrageous prices of poolside snacks, I can only imagine it was just as overpriced as everything else in this hotel. A small ice cream bar cost $5 by the pool. There were notices telling people no outside drinks or food were allowed by the pool, I guess to encourage people to spend ridiculous amounts of money on drinks and snacks. There is beach nearby and Hilton has its own boat dock there as well. You can rent a jetski for $99 PER HOUR, for example. The front desk staff were lukewarm at best. One night I found someone's lost room key card, took it to the front desk, waited almost 10 minutes in line to return it, saying I found it lying around near the pool bar. No thanks, nothing, just a very bored "Oh yeah?" and the woman took the card and that was that. I booked the room as a package which gave me a 50-dollar credit towards the spa services, which the front desk confirmed at check-in. Later on I had a manicure at the spa, the manicure was $45 but they add 20% gratuity automatically to each bill, and that plus tax meant my total was $63. I told the spa coordinator that I had a $50 spa credit, she called the front desk to confirm it, and then told me should couldn't deduct the credit from my bill, but the front desk would do that at check-out for me. No problem. Of course, when the bill came the day of our check-out, the spa charge was there, all $63 of it. So I had to go to the front desk to get it cleared up. I told the man they forgot to apply the $50 spa credit, expecting a sincere "I'm so sorry". He couldn't have been less interested. Looked into the computer, then said "Yeah, there is a credit." He didn't say anything else, so I politely asked for an updated bill. He said yeah, all right, and I was still standing there and he finally realized that I wanted the correct bill, like, you know, NOW. He asked "Do you want me to print it now?" I said YES. He asked: "I can just send it to you as an email." I said I'd prefer it printed out right then. He FINALLY did it and gave me the updated bill. This whole thing was like pulling teeth. Seriously, is it so hard to do your job? Now, there were POSITIVE aspects to the hotel resort as well. We ate at the Olive bar one evening and the food was very good and the service fast and accurate. Our room was clean and had a small balcony. There was a small fridge and a safe. The housekeeping ladies were all very friendly and our room was always nicely cleaned and tidied. The location of the Hilton resort was good, right in the Mission Bay, near the beach and a park with picnic areas and a playground. The nail tech at the spa was very nice and friendly. We had expected more from the Hilton and it speaks for itself when I say that you can getter better value for your money at the Hampton Inn (by Hilton) than a Hilton Resort. In conclusion: we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: Chris N
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler I see a huge number of properties and interact with a lot of hotel employees. I would like to compliment the property on being gorgeous and well kept, but more than that the service of the entire staff was phenomenal. In particular a particular team member stood out. Alyssa Lincoln at the front desk went above and beyond. This was particularly endearing, on this trip, as I was traveling for leisure with my children. Thanks so much and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “William is the BEST!”
Reviews.Author: Diane R
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the Hilton in support of a business conference and during checkin William was exceptionally helpful and made the stay perfect. I would recommend this resort to anyone and definitely see William and tell him Hi from me :) :)

Reviews.Title: “We love it here!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: eli s
Reviews.Content: William Matthews checked us in and helped accomodate our entire family from beginning to end. We love it here, and are so happy we decided to stay here, as opposed to our other options.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the kids!”
Reviews.Author: Erika G
Reviews.Content: We live in Los Angeles and was looking for a great staycation for the weekend and end of summer that was kid friendly and we found it! I felt like this is the perfect resort for families. I am not sure if I would enjoy it as much if I was looking for a romantic weekend. We were luckily able to upgrade our room from the garden view (primarily grass and a parking lot) to the waterfront....and what a difference that made. The view from the waterfront rooms is perfect and makes a difference with the trip. One of the major cons to this resort is there high priced parking of $28. We were only here for two nights, but could not imagine staying longer than that and paying more. The additional $60 damage was more than enough. I think they should give people a break especially since the Four Seasons parking overnight is less than that. Other than that if you have kids you will enjoy this place!

Reviews.Title: “great experience!”
Reviews.Author: happytravelers321
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great time at the resort! What we loved: Whitney at the front desk. She checked us in, and was fabulous and super accomodating with all our requests! Got us a great room, and went out of her way to give us a great experience. What a doll! The on site water sport rental - especially the complimentary acitivites offered there at different times throught the day. make sure to ask for a schedule at check in! Smores at the poolside fire pits! Toddler wading pool -if you've got a little one, you will love it! Location - right on the bay with beach access, close to everything The balconies The vaulted villa ceilings Helpful and friendly staff What we didn't love.. $25 parking fee Bathtubs need to be upgraded Pool area is too dark at night, Other than inside the pool (and fire pit), there are no lights Leaving! But hopefully we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cpseley
Reviews.Content: We spend a few days every year at the hotel and we're never disappointed. My thirteen year old son doesn't even miss his computer, which remians at home. The beach was right out our door and "groomed" every day. Fireworks nightly across the bay at SeaWorld while roasting smores at a beach firepit. The best buffet breakfast anywhere! Rooms were kept immaculate by an attentive staff. Front office personnel well informed, courteous, enthusiastic...overall we couldn't be more pleased. Thanks. PS Snorlking at La Jolla Cove is a must. Kelp beds, Garabaldi galore, in water 10 to 15 ft.

Reviews.Title: “Children loved it, but was a bit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: nicola b
Reviews.Content: A great resort with plenty to do for the children. Room was a great size for a family of 4 but did overlook the freeway which was very noisy, even during the night. Although the room had a private balcony, the noise from the freeway made it impossible to sit out or open the balcony doors for air. Restaurants at the hotel had limited menus and were pricey. There were no other restaurants within walking distance. Pool area was pleasant and beautifully landscaped but the pool area could get crowded in the afternoon. Great views of Seaworld's fireworks from the beach, which is just across the bay. Car parking is very expensive at 28 dollars and you will need a car staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for San Diego vacation”
Reviews.Author: Stevensmom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hilton for years. As a long time HIlton fan, I bring my family here every summer for a relaxing, and at the same time active vacation. The location is perfect, the jet skis and water activities are numerous, and the bicyling around Mission Bay is terrific. With two teenage boys there were plenty of activities here for everyone. They loved the freedom of the resort along with Fresco's grill (poolside), and we all have a great time. I loved the Brezzia spa, beach, and onsite Starbucks. But I must say that one of the reasons that this Hilton is a stand out (besides the facility) is the customer service. It is exceptional!. William at the front desk is without a doubt the best! We came during a rush hour, and he was amazing. Answering phones, showing someone how to get somewhere in Italian, and very pleasant to deal with. As a professional in Human Resources, he is definitely the consummate professional. Driving home last evening, we talked about our trip, and will look forward to returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time at the best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: urbanbeauty76
Reviews.Content: My son and I came from out of town. We had the pleasure of staying at the Hilton Resort & spa in San Diego. Starting with the check in. I had the pleasure of speaking with a young lady by the name of TC. She was so friendly and she knew her stuff. I was really in a bad mood that day. I have to say she made my day. She was very nice. I felt like I was speaking with a friend. She really had my son and my best interest. The Hotel was quit beautiful. I enjoyed the spa and the service I received. You can bet I will come back next year. Thanks to TC Happy Customer

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Phil D
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel three times now and always enjoy our stay. The location is perfect, close to SeaWorld, Old town, and the ballpark. Service has been exceptional, and more specifically, William at the front desk was overly accomadating to my family and I. We will certainly be back again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Steve78759
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed a fantastic visit to the Hilton San Diego Resort. The service was excellent (special thanks to TC), the room was roomy and clean, the food was great, the location is perfect, and we all loved the pool! Hope to go back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best summer for family vacation in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: jimboz3
Reviews.Content: We come down to this hotel twice a year. It has great service, clean large room and awesome location for family with young children. Bay or garden view in every room. Every room has a patio or fire pit. During summer we enjoy fireworks at SeaWorld which you can see from all hotel grounds. Daily activities for entire family to do. The marina has all the water sports for all ages. Kids spend every day on the beach which is less than 10 steps for some beach front rooms. Ask for TC when you check in, she is the BEST! Location and service are the reasons we keep coming back. Ask for TC at check in, Ryan at Marina and Ronald at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ambiance; on the waterfront”
Reviews.Author: JustCruisin11
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place, completely redone a few years ago, and even better than in the past. Rooms are large and many have great views of the bay. Service is good, and you can tell them a two hour period for room service. The pool is large, and there are several whirlpools scattered about the gardens on the property. We like the rooms in the single or two story structures, but there's also a tower with better views. Every room has either a patio or a balcony. Many of the suites have firepits on the patios, and there's a large bonfire area on the beach for groups. Staff is friendly and eager to help. Parking is included in the rates, but you must place a pass on your dash to use the parking lots. They have lots of watersport equipment available for rental. There is also a wonderful, long beach walk right in front of the hotel that wraps around that part of the bay and adjoining parks, used by walkers, runners, bicyclists, and skaters. The main restaurant has indoor and outdoor dining, good views, and good food, but the menu is somewhat limited. The bar also serves food with lower prices. Sandwiches are served out by the pool in a cabana, as well. We need feather free rooms because of allergies, but the one down side is that we always arrive with the bed filled with six or so down pillows. If you need a feather free room, be sure to check the pillows and comforter upon arrival and have them changed out right away. The mattresses, however, are the best we've ever slept on. The downside? It's pricy, but it's possible to use Hilton Honors points. If you don't have enough, sign up for a Hilton credit card and they'll give you enough points for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service (Alyssa) very pleasant resort when with kids, great restaurant (acqua)”
Reviews.Author: Redondoredondo
Reviews.Content: We are frequent travelers (diamond) and have stayed in many Hilton resorts. The customer service by Alyssa at check-inn was outstanding. So went beyond and above to help us move into a great room for ourselves and our 3 little boys. And she did it with a big smile and never gave us the impression we were difficult. The resort has many amenities (tennis, spa, pool etc) and great activities (s'mores at the beach, movie night at the pool etc). The location of the hotel is close to sea world, balboa, zoo, gaslamp; but we actually spend quite some time at the resort itself because it was so pleasant and 'easy. We had a wonderful time and will for sure come back. And thanks Alyssa!!

Reviews.Title: “room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: bdj8020
Reviews.Content: The resort was close to100% occupancy but there was only 20-30 people in the pool the entire weekend. Just maybe the pool was to cold to go into. The security at the pool entrance is nonexistent, families lounging on either side of me were pool crashers. The table service at the pool is absolutely the worst I have experienced anywhere, way to slow. Please Improve.

Reviews.Title: “WILLIAM, FROM FRONT DESK, MADE OUR VACATION AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Sterlingwhg
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and quietly checked in to surprise my mom for her weekend, August 5-7th. We woke up the next morning and spoke with William at the front desk. He proceeded to turn our vacation into one of the most memorable! He was helpful in procuring the perfect room, at a romantic resort where families joined in the evenings for smores on the beach. The location was ideal for those seeking biking, beach activities, water sports, great walks around the bay and the BEST SERVICE, SPECIFICALLY, WILLIAM AT THE FRONT DESK, choose this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location next to many Activities”
Reviews.Author: Annew1217
Reviews.Content: We walked in the hotel this weekend with no reservations to get the last room available! All the other hotels were booked .....August in San Diego is apparently a busy time! The rate was way more than we wanted to spend but luckily my husband had Hilton Honor points that we used for this stay. And parking was $28, high IMO. The room was clean and quite large and the bathroom had marble counters & nice quality towels. I couldn't get the tub to drain as I was showering so I stood in a puddle of water. Also the plumbing was noisy from the other room. However, these minor things did not bother me, just letting you know. The bed was comfy. The grounds were very nice, however, the common areas (the elevator & public walkways) need constant attention due to all the kids, water, sand & handprints. The location is great for bicycling, boating, jet skiing, & more because it is right on the bay. Close to Sea World, Old Towne, Marina, Gas Lamp. Very nice stay if you can afford the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed by Front Desk clerk TC!!”
Reviews.Author: suneagle
Reviews.Content: When my mom and I booked our rooms online we specified adjoining rooms, as we would each be travelling with a young child and my mom would be fresh out of surgery and may need my assistance during the night. Upon check in we found our rooms to be on the same floor but not adjoining. We told the clerk helping us, TC, that that wouldn't work for us. She spent 20 or more minutes trying to find a combo of rooms that would work for us and bless her patience and perseverence she succeeded! We ended up paying a little more for the upgrade from the tower to a villa, but she made it affordable for us and we couldn't have had more comfortable accommodations. In this circumstance we spent a lot of time at the hotel and the rooms she moved us to were not only adjoining, they were on a quiet path with patios and grass in front that the girls could run in. TC personally helped us with our bags as the bell desk was unmanned and she couldn't even get them by radio. What a godsend she was for us! As for the rest of the hotel...it was average. Pool area was nice but the menu, until the day we left, wasn't very child friendly. Could be our stay was right before tourism got hot and heavy, but we were prepared to eat at least 2 meals a day there and were pretty disappointed in the selection for our girls. We stocked our mini fridge with sandwich makings and ordered pizza from up the hill several times instead. And I must say the pool staff spent far more time wandering and fixing chairs to be lined up straight than they did offering food/beverage services. So they didn't make much money on us there either... Would we stay again? No. If TC hadn't upgraded us we would have moved hotels. She is the shining star of our trip. Other than that, this is just a hotel with services and amenities overpriced for business groups, not families. The location is pretty enough, but we had just moved from Hotel Circle which was a crummy location (I-8 in the middle of it all!) but very family friendly (kids meals were half what Hilton charged) and comfortable for our kids to eat and play all day at. If our kids are entertained, fed and happy...so are we!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: GenXTraveler-NJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 11 nights.....and had an absolutely great time there. We couldn't have asked for more. We chose this property since it is the ONLY Hilton-owned property in the San Diego area with a beach. Part of this trip was using reward points. We were a little leary of being in a "Villa", but it turned out great. Some of the villas (1st floor) have the option of a firepit. We had a nice partial view of the bay. A sink outside of the bathroom (like you get at Embassy or Homewood) was missed. The hotel puts on a number of great programs for vacationers.....s'mores on the beach at 7pm, movies by the firepit at the pool at 8pm, boat rentals, bike rentals, beach games, etc. I can't write a review without mentioning Dan, the great guy who works at the bike rental/recreation station out at their beach. He's a real gem....clearly loves what he does (helping people "make a memory" as he says). He's a success! PS: The bike path he suggests is just great...honestly one of the favorite things we did on the whole trip. The restaurant is great.....plenty of tasty options at fair (not cheap) prices......service was generally good (especially with Terry from the Bronx!). As others have said, you can see the SeaWorld fireworks very clearly from the beach...lasts about 5 minutes. We rented a car from Enterprise through the hotel. Pickup was a bit pesty in that I had to be taken to the Enterprise office to sign papers. But, I was able to drop off the car at the hotel. Be prepared for the strong breezes at this hotel. Those who tend to run cold will want to bring SERIOUS sweatshirts or jackets. Those folks will want to save the pool for days with lighter breezes. They will also love the fact that the patio at the restaurant has glass barriers up that block the wind (let's be honest, not really a breeze). :-) Those that run hot like me, will be fine. Overall, we had a fantastic time....would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back.....ever”
Reviews.Author: HappyCouple005
Reviews.Content: Wow, poor customer service, old, and dirty. From the moment we checked in I knew that we had made a mistake. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member and this place is not up to the standards of any Hilton property I have stayed at. We did not get the room we had paid for even though they tried to tell me I was being upgraded to a bigger room, not true. The first day at the pool, not one of the staff asked us for a food or beverage order. With young children a problem quickly became apparent. The pool is not secure and the entire pool can be accessed by non guests from the bay walking path. It would be easy for you to take your eyes of your child for just a second and have something bad happen. We were unable to relax do to this fact. The room had been re-newed but was still not cleaned well. We spent four days here and we will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back. Great family hotel and GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: YoungGuns123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my wife's family from Italy and had a fantistic time. Our experience started with William (front desk supervisor) who provided us with great service and made us feel greatly welcomed from the moment we arrived. We spent time at the pool and bay. We rented jet skies from the hotel and had an awesome time! We will definately come back to this hotel anytime we visit San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: Diane92660
Reviews.Content: Bought three days at this at a 4 STAR on priceline. Upon check-in we were informed that parking in the parking lot would cost us $25 per day....? We were placed in a nice room as far from the lobby and services as you could get. We checked in on a Sunday evening and listened to staff cleaning carpets in the PARKING lot for over an hour (really loud). Apparently our room location is the LAST rooms of the day to be cleaned -- so maid service was around 5 p.m. (we skipped room cleanup on the 2nd day as we had been out all day only to come back to an undone room). No internet service in the room. Coffee service in room had dirty styrofoam cups. Did NOT consider this a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property Staff was rude”
Reviews.Author: murphy50_11
Reviews.Content: Nice property and priced accordingly. Hotel staff was very slow at font desk, took about 20 minutes to check in. Then after finding the receipt under the door the next day I immediately called and expressed that my reservation was for 2 days. They basically said too bad, we are overbooked. At my meeting in the am one of my peers stated that he was checking out early, so I could have his room. We went to the front desk, explained the situation to William that we were part of the same group and could they book me in his room for the extra night since he was vacating early. He looked at my associate, asked him if he was checking out, he said yes, handed him his receipt and turned back to me and said, "Sorry we are still overbooked". What a jerk. After almost blowing my top, he back pedaled and said, ok, we will extend your room for another day. I had to get into an argument to make it happen, very poor customer service to say the least. ? Very embarrassing. Business center was a joke, Fax was broken, and couldn't print a boarding pass on any of the computers, they would just hourglass. Not a great place for a business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Relaxing Atmosphere to recharge and relax!”
Reviews.Author: berta6696
Reviews.Content: Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa was a wonderful respite in a busy area. Amenities are wonderful, rooms great but the service is what made the stay. All the staff were great, but I would like to make special mention of William at the reservation desk. We arrived to find the room we had requested not ready as it was still being cleaned. William immediately, and without asking, began to search for a comparable room. He not only found a room that was availabe, but was an upgrade to our reservation, in his words "to compensate for our inconvenience". William did this while being asked questions, folks milling about and other distractions. Definately grace under fire! Thanks William!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Mission Bay!”
Reviews.Author: brown-I-gal
Reviews.Content: We live in Orange County and travel to San Diego several times a year. I have Always wanted to stay at this hotel. We finally had a chance the week of July 4th. We got upgraded to a partial bay view (the view was mostly of the neighboring park). The rooms were average and were not anything special. The pool was also just ok. However, you are literally right on the bay. All the sporting activities are just outside your door! It is great! Plus in the evening you can talke a stroll and watch the fireworks at Sea World. Location of this hotel is great! It is close to all the major attractions and Old Town. Great place to stay! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but nickel and dime you to death”
Reviews.Author: pagerawd
Reviews.Content: Clean, front desk was friendly and helpful but if you need something, I hope you have it. Bring firewood, they have fire pits by the beach which are great and me and the kids were planning on making smores. We bought everything except firewood and found out they wanted 10 bucks for 4 peices of wood. Struck me as a tad high even for a resort. Can't remember exactly what the other things were but there was a lot of that. If you want a nice room, with beautifully landscaped property and don't mind added cost then you will enjoy. Oh yeah, 25.00 per night for parking, not unusual in that area but once again, a little high, even for there. They have a connection for wifi there in the room, almost hooked it up since there was no little card telling you there was a charge but wised up and called and turns out it was 12.50 per day, and no notice anywhere that it was a premium. Rubbed me the wrong way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money...”
Reviews.Author: Sazelle
Reviews.Content: My husband were here partly for his business, and partly to see friends and have a bit of a romantic weekend away. We didn't have a choice as to what hotel we stayed at given that this was the location of his conference, however we likely would have picked it anyway. The price (granted, with a bit of a conference rate discount) was terrific for the value. Rooms did smell a tad bit musty, but freshened right up when we opened up our sliding door and let some air in. We were very impressed with the patio and the bar area--for a single king room it was quite a little space to entertain in! The pool was clean and serviced for food and beverages, and had ample chairs with sunny and shady spots. It wasn't a requirement that you arrived early to score a chair, though if you are traveling in groups of more than 2, you might want to just so that you all get chairs together. The breakfast was overpriced, but the buffet had a lot of good options, including scrambled eggs and bacon, and pico de gallo and other interesting sides. The resort staff was very friendly and helpful, and the best part - the resort is located right on a sandy beach. Water is not good for swimming, but watercraft are available for rent just steps from the pool, and there is a nice park next door. Overall we couldn't have been happier with our luck at finding this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Choice! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: JPortia
Reviews.Content: My husband, 5 year old son and I, drove down from LA to stay here in mid-June for a few nights. We were meeting up with friends at the San Diego parks (Sea World, Zoo, Balboa). We wanted to be out of the city, but close to everything, and the Hilton is just that. The location was perfect. We were on the top floor of the tower, facing the bay. What a fantastic view! We even left the balcony door open the first night so we could feel the ocean breeze. The room was beautiful, very spacious, recently remodeled, and clean. I loved the wood beams that added a cool architectural element. The furnishings were dramatic--not the average boring hotel room. The beds had soft linens, feather pillows and were very comfortable. The bathroom had beautiful granite and tile, but a pretty typical bathtub/shower. Not quite ultra luxury bath like a Four Seasons, but really well done. Every hotel employee we encountered was gracious, genuine, and helpful. They each inquired about our stay and several engaged in short conversations that made it clear that they were not just â€œgoing through the motionsâ€�, but that they took pride in their job and cared about the guests. We had a very slight rattling noise from the A/C unit that most people probably wouldnâ€™t notice, and they fixed immediately. In my experience, leadership makes all the difference when it comes to the customer experience in any business, and the Hiltonâ€™s General Manager is obviously dedicated and skilled at running a major resort. We were pretty worn out from touring the parks & swimming, so we ordered room service in lieu of going to the restaurant. Room service was delicious, fast and accommodating. My son is a pretty picky vegetarian, but they were able to prepare a special dish for him! The pool was huge, gorgeous, and perfectly maintained. My son is just learning to swim and the beach-like wade in area is very cool, awesome for little ones. He also swam in the 5â€™ deep area with my husband and LOVED it! There was plenty of lovely comfortable seating, big beach towels, and helpful hotel staff, ready to assist. Fantastic!! I looked at a few 5 star boutique hotels in the area before choosing the Hilton for location and amenities, but Iâ€™m very happy with my choice. It was an incredible value and we had a fantastic time at the Hilton Resort and Spa!

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: JeffreyDziedzic
Reviews.Content: We arrived, my wife, 2 year old daughter and myself, after spending 5 nights at a Sheraton hotel, and we initially impressed. Although we were not on their books, the front counter lady checked us in with no hassles. Room was nice, garden view villa. Very disappointed when we were asked to get out of the main pool as apparently children 4 years or younger are not allowed - yet this was not signed or advised by the Hotel when we booked ( and they were aware we were traveling with an infant) This took much of the 'shine' off our stay as spending most of our time in a pool with 1 ft of water in 30 degree heat isn't much fun ( for both the kids and the adults) I would suggest this is made much more obvious, particulary for families with young children - or don't bother allowing children to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Chaseme303
Reviews.Content: We stayed the last night of our 7 day San Diego vacation at the Hilton, the staff was great, room was clean, view from our room was awesome! We had a better view of Seaworld's fireworks than we did when we were at Seaworld! The pool area is beautiful, my only complaint is babies are only allowed in the baby pool....which makes it difficult when you have older kids too since I can't be two places at once to watch everbody! Other than that our stay was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice to stay here”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirls4
Reviews.Content: Pleasantly surprised. Arrived early so our bags were stored while we had lunch. Room was ready after we finished lunch in the nice restaurant . Room was 2 QNS IN TRADITIONAL TOWER the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was very clean with good hair dryer and toiletries. Sliding door from room out to chairs and table was lovely. The pool area was great with plenty of chairs to relax. Happy hour drinks were a bonus. Jet ski and bikes were also worth a go and great fun. Food was good and shop for little items like tissues and snacks was handy. Atmosphere was pleasant and relaxing and the staff were very helpful. Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great service at pool”
Reviews.Author: KatyMomof2
Reviews.Content: My family watched the Women's World Cup Soccer poolside and received excellent service from Lindzee. She was very friendly, fast and accurate. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Poor management and customer service”
Reviews.Author: Meadowsweet
Reviews.Content: This is a delayed review, but the service I received is still bothering me so I decided to write. My daughter and I stayed here 6/13 - 6/15 to celebrate my 50th birthday on 6/14. On 6/14 I went to the resort's spa, and then we spent the day at Point Loma (wonderful) and then decided on happy hour and dinner at the hotel. I wanted one margarita at happy hour. First wasn't allowed in pool bar due to private party. Went to restaurant bar and it was full. Went to restaurant and wasn't allowed to sit anywhere with a water view and get a happy hour price. Come on! I'm turning 50 & from Arizona, let me have one margarita and look at water! The GM of the restaurant was incredibly rude to us. No apology ever received for the hassle of being uable to get the advertised happy hour price. We ended up paying full price for one drink each and then left the property to go someplace with nicer people. Complained at front desk at check out and they reversed the charges for my one drink, but I still can't believe how rude the restaurant manager was. His employees later talked to me, apologized, and basically said he's horrible. Also, the property, despite a few upgrades, still seems aged and not very clean. I did have a good experience at the spa though. After this we moved on to our next reservation at Hilton's Torrey Pine property. What a difference! We were treated wonderfully! I'd suggest staying there instead and just making the short drive into San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego is paradise”
Reviews.Author: GalThatTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Diego during July 4th holiday and we stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. I was a little skeptical based on the other reviews that I read on TripAdvisor about this propety but we were very pleased with our room and stay. It is a beautiful location overlooking Mission Bay. The sunsets were great as well as the fireworks from SeaWorld every night (at least in summer). It was a convenient location with regard to getting around San Diego, right off I-5. We got to/from the airport in less than 10 minutes; LaJolla was an easy 20 to 30 minute drive; Old Town just an exit or two away; San Diego Zoo 15 minute drive; and of course SeaWorld was 5 minutes away! You do need a car if you stay at this location and want to get around. Although the location is convenient to the highway etc., the resort is in a isolated location i.e. nothing within walking distance. However, the hotel is full service and there is a restaurant/bar (Acqua & Olive), casual pool bar/restaurant, coffee shop (Aroma), full gift shop/convenience store, spa/gym/tennis courts (which we didn't happen to use), water sports. It does have a "beach" technically but it's the bay. So if you are looking for a true beach experience i.e. Pacific Ocean - you'll have to head out to one of the several beaches. It does cost $25 per day to park here which we knew ahead of time but it's worth mentioning again since it seems to be a surprise to some based on the reviews. It seems to be a family-friendly place - lots of kids at the pool and lots of kids activities at the pool. They had a family movie night one night at the pool; another night S'mores on the beach. The food is very good at the Acqua restaurant - we ate there for breakfast several times, dinner, and at happy hour (Olive is the bar). However, the service is very slow so just be prepared. Nothing is quick. The pool bar also has happy hour every day which was fun and affordable I can't say how much of a value it was price-wise as we stayed using Hilton points. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to San Diego and cannot wait to go back some day. it is a beautiful city with lots to do and absolutely perfect weather.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Hilton a resort”
Reviews.Author: travel277
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort. As a Hilton honor member, we have enjoyed staying a various Hiltons. Before booking this hotel, we had read many positive reviews on Trip Advisor. Upon check we were given a room in the Villa waterfront. The Villa has two floors. As a warning for those that may need an elevator, there are only stairs. Outside our room and throughout the stair case was the strong smell of insect pesticide. On one of the evenings, we saw a roach run across the bathroom floor. I could catch it fast enough. The buildings and the decor of the resort looks old and run down. The place almost had a feel more of a motel. A couple of years ago we stayed at the HIlton resort on the big island of Hawaii. Now that's a real resort. The staff at this Hilton was friendly. The pool would be the best part of the hotel. From the pool, we could see the firework show from Sea World. The parking was $25 per day. Not sure why because there isn't any other real business nearby. The breakfast buffet was also disappointment. Not many selections compared to the other Hilton buffets we've been too. Even though our breakfast voucher took off $13 dollars per person, we still paid over $20 dollars after tip for a limited breakfast selection. After the first day, we just ate in Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Personnel needs some work”
Reviews.Author: familytravel4fun
Reviews.Content: I am a regular Hilton customer so of course, I judge one against another. This resort just didn't meet up to others that I have stayed at just due to the horrible service we experienced in the restaurant. Over the course of three days we had one dinner and three breakfasts at Acqua. At dinner they wanted to seat us outside which I said would be fine as long as we had a heater and the hostess said no problem. We ended up having to ask the waiter after some time for a heater and he said the one next to us didn't work and there were no others available. There were only maybe 6 other tables and most of those were seated next to firepits! The sun went down and the fog blew in further and it was just too cold so we asked again. Turns out the heater next to us did work but the waiter hadn't been sure how to light it! It was just lazy of him. The food was fine. Overpriced as all Hilton restaurants are. It was the breakfast staff that really blew our minds. Very inefficient. Our waiter would walk all the way out to the patio and only visit one table at a time so good luck getting any drink refills or asking for the check. The hostess grumbled aloud every morning and couldn't manage a good morning or a smile. All the staff would shoulder their way through the doors and make YOU hold the doors open for them. I had overheard a table grumbling about this our first morning and thought that surely they were exaggerating but no, it happened the next two mornings to me. Thankfully, the last morning we had Daniel as our waiter and he was excellent. What a waiter at a busy, upscale resort should be. The buffet food was fine but the pastries were fresh and exceptional. Not a large buffet like the Cabo resort. We had a bayfront room and that was a highlight. Very spacious, really liked the decor, didn't like the mildew in the shower. Nice and quiet. There was a newborn next door and it cried alot but was very faint and didn't disturb us. The pool area was lovely but the pool itself was cool. My kids didnt mind. We liked the big checkers board. Poolside food was good (the chicken quesadilla was excellent) but again, expensive and service there was fast and friendly. Great location to see the Sea World fireworks every night. Nice to be able to jump on and off the highway but not hear the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Tonyg536
Reviews.Content: Great: The front desk was exceptional and I want to make the point that William the front desk supervisor is friendly, and knows his stuff. His personal attention to my needs made may stay enjoyable and we will definitely be back. Additionally, the bar, Acqua, pool and beach personnel are all worth mentioning. Okay: my wife's experience at the spa was okay. She wants to be pampered at a spa and she was left on her own and forced to fend for her self at times

Reviews.Title: “Great Property All Around!”
Reviews.Author: ashdoyle
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort for training with my work and I loved it! It is a beautiful property and the staff was wonderful!! The Conference Center is in the middle of the property so it was easily accessible from any room. Also, I am a runner so it was nice to have the Bay right outside my door so I could go for an evening run and enjoy the cool weather. The Front Desk staff and Bellmen staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations to dining and other activities. I am looking forward to visiting the property again in the future with my fiancÃ©. Ashley Doyle

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the tower”
Reviews.Author: Acdman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on 6/27 - 6/29 2011. They must have given me the dirtiest room in this entire complex. I do not recommend this hotel at all. The condition of the room is very worn. Poor paint over paint jobs. One elevator working. Only one outlet in the room. Wifi was aweful to connect. Pubic hairs on the towels. Straws on the floor. Bathroom were moldy. The room was in very poor condition. it desperately needs remodeling. If you are tempted o stay here it will be a very unpleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware - Definitely Not a Resort or Spa”
Reviews.Author: Jr2012
Reviews.Content: This place is the definition of a poorly managed property that misrepresents itself as a "Resort & Spa". The negatives start with some noisy children running up and down the hallways, knocking on random doors at 11:00 PM. The worst part wasn't the noise so much as management's lack of concern after I and other guests complained. And we were in the villas which are supposedly an upgrade over the tower. I can only imagine what it is like in that building. In addition, the sauna, locker rooms and showers close at 8 PM which is ridiculous for those of us who wanted to end the day with a nice steam. When asked why they close so early, we were surprised to be told by management that the spa isn't owned by the hotel and they have no control over its operating hours. It seems misleading that this property rerpresents itself as a "spa" when they have little or nothing to do with its operation. There is a positive. We were so disappointed with this place that we did not want to spend a second night as planned so we checked out and were not charged for leaving early. Something tells me that this situation happens fairly frequently. If you are a seeking a hotel for relaxation, peace and quiet, romance or spa services, this is NOT the place for you. If you have a family or are with a group where you don't want to worry about keeping noise levels down or keeping your kids under wraps, then this might be a good fit if you can get a room for under $200 (and it's only that high because of it's location on Mission Bay), but be prepared to pay $25/day for unsecured parking and $11/day for internet. It's definitely not worth the prices they try to get during peak season.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: adamafolous
Reviews.Content: My family's stay was fairly pleasant. There wasn't anything special about this hotel but the location. It was close to everything. You are about 7 miles from the zoo, 1 mile from Sea World, 7 miles from La Jolla Cove, 30 minutes from Legoland, 30 minutes from the best outlets Las Americas and about 10 minutes from downtown. Restaurants were also very close. The only two negative things about the hotel was the $25 a night parking and the dirty toilet in our room. It was filthy in places people can't tell unless they really look. Breakfast buffet was $20.95. I think that is a bit pricey for eggs. The grounds were lovely and the weather was pleasant. Tip: skip the zoo if you have a zoo at home. It is just like a regular zoo, nothing special. La Jolla Cove is a must. It is not far and it is beautiful. You are able to view seals. Don't forget your gps. You will never get lost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond121
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel with our 11 yr. old grandson. We loved the convenience to Sea World and Old Town. The food at Fresco's (the pool bar) was great, and the bartender, JV, couldn't have been better. He made a Roy Rogers (fountain cherry coke) for our grandson that was so good both my husband and I ordered one, too. The hotel isn't new, but our room was clean, and everything worked properly. The hotel grounds are beautifully manicured, and the fire pits conveniently located around the property are a nice touch for cool San Diego evenings. We found the staff to be efficient, professional and attentive. This was not my first visit to this hotel, and once again I was pleased that we had selected it. We were not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Such a disappointing return trip”
Reviews.Author: MaggieDublin
Reviews.Content: Having had a lovely time here two years ago we returned only to be hugely disappointed. The hotel is a huge conference centre and this is all they are interested in. They are simply not interested in the one off guests who are on holiday. We were staying 8 nights and didn't get the room we requested when we checked in. We got a bay view room which was a joke - you could see the bay if you stretched your neck over the balcony. The balcony was filthy. We asked to be moved but were told the place was full so they could do nothing, they could move us the next day for a few nights and then we would have to be moved again! We contacted our agent at home who are 8 hours behind but due to time differences there was no Manager on site, they left a message and were promised the manager would contact us as soon as they arrived in. They didn't and we had to follow it up ourselves. We spoke to Elizabeth who turned out to be one of the only helpful staff members and after some sorting her end she managed to get us the room we wanted. The hotel is so busy with conferences it's just not a relaxing holiday destination. There are business people on lap tops everywhere (including the pool) and talking loudly on mobiles. The place really needs a renovation as it's filthy in certain areas. The cushions around the bar area are dirty and the whole place looks tired. We loved it the last time we stayed but sadly we will not be returning. The apathy of the staff is probably due to the lack of care given to the hotel. It's such a pity

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: suethenurse29
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the beauty of this resort, the grounds were lush and so close to the water. There were many activities you could partake in, but what a cost to do them! It isn't a quiet place, lots of kids, and weddings on the weekends, but if you don't mind that and the cost, it's a great place to stay. My one issue is they don't have WIFI in the rooms. For a very expensive place, that has a lot of business confrences, you would think they would be more up to date, dial-up is not acceptable! Also I really think that if you are going to charge so much for a room, you shouldn't have to pay 25.00 a night to park too! The best part was the free fireworks right out our terrace every night, compliments of Seaworld. It was an unexpected treat, and very romantic!

Reviews.Title: “Great time, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: kraybrig
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility with so much to offer, between the pools,games, beach etc it was difficult to decide what to do. Fabulous location for families and friends regardless of age. You can park your car and stay for days and you will love every minute. The staff was most accommodating and it was obvious that excellent customer service is a priority. It had a very nice design both interior and exterior, reminded me of a Hawaiian resort. Food was also great.

Reviews.Title: “thank goodness for the front office staff”
Reviews.Author: gg3229
Reviews.Content: My family and I went on our 5 day vacation and ran into a problem at a hotel in the Gaslamp quarter. We called the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. Rod at the front desk completely took care of us. He was so wonderful!! Then the next day we need some additional help and William was at the front desk. I could not believe how much he went out of his way to accommodate us!! I have never been treated so well. I just want to say that Rod and William really saved our vacation and we are so appreciative. We will come back to this hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: rayranryan
Reviews.Content: Hilton San Diego Resort grounds are beautiful... The 1st room we had for my husband handicap accessibility was kind of small...he could move around to well in his wheel chair...I went to the front desk and talked with TC the counter clerk...she is an awesome "LADY"....she relocated us to another room which was bigger and she made sure my husband had a bath chair for the shower plus a higher toilet seat to help him get up without extra struggles... for it not to be handicap "TC" help turn it into ONE for the comfort of my husbands needs!!! I rate her a 5 star...everyone at this hotel was very nice...thanks also to the other clerk who gave us a discount on parking...

Reviews.Title: “I would highly recommend the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa for a family vacation because It the perfect hotel to go to for par”
Reviews.Author: GBELL222
Reviews.Content: We went to the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa for the weekend with our family. There were 13 of us including 5 children from 18 months to 6 years. There was so much for all of us to do. The kids loved feeding the ducks and the fish. All of the Hotel staff were wonderful. The food and the service was A+. Kevin always welcomed us with a smile and had tables set up for our large group. He kept checking to make sure we were happy and the children had whatever they needed. Ignacio remembered what all of us ordered to drink the first morning for breakfast and brought it to us when we sat down for breakfast the second day. From the welcoming staff at the front desk, the staff who were very helpful in the pool area, the friendly ladies in the wonderful gift shop to the best food and wait staff, I would highly recommend any family go to the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa for their vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel with a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: avivaleah
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights while we were on vacation. There are five of us so we had to get a fold-out bed which made the room pretty small, since it wasn't that big to begin with. There was a musky smell to the room which we figured was due to the hotel being on the Bay. The beds were not comfortable unfortunately but the room was clean. Parking our car was sometimes difficult since there were not enough spaces near the rooms, but we were told to make a space. My husband gets free breakfast vouchers since he travels a lot, so we ate at the restaurant every day. The food and service was very good. Also, we were very pleased with the great location of the hotel. Most places we went to were only a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Overrated”
Reviews.Author: dallascowboys1960
Reviews.Content: The clerk at the counter @ ck.in TC was very helpful as she put us in our room 2 hours early on Sat the 4th when we arrived in San Diego.But the room for a Hilton Resort was overrated as the AC didn't cool, the door had an opening at the bottom as the door seal was missing and you see day light coming in.also the room had a very strong odor.we asked for another room and it wasn't until Monday the 6th that we were moved down the hall in to a like room.

Reviews.Title: “Awful remodel”
Reviews.Author: AZscimom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the tower bay view room. The balcony was barely a balcony and filthy with bird poop. The bathrooms are so small you could barely move and old. The remodel needs remodeled! I would not recommend this hotel, until they spend some money remodeling the hideous bathrooms. Not impressed with the customer service either. They do not offer free Wifi and their rates are awful. No special offers, just hideous bathrooms!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT resort and location for my family with young kids!!”
Reviews.Author: themitchells8
Reviews.Content: I took my family to San Diego for the Memorial Holiday Weekend and we stayed at this wonderful resort. I have never stayed at resort that accommodated our needs as much as this place did. There are all kinds of activities to do, plus they are centrally located to all the parks and ocean. I was very impressed how clean and updated the resort was. As soon as we stepped foot on the property I was greeted by a friendly staff and helpful service. I instantly new we had chosen the right place for our family vacation. The front desk staff was very knowledgeable about the area and answered all questions that I had. When we arrived at our room, we were able to park directly in front of our door which was a huge plus considering parking in San Diego is hard to find. Once we were in our room we not disappointed. The room was very clean, large and it had a huge sliding glass door. When that door was all the way open, it seemed as if the entire patio and outdoors were part of the room. We had a garden view room which allowed us to watch our children play in a large grass area while my wife and I had a glass of wine on the patio. When the kids were bored with the lawn area we were only steps from the pool and the beach. With this hotel being on the bay it allowed my two boys to play in the sand and water yet not have the fear of them being tackled by large waves or the crowd of Mission Beach. The pool and restaurants are top notch. The pool is large and has an awesome relaxing atmosphere...a real oasis (plus it has a kiddie pool for the little ones). The restaurant on site has spectacular views of the bay where my family and I were able to watch wind surfers from the patio and enjoy our meal. Because the resort is on the boardwalk we had the opportunity to explore all of Mission Bay by way of walking or by bike. We actually rented a four seater bike (through the Hilton) and cruised the boardwalk for an hour. What a great way to cover lots of ground yet still be able to appreciate your surroundings. Finally, what is a San Diego trip with the family without visiting the parks? This place is is practically on Sea World's grounds it's so close, it's around the corner from the San Diego Zoo, and a few miles from Old Town and Mission Beach. Perfect location!! But to be completely honest, my family and I would have been perfectly content staying at the resort all weekend and never attempting to battle the holiday crowds. We will definitely stay here again and I will be recommending the Hilton Resort and Spa to anybody headed to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great family getaway but room was lacking in the details”
Reviews.Author: CAvacationmom
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our experience at the Hilton as a family (kids 11 & 7). Pool is good, fun enormous checkers games, beach and yummy mojitos. Ate at the resort and food was good. Our room, however, looked nice as we walked in but after spending time there, noticed that the table was pretty beat up, the upholstered headboard had half the brass studs missing on one side, the closet was the old closet doors only with updated handles. It's a nice resort but I think lacking when you consider it is a 4-star with a $250/night plus $25 parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: BKahler
Reviews.Content: We went to San Diego with our family. We rented 5 rooms and had children from 4 months to 15 years and the property is amazing. The grounds were beautiful with a great pool and beach access. We rented bikes and also went to Sea World for a couple of days. The location was great we were to Sea World with a short 5 minute drive and we were able to watch the fireworks from the beach in front of the property. This was great with the children because we were able to get back to the resort at a decent time. We will definitely go back to this property it is A+.

Reviews.Title: “Oh RATS!!! What a hotel”
Reviews.Author: DonG20t
Reviews.Content: Yes, the title should give away how my stay was. Lets start with the good and work our way down. Stayed at the Hilton from 5/30-6/3. Family of 4 with a 2 and 3 year old. Check in was very fast. The Indian gentleman (sorry didn't get his name) was very nice and gave both my kids a free Shamu stuff animal upon checking in. We were given room 624 (single floor villa). The room and bathroom was a nice size. The patio had 2 chaise loungers and grassy area. Kids enjoyed playing in the grassy area. This is when the trip got uncomfortable... As I was sitting in the patio watching the kids, in the corner of my eye, I saw something scurry next to my chair and then run away towards the trees. I didn't think anything of it because I thought it was a squirrel or chipmunk. The next day, I confirmed twice that indeed it was not a chipmunk but a 6-8 inch RAT!!!! I was laying on the lounger again, enjoying a cup of coffee. I happen to put my coffee cup on the ground next to me and the next thing I saw was a rat come towards the cup. Once it saw me, it ran into the tree area next door. That freaked me out pretty good so we quickly went back inside the room. As we were leaving to go out that night, we were walking along the path to our car and low and behold a RAT was sitting in the middle of the sidewalk. The rat did not even move as we approached. My wife even threw a rock at it, but it did not move. In amazement, we went to to front desk to report this to the staff. They were shocked to hear our story, and didn't believe us. So 4 members of the staff (front desk, security, bell hop) walked with us to where the RAT was and it was still sitting there. They went looking for a stick or golf club to make it move. We left them to do whatever they needed to do. I personally did not feel comfortable at the hotel after this incident. No one from the staff came to follow up with us during our stay. Would not recommend this hotel based on this recent stay. Pros: Nice pool area Cons: Parking - $25/nt (knew price going in, but still hard to understand why so expensive); huge RATS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pool covered in Duck excrement!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wilko2211
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in September 2010 as a relaxing break prior to a not so relaxing trip to Las Vegas. The hotel was nice, the room was lovely but the customer service was just shocking. Being an animal lover the ducks in the pool were a novelty for the first few minutes but it became apparent that they were not leaving anytime soon and pretty soon the bottom of the pool and the whole edge of the pool was scattered with duck excrement. I went to speak to reception at around 11am and was told that it would be cleaned up soon, but hours went by an no cleaner arrived. I went back to complain again as was greeted with 'well I am sorry you feel that way but the ducks were here long before you' and that 'you don't need to worry there is so much chlorine in the pool that you wont catch anything'. I was horrified at the terrible customer service. Eventually my partner went it to complain and was told that the cleaners had gone home and would be back at around 3pm to clean the pool. They eventually arrived at around 4pm. We went out every evening and asked for a taxi and was given the 'house' car which turned out to be 50% more expensive than a taxi. From that night we insisted on a taxi being called for us but the guy was clearly unhappy with this and once he ignored us altogether and called the 'house' car. We refused to get into it on the grounds that it was too expensive and eventually had to get a taxi number from a return journey, call it before we went out and meet it away from the hotel (they would not come to the hotel). There was however one nice gyt and on the day he was on shift he called us a taxi without any issue and didnt even call the 'house' car. I wish I could remember the rude ones name - but he wore glasses and had blonde hair. It is such a shame because the hotel in itself was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: amaze79
Reviews.Content: A little far from the action. The room it self was nice and tidy with a nice balcony. Pool area was really excellent with two jacuzzi's, heated pool and loads of sunbeds. They also have fireplaces with gas/vulcano-stones - where we enjoyed margaritas before dinner. The restaurant however did not impress much. The service was not up to Hilton standards, and the food was'nt all that. The gym is not so big, but well equipt. The steam sauna did'nt get that hot.

Reviews.Title: “Service, especially front desk supervisor William Matthews, was 5-star”
Reviews.Author: billorangecounty
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, along with our daughter's family including her 4 young daughters (ages 2-10), stayed at the resort recently, booking multiple rooms. With multiple rooms, and young children, also comes the worry and stress over our assigned rooms including adjoining rooms, proximity to the pool, etc. On our recent stay, there was a misunderstanding on an early check-in promise made over the phone by one of the younger front desk employees. When we tried to initially check-in, we were told our rooms would not be ready for several hours. William Matthews overheard the conversation, during which I admittedly was annoyed. He stepped in, took control, and did everything I could have asked for, before I even had a chance to think, or ask for anything. During the rest of our one week stay, he repeatedly contacted me to make sure everything was to our satisfaction. Through my work travels, I frequently stay in 5-star hotels throughout the United States. The level of service and professionalism shown by Mr. Matthews was above and beyond the call of duty, and certainly more than could be expected by anyone. This was Spring Break in San Diego, and as one would expect the hotel was very busy. In spite of the demands on his time, he went well out of his way to show he cared about our personal experience. He really made our trip outstanding. We would not consider staying anywhere else in San Diego. I would highly recommend the resort to anyone looking for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not 4-star.”
Reviews.Author: moomooluvr
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on this room at the last minute. It was our 10th anniversary family getaway. I was able to get our room upgraded from a tower room to a villa room with a fire pit thanks to Alyssa at the front desk. The upgraded room was just a little bit bigger than the tower room, but was more to our liking than the tower room (we had 5 of us in the room...my husband and I and our three kids). The room was a dusty and poorly lit and not exactly what I would expect of a 4-star hotel. We wanted to use the fire pit, but the hotel marketplace pricing on wood and a smores kit was WAY over priced ($14.99 for a small bundle of wood and $26 for a smores kit) We had an excellent experience with all of our needs.
