They were prompt to take care of everything we needed and we even checked in early with no issues. On Friday night they had popcorn and a movie playing in the pool area which our kids loved. The grounds looks beautiful, I just wish we took more time to walk around and check everything out. Our only issues with our stay was it seemed like more of a 3.5-star hotel, the parking was quite expensive at $25/night, and there was no wifi. I think we're about 50/50 on staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Customer Service from Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: terrth
Reviews.Content: The location is beautiful. The restaurant and gift shop staff were friendly and helpful. The food was good. The pool area was clean and very pretty. they are on a good walkway for beach walking and there was plenty of sailboats, wave runners and bokes to rent. The room itself wasnt real clean. Room service was quick. My main issue was the Front Desk staff was so rude and had no customer service skills. From the moment I checked in - I felt as if it was an inconvenince for them to assist me. I tried to check in early as I was coming from one San Diego Hilton to another from business to pleasure. The Staff member checked me in and then told me he would call the cleaning crew to see if they would get me into my room early. He took my suitcase and then said he would call me. I waited 3 hours and didnt hear anything. When I called back I got someone else that said they NEVER let anyone check in and I could wait 10 more minutes. I felt I had been lied to. When I went back at check in time - another person made me go through the full check in process again and when I said I already did all of it, he said my credit card was declined..which I knew was not true. When I asked for my luggage I was not even directly responded to...and stood and waited, and had to ask again. When the desk rep gave me my key cards - he didnt even tell me what room number or how to find the room. This is a hotel which is spread out in several buildings. He called a bellboy to help with luggage and as soon as we got outside of the check in area, thebellboy passed me my key and said I could find the room and pointed the way.I struggled with my luggage as he went after what he thought was a better tip.When I got to the room, the maid was just coming out. Seriously! 4 hours later... After leaving this hotel, I realized I left my Kindle in the bottom of the room safe which was ontop of a closet shelf. (I am short and couldnt see what was in it) I called and was forwarded to Security. It took them over 7 hours to call me back. They said the room was occupied and nothing was turned in. When I asked if they could call the room and ask them to take a quick look, I was ignored and told..we have your number if it shows up. Very very lazy...and poor service. My friend called the other Hilton as she lives in the area and misundersstood which hotel I had left my Kindle in..and they called her back in 10 min and actually called the rrom and asked the guests to take a quick look...and then called back again. They were top notch...so it isnt any Hilton..it is just that Hilton that has terrible service. I wouldnt recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Best Memorial Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: couturegal0818
Reviews.Content: The hilton bayfront is the best hotel in the downtown san diego area. I just spent 3 days there for memorial day weekend with my husband and 16 year daughter and let me say that the only bad thing about the trip was that we couldn't stay longer.The pool area is great the fox sports grill is excellent for a nice afternoon dinner.The best thing of all is there customer service they treat everyone like a VIP .Hilton Bayfront ur the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: johntremblay
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, Alyssa greeted us with a big smile that made us feel very welcome. It was a special occasion for our family and with the guidance of William, together they selected the perfect room to meet our needs. As a Hilton Diamond member, I expect excellent service, however Alyssa and William exceeded all of our expectations. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear of this place”
Reviews.Author: Pilotr
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at this disaster of a "Resort". I do extensive traveling for business and am normally very easy to please, but this place compelled me to write this review. I was traveling with my wife and 1.5 year old twin boys. When we made the reservation (knowing we would be arriving late), we asked that two cribs be put in the room. While this was confirmed during our midnight check in, no cribs were in the room. We had to wait an eternity for cribs to be delivered because "all the housekeeping people had gone home". Not a good start. The next morning in the restaurant, we met up with family (who luckily for them were staying elsewhere). After we were seated in the restaurant NO ONE would wait on us. We waited and waited. After asking THREE times for some help, we were told by the only server present that it was not his table, that he had asked someone to help us, and to get any service, we would need to speak to the manager! After speaking with the manager, someone finally showed up, but by then it was beyond annoying. We were gone for most of the day and got back to the room at about 4 pm. The room had not been made up. Because the twins needed a nap, we put them down with the "Do not Disturb" sign on the door. Right after the kids fell asleep THE PHONE RINGS - waking up the kids- and the staff person asks when they can clean our room. They had ALL DAY to clean it but wait till the evening and then ignore the "Do not disturb" sign. Incredible. The $25 dollar parking fee is high, but it would be better if you actually got a space to park in. When we got back to the room at 10 pm the last night, there were no spaces in the entire resort. I drove around for 20 minutes looking for a place to park (with a bunch of other guests). I eventually had to park on the street and hoof it back to the room (a ten minute walk). There is much much more, but I have already wasted too much of my time on a place (like any other Hilton) that I will never stay at again. STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and customer service”
Reviews.Author: bigmow33
Reviews.Content: Hotel was awesome. The location is great for anytime of year. Walk the boardwalk, you have all food, fun, sport in one location. Staff is great all around, especially William at the front desk. He provided great assistance throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place I could spend with my Family”
Reviews.Author: Araik
Reviews.Content: The Best Place I could spend with my Family!! I Enjoyed staying at Hilton! Clean, comfortable and great service. Would love to go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travelnaps
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my wife and 2 year old daughter. The rooms were great, the staff was very friendly, and the location was ideal. They have a great pool deck with a small pool for little children. The little pool is only 1 foot deep and it allows little children to play away from the bigger kids. We took our daughter to Sea World which was about a 5 minute drive away. As you can imagine, a 2 year old needs to nap. It was so nice to just be able to return to the hotel, have my daughter nap, and then return to Sea World. The hotel is also located just a few minutes from Old Town. We went to Old Town for lunch and it was a great place to walk and spend a few hours. I must admit, it is a little expensive to stay there and the $25 dollar a night parking fee is a bit excessive. There were a lot of cars and it was difficult at times to get a parking spot. For that kind of money, a parking space should be designated. We will definetly be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Katielynnh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hilton with 2 teenagers and a 5 year old. It was perfect. The hotel is located in an easily accessed area. Less than 10 minutes to most areas. Also it's located on mission bay which has all kinds of activities. You could stay at the hotel without going anywhere and have plenty of things to do. The hotel property is well maintained. There is a ton of outdoor seating throughout. There is a poolside bar but I couldn't figure out what their hours were, sometimes it was open sometimes it wasn't. The pool area was relaxing. We spent a lot of time there. They had a "dive in movie", popcorn and all. I saw some families ordered pizza for it and sat by the fire pit. Great idea. The coffee shop in the morning was good. We ate there several times. The Acqua restaurant was fantastic. I topped at the hotel shop nearly everyday, very convenient, a little overpriced, but worth it to not have to go elsewhere. We stayed in the tower, bay side, although we couldn't see the bay from our balcony. Not a problem though since we didn't spend much time in the room except for sleeping. The beds were very comfortable, the room and bathroom standard hotel size. Housekeeping did an excellent job taking care of us. The 25$ parking fee seems overpriced. You will want a car in San Diego and there is no where else to park near the hotel so they are taking advantage of you there. I bought my room on Hotwire and saved a lot of money that way, makes up for the parking I guess. I would stay here again. My 14 year old daughter said she wants to get married there, LOL.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape for the family”
Reviews.Author: SFWorld
Reviews.Content: Anytime I see the word "resort" I immediately think of something bigger than what many resorts can deliver. For me, resort means offering everything you need on the property for a complete vacation. If you use that idea then this property is certainly a full service hotel but not a resort. So before I go too far and you think this is a terrible hotel let me say we would go back. It's just that you need to temper your expectations. This is not a luxury resort. It's a very nice hotel in a good location (near Sea World and on the bay) that fits well with families with young children. There is a small kiddie pool (1 foot deep) and the main pool only gets to 5 feet deep and is 3 feet deep in most places- so our 4 year old had a great time by just avoiding the middle of the pool. It also draws a family crowd so he had plenty of kids to mess around with whenever he was poolside. Their kids camp is only offered in the summer months (another reason they are not a resort in my opinion) so that was not available, making the poolside encounters that much more important. As we experienced with HIlton in Hawaii we do wish they would put a bit more heat in their heated pools- it was not ice cold as it was in Hawaii but it could have been a bit warmer to make staying in a bit easier. They also had a great food option for those not wanting the full service restaurant: a 7-day happy hour with half price starters and drinks. It made grabbing a quick meal each evening much more affordable and was certainly good enough for us on several occasions. The issue is there is only the 1 restaurant and the bar area so leaving the property was inevitable unless you are really a creature of habit or just there for a long-weekend. Where is the hotel lacking? First, they charge $25/day for self parking. This is essentialy a suburban hotel so that struck me as way too expensive. Second, our expectation of the beach was quite different than the reality- it's not a sit out and sun yourself beach- it's a narrow strip of sand separated from the hotel by the bay-side walking/biking trail (the trail was a nice feature for getting out of the hotel). The rooms are spacious enough and in good (but not great) shape. The TV was new but the signal sketchy if you touched it. The two reading lights besides the beds didn't work at all and the chain on the lamp by the window pulled off on Night 1 (thankfully in the 'off' position). They also went a bit too far with the cheap flourescent bulb in the can light near the doorway which gave a harsh light when it was turned on (and was the only light in the room besides 2 lamps) that made us prefer to leave it off- and we were down to 1 table lamp for the whole room. They would fix things as you called- but you had to call. The shower on/off handle clearly looked like it was added on when the original one broke as it simply didn't look like it belonged there. They also have the old, what I call atomic toilets whose sound resonates for several floors - you will know when your neighbors above have gone to the bathroom and only a sound sleeper can sleep through a toilet flush in the room. So a bit more attention to detail would be nice. But the rooms are comfortable (though with the usual glut of pillows on the beds) and spacious enough. They also have two other features I wish they highlighted more clearly: refrigerators and an in-room safe. Being able to stock the small fridge was great but we were not aware it was there when booking. The safe is always nice given how much we just seem to have that has some value. The food was fine- good not great. It met our needs but we headed for other places just for variety. The larger number of CPK and other food boxes/bags suggested others felt the same way. It was nice to have poolside bar service though we found it odd in this day and age that the female servers were blonde and in short-shorts and short-sleeved shirts while the men practically had no skin showing besides their hands and faces. It's not offensive to me but it is a bit too obvious to go overlooked. So for a good hotel in a great location consider this property. It's not a value option by any means but it was a nice, comfortable base for our 7 days in San Diego. Hopefully they can smooth out some of the rough edges and it could be a really great place.

Reviews.Title: “LIARS!”
Reviews.Author: Zandronovo
Reviews.Content: The front desk people are liars! First we booked thru the web and never informed us of the parking fee for $25???? So we talked to one of the front desk lady and she told us she'll Just charge us $25 for 2 nights We just complied and out of trust we nod. When we checked out, we were surprised to see that they still charged us 25/night! We talked to this guy WILLIAM at the front desk and told us he'll call the lady that we spoke to about the discount and he just acted as if he was calling but actually did not!!! Please stay away from these LARS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: Zaydo
Reviews.Content: We were there for an amazing party hosted by Austin Campbell w/ Sola Salons. Beautiful day. Beautiful people. Beautiful hotel. Everything was taken care of by the staff which was very professional and friendly. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing”
Reviews.Author: Maria32296
Reviews.Content: Just got back from having our conference at this hotel and it was amazing. The staff (Maribel, the banquet captains, Swank AV, William at the front desk, Nick at the pool) was amazing. The location of this hotel is beautiful, the rooms are nice especially if you get a bayfront. Everybody commented on how much they enjoyed their stay. I had a lot of people with different requests and the staff here did everyrthing they could to accomodate everybody. I would definately recommend this hotel. Cant wait to come back and enjoy this hotel on personal time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great facility,Hilton should be ashamed.”
Reviews.Author: Jgitto
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't want to spend much time on this. So here it goes: Service Sucked! They didn't know which way they were going, they didn't seem to know who was in charge. Some highlights pool wasn't heated to any level of comfort. Room service left our old trays with half eaten food outside our room for two days. I'm done.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay . . .”
Reviews.Author: megkfrank
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hilton Resort San Diego. The hotel was fine. Nothing too special. I enjoyed the grounds and the freedom my children had in running around. We especially enjoyed roasting marshmallows in the fire pits on the bay. The pool was nice, but it was pretty cool while we were there, so we didn't spend much time there. The rooms were OK as well. Definitely, an older property, but with some updates. My first room had hair all over the shower. The hotel promptly moved me to a new room with a better view. I certainly appreciated it. The new room however, had a broken TV. Once again they were very prompt in fixing it. All in all an OK hotel, but I probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - OVERRATED!”
Reviews.Author: rjung10
Reviews.Content: It was a decent hotel. Definitely not a 4 star in my opinion (a 3.5 star at best). The cost of parking alone made my experience go from "bleh" to "I'm never staying here again unless it's free or significantly cheaper!" The rooms were dirty and I had incredible mucus production from the dust in the room (yes - that is meant to sound gross). Some staff were 'ok' but there was one who couldn't speak English and another who was very rude to me personally. There wasn't a very resort-like feel to this property so needless to say, I won't be staying here again. I can't believe that I paid 50 bucks for parking for the 2 nights I was there. If I stayed longer (which I was considering but quickly came to my senses), that would have been $125 for 5 days - when did Mission Bay turn into Manhattan!!! Space is not at a premium here so my problem is with the price of parking, not the actual fact that they are charging. And is it just me or is it that whenever I get a deal through priceline, I NEVER get the free upgrades that everyone in front of me and behind me in line was getting.

Reviews.Title: “Service is excellent, location is perfect.”
Reviews.Author: CMarvinGallo
Reviews.Content: My tween son and I came down to San Diego to visit museums, and local attractions. We planned to stay here for a couple days and ending up extending our stay because the hotel is beautiful and the service is exceptional. We have a great room overlooking the bay. As a Hilton Honors member I typically receive great treatment, but I was very impressed that they had upgraded our room when I arrived. For the room rate, I was expecting to stay in a room with no view at the back of the grounds (this would have been ok), but we were given the choice of 2 rooms, both with a bay view. Everyone we have encountered has been welcoming, the rooms are upgraded and spacious, the grounds are beautiful and the value can't be beat. The only thing I didn't give 5 stars to is cleanliness. The rooms in the "wing" we are staying in are upgraded and clean, but the hallway can use a paint job and new carpet. It looks a bit dingy, but really no big deal. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “A Tremendous Long Weekend at the Hilton Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixDesertstar
Reviews.Content: We arrived Saturday expecting little. On departure we raved we could not return quicker. The Villa Garden Room was enchanting. The few request we had were immediately granted by the gracious staff. We lingered at the bar during happy hour enjoying the ambiance and the fun crowd watching the NCAA tournament. We lounge by the pool , and the evening viewed the spectacular fireworks and fired Smores in the beach. By the way the bed was the best we ever slept.

Reviews.Title: “Best room ever!”
Reviews.Author: kp350
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors member, I was hoping for a reward upgrade when I arrived at the resort. William, the desk supervisor who helped me, hooked me up with the most amazing villa, private fire pit by the beach and all! Thanks, William, you're the best! Great food, wonderful service, I'll be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: SnapDragon777
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hilton for a quick family getaway to Seaworld for the weekend. The plan was to arrive on Friday afternoon and leave Monday late morning for a return to LA. After getting to the hotel, it was clear that we would leave on Sunday morning after Seaworld. The hotel was very uncomfortable and not up to expectations. While the room seemed to have been updated with new furniture: modern style headboards and flatscreen TV, the mattresses were old and uncomfortable and the room smelled heavily of mold. The carpets had a gross damp feeling and the balcony railing paint was old and chipping. The walls were paper thin - I could hear the next door neighbor so well that I was forced to keep my television on while we slept! This hotel is in severe need of a real makeover. I would definitely not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort for both business and pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: krindell
Reviews.Content: Recently visited the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa for a site visit for future business meetings and was pleasantly surprised with the meeting rooms and the layout of the resort. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained - overlooking the water and Fiesta Island. Also, had a WONDERFUL lunch at Aqua on their outdoor patio. Great food and reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel & Resort perfect for a family vacation or business trip”
Reviews.Author: fabs92130
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa for a business lunch. I was so impressed with the customer service provided by all staff members that I felt compelled to write a review to give them kudos for caring so much. During my visit, I was even greeted by the hotel's General Manager and Director of Sales. Wow, they make time to greet business people who visit the property! I asked for a tour to familiarize myself with their hotel, and was able to see a room in one of the towers. The view is amazing and could imagine watching the fireworks from one of these rooms during the summer season (think Sea World Fireworks, the best I've seen). The room decor was contemporary and nice. I'm very picky and dislike old carpets in hotels. This is not that kind of propety at all. What I liked the best, is how nice, clean, flat and calm is the ocean water in front of this hotel. This is the perfect place for a family wtih kids since it offers privacy and a calm beach front. This is completely the opposite of those busy beaches in Mission Beach. They also offer rooms with fire pits, which I think would be the best because I have boys and we love doing this kind of thing. if you eat at their main restaurant, the food is amazing, and their tuna tartare is delicious, you must try it! I highly reccommend this resort for anyone who wants to relax for a few days and disconnect from a hectic life. I know I'm coming back and bringing my family next time.

Reviews.Title: “Surly receptionist, lack of decent lounge/bar”
Reviews.Author: JOHUk
Reviews.Content: Checked in by very friendly receptionist and was given an upgrade so that we were near the pool, which the kids loved. The corridor to the room was a bit grim and I was a bit apprehensive but our room was small but nice. Next day asked different receptionist for details on the trolley bus tour and she basically threw a leaflet at me and grunted that we'd already missed it! Breakfast was included in our package and was good and the staff were very friendly and helpful. In the evening the one bar was very dimly lit and short on space, it really did seem to small for a hotel this size. If I was visiting San Diego again, I think I would definitely stay closer to the city as this hotel is a good car ride out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Meeting Venue with a Lovely Resort Feel!”
Reviews.Author: trihud
Reviews.Content: I am a meeting planner who plans meetings all over the country and I love to have my events at the Hilton SD Resort! I plan medical meetings for lab techs and doctors and the venue satifies both the needs of our physicians who travel with their families and our techs who are usually single female attendees. The accomodations are lovely, the staff is friendly with great can-do attitudes, and the meeting rooms are just what we need. I have planned multiple events at the Hilton SD Resort and will continue to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue and customer service”
Reviews.Author: WA1_2011
Reviews.Content: The staff at Hilton San Diego made our visit one to remember. Great customer service, food and facilities! Would highly recommend utilizing for company events/meetings. The hotel planner, Kelly, and our conference coordinator, Maribel, made the process easy!

Reviews.Title: “Thank You for your Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: SDAngie1983
Reviews.Content: In the past year our family has stayed at the Los Angeles (airport) Hilton, The Anaheim Hilton, the Torrey Pines Hilton and most recently the Hilton on Mission Bay. I just wanted to comment that the Hilton on Mission Bay was by far the most enjoyable experience of the four. The room and view were awesome, however the courtesy shown by all your staff was greatly appreciated. Your hotel would be first on my list to recommend to all my friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend rendevous”
Reviews.Author: supataco
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel personal. Really nice, courteous and professional. Our interaction with the front desk staff was also very friendly and quick service. they gave us good directions to our suite to make it easy to get to. the room was perfect. we had a bayfront suite. the view was amazing and the size and comfort of the room was undescribable. it was fully furnished and clean. i would highly recommend the bayfront view rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Great restaurant!!!”
Reviews.Author: ammcclin123
Reviews.Content: I have lived in San Diego my whole life and never once been to the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa, man have I been missing out! The hotel itself was goregous, right on the beach with a beautiful pool and many fire pits. In addition the beautiful grounds, the hotel has an amazing restaurant. The food was fabulous, I have not one complaint about it. If you are planning on eating there ever i highly reccomend the Tuna Tartar. All in all I would say this is an awesome hotel to stay at if you are visting San Diego or a native like myself!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing resort to hold your conference!”
Reviews.Author: japanwoman
Reviews.Content: A few years I started researching a location for our yearly Fitness Symposium. After thoroughly investigating the options in San Diego, I was pleased to find and contract the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa. While every square foot of this property is stunningly gorgeous, you actually feel like you have escaped to your own private island, and yet you are conveniently located less than ten miles from the trendy downtown Gaslamp location. Now, I work for a non-profit company which has extremely high standards, so I have a "Champagne taste on a beer budget" as the saying goes. Even with my tight budget guidelines, they were able to work with me to meet my budget on everything to include my room block, food and beverage, meeting space and audio visual needs at the minimum. They also worked to add numerous added values for my group to definitely encourage our attendees to stay at the hosted conference property. So, while they seemed to make everything look great and seem smoothless in the walk through and had lots of promises as to great customer service, what would happen once the event took place? Well, as they say, "The proof is in the pudding." I could not have hoped for a better experience from an event planning prospective all the way to my conference attendees experience. They distinguish themselves through their customer service. Every single staff member from the Director to a front line food and beverage staff is attentive, a sense of urgency, and was never ONCE annoyed or put off my more than abundant requests. And I had a lot of them. I would also have to comment on the professionalism, welcoming nature, flexibility, great sense of genuineness and attention to detail my Conference Services Manager had. Every planning meeting I had with her was extremely enjoyable and put me at ease for my extremely important event. This experience was so great we not only had our event there in 2009, but in 2010 as well. I am extremely grateful. Thank you for helping to make our event one that our attendees will never forget. Kerrie Smith, American Council on Exercise Event Marketing Manager

Reviews.Title: “A chill zen like extension of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this resort for an extended period (approximately four weeks) and combine the ambiance that is San Diego with the chill aura if this hotel and you have a winner. Â Our manager Justin McCabe was very accommodating to our work group and the entire staff made this a highly enjoyable stay during my offside assignment. Â I found the staff to be very eager to make my stay a perfect 10. I stayed in room 310 the entire stay which opens up to a beautiful stretch of Mission Bay. Â Night was my favorite time to chill in my little pod chair next to a blazing fire pit- awesome zen like experience.Â  It is a spectacular location but you should be prepared to have a car. Â It is an expansive resort but not easily accessible by public transportation to the sights and sounds of Downtown San Diego. Â I'm an Hhonors Gold member and would not hesitate staying there again. Â And Justin if you're reading this- thanks again for everything you did to accommodate us during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: runningaround_456
Reviews.Content: I traveled to San Diego to participate in an athletic event. I had gotten the group rate (for 2 queens) and as I was alone, I was upgraded to a king room, complete with a kitchenette and patio. It was a very beautiful room (a bit of cork on the floor, so not immaculate, but very clean) and I had a nice view. The bed was very comfortable and the room was quite large. I was sad that I only got to stay one night as it was near the "adult spa" with a hot tub and I didn't get to use it! I dined with a friend at the on-site restaurant as we were both car-less and the food and the dining experience were both excellent. Granted, I got a great deal on the rate as part of the event, but it really was a lovely hotel and I was sorry to leave so soon. I had a great nice of sleep and would have enjoyed a longer stay and someone to share it with!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVE this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleepyforestcottages
Reviews.Content: We love to stay here. It is absolutely beautiful and beyond expectations. We stayed with our family and a friends family and had 2 rooms facing the bay. Out the back doors were fire pits, huge comfy chairs, a huge beautiful lawn and the water. When we arrived we got some wood bundles and smores kits for the fire. Less than 5 minute drive to Sea World! The service is great, and the kids LOVED the pool and spa. Beautiful area, our favorite to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding time”
Reviews.Author: cfcreative
Reviews.Content: As local San Diegans, we've been coming to Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa for many years and have always had a fantastic experience. Even though San Diego is paradise, once you step foot on the property, you feel like you're in a whole other tropical destination. Rooms are clean and contemporary, service is superb and the dining is exceptional. We especially like the pool area as it's perfect for the whole family. Because of it's particular location, there are no other resorts close and the beach almost seems private since it's tucked away, behind Island. We can wait to be back...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for a National Sales Meeting with a little fun on the side!”
Reviews.Author: cocolick
Reviews.Content: We hosted our annual sales meeting at this location in January. The weather was great, particularly loved by our East Coasters currently living in inclement weather. The conference center is centrally located with a variety of room sizes to fit various needs. We had a number of role playing scenarios in which we needed to customize the layout of each of our rooms. They were very accommodating and instrumental in supplying additional furniture needed. The food is NOT your typical "hotel' food. I cannot express how important this is when you're hosting a 5-day meeting. The onsite restaurants/snack shops (Aqua and Aroma) were nice options as well. Great wine makes people happy! The hotel staff from AV, catering, concierge, etc., were always present, ready, and willing to assist as needed. A great bunch of high energy folks! It really attributes to the success of a meeting. The beach front property (Garden by the Bay) was gorgeous and was the point location for our volleyball team building event. The food was catered by the hotel, again very tasty. The hotel partners with a company called Arrangements Unlimited. We used them to plan and facilitate this event as well as for ground transportation to bus our team to and from the Gaslamp for a night out on the town. Lastly, after all that, you cannot come here and not go to the spa...I get relaxed just thinking about them!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Galileo321
Reviews.Content: I really liked staying in this hotel; it was clean, luxurious, wonderful bed, sheets, pillows. The only issue I had was that I was charged $25.00 for parking unexpectedly. I called down to the front desk in the morning after I saw the bill slipped under my door. They said I initialed it the night before. I stated I was never told I was being charged $25.00 to park in this hotel. It wasn't until I called Hilton, that the manager was kind enough to remove the untold charge. He was kind and courteous, but it wasn't the initial response.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly, for a "resort" it is just ok...”
Reviews.Author: Pharmrep79
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego "Resort"...what can I say---I wasn't impressed. Overall, there is nothing inherently wrong with the resort, but it just underwhelmed me. First, off the pictures on the website made it look as though this resort was on the ocean proper. Yeah, I guess if you look really closely and read very carefully you will be able to discern that the water in the pictures is from more of a river that is located behind the hotel. Just know---this is not the ocean. The water is dead still and the beach isn't that great. Yeah, they have boats and things to rent, but the water is pretty unimpressive, unless you have never been to a real ocean before. The Hilton is located in the middle of a large park, as well, so there are plenty of people around and the walkways are filled with people riding bikes--not very nice to walk on (good for riding bikes though). The grounds look pretty nice, so I can give that a plus. The pool seemed too small for the resort, and though it was nice, is guaranteed to be crowded, all the time. This is a pretty good area to check out some beach bodies, however. I am a Hilton Diamond VIP and though I wasn't treated poorly, I never felt as though I was being treated any different than the average Joe, despite the hundred plus nights I stay at Hilton properties yearly. This is ok for a Hampton Inn, but at a resort I feel as though this is a bit of an insult. The hotel check in time is 4pm, which is fine, but I tried to check in about 45 minutes early, and was told that the room wasn't ready and that it was a nice room and that i should wait and they will call me when it was ready. Other people were checking in and going to their rooms, so I thought "this must be a really nice room and I am getting upgraded like I should be given my Diamond status". I wait till 4pm and they call me to let me know my room is ready. I go to the room and it is just a regular room (#406 on 02/12/11-02/13/11)!!! No different than any other Hilton hotel in the U.S. No different than any other regular room in the hotel, except that the outside area, which are nice and have a couch/bed thing, is connected to another rooms outside area, because we are a corner room! The building we are in is shaped like an L, and our room and the room next to us are on opposing sides of the inside of the elbow. So our outside area is virtually unusable, unless you like being that close to your neighbor with no separating feature (the rest of the rooms have a wall). That was a disappointment, especially after I waited thinking I was getting an upgrade to a "nice room". The room wasn't bad, again standard Hilton, but wasn't "special", I expected more from a "resort" though. It was particularly noisy, however. It seemed to have a "water running through pipes" sound that never ceased, even at night. Anytime anyone walked by and was talking we heard the conversation loud and clear, because the front door had qaurted inch gaps on all sides between it and the jamb. Not a big deal in warm San Diego, but not a good sound dampening system. There is only one restaurant (that I found--the hotel info book is useless), which is the same as any other Hilton. We ate breakfast at the restaurant, "Acqua" (Diamond VIPs get free breakfast, which is nice), and it was really pretty good, so I can't complain there. You will need a car, though, if you plan on eating anything that isn't $30 a course. I wasn't charged for parking, but you are normally supposed to pay, and so I give them credit for not charging me, I guess that makes up for any other lack of VIP benefit. We also were given two bottles of water at check-in for being VIP members, so again they did give me some benefits. This hotel is nice for what it is---a hotel, but as far as being a resort, just know that it has that title predominantly because it has a spa. I probably wouldn't recommend it unless you got a great deal and you just need a place to stay,---like a regular Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, very relaxing accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: traveler0000043
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this property. It is very comfortable, easy to access, and the staff is most accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “The Hilton San Diego is like going back home every time I visit”
Reviews.Author: fionahendricks
Reviews.Content: I have personally been using this resort for 14 years booking conferences. I have worked with the same wonderful staff and know that the service and quality will be consistent. The location is a nice change from being downtown yet easily accessible. Feels like you are also on vacation and has great walking trails close by. Highly recommend the resort for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “the hilton resort offered the right combination of luxury and comfort.”
Reviews.Author: mheskin
Reviews.Content: i recently stayed at the hilton resort for a week to host a business function. the resort staff was extremely accommodating prior to my arrival and throughout the week. they did everything in their power to ensure our meetings occurred smoothly and never hesitated to assist at any given moment. the resort grounds were lovely and the the views of the water in the background were very nice. the aqua and olive restaurants served delicious meals. i hope to return and enjoy the resort when i'm not there on business.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cheriecrafts
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this Hotel numerous times and have enjoyed it everytime! The rooms, the pool, the surrounding, are perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in SD”
Reviews.Author: BobbyC71
Reviews.Content: I love the SD Hilton Resort and SPA. The rooms are wonderful, the staff is very professional and the property has a real resort feel. If you don't want to be locked in a box all day during your meetings go to the SD Hilton Resort and SPA

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business and Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: tdiomede
Reviews.Content: My company does 50 big conferences/yr and we just wrapped up 1 at this hotel this week and am in the process of planning our next for week long event in March. We do about 3-4 events/yr at the Hilton SD Resort because we Can. The Service, Meeting Staff, Space, Leisure Atmosphere all add to the Amazing Experience for our Events. We look forward to booking each & every SD conf. we do at the Resort because we know not only will it be seemless for us meeting planners but the attendees will Love it too... I Highly Recommend this property to Anyone looking to travel here on business or Pleasure. It Truly is a welcome oasis especially to anyone looking to escape the brutal winter alot of us are experiencing in many parts of the country.

Reviews.Title: “Unique business and incentive travel location in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: latinlee
Reviews.Content: As a corporate conference director, I did a site visit to check them out at their location right on San Diego's Mission Bay. Although the hotel is only a few minutes from the airport and SeaWorld on Interstate 5, it is a quiet, even idyllic property that is one of maybe a hand full in San Diego that is right on the water. The function space has what most lack in San Diego, which is windows with a view of the bay and the palm trees around the large location. Even though it is a mega-sized location in terms of number of guest rooms, it is spread out among several buildings covering a lot of lush gardens so it doesn't have the feel of an urban conference hotel. I like the sleeping rooms and the fitness center, but I really enjoyed the food, which is sort of California-Spa-Austrian (their executive chef is apparently from Austria and has a nice wine collection.) The only draw back I could see is that I was eyeing the tennis court, the pool bar and rental boats -- not to mention the spa -- and might be tempted to bug out on meetings (if I weren't the one organizing them!)

Reviews.Title: “Service and hospitality impeccably delivered”
Reviews.Author: Sharon010244
Reviews.Content: I would like to express my gratitude to my conference mgr., banquet mgr. and conference room set up staff. Your service and hospitality was impeccably delivered with friendliness and expediency. Every issue was addressed with a "can do" attitude and resolved to my complete satisfaction. It truly was a pleasure doing business with you and your wonderful staff. Thank you for a very successful conference.

Reviews.Title: “Our visit to the Hilton San Diego made our trip to Southern CA perfect!”
Reviews.Author: GansettTravelers
Reviews.Content: We traveled from the East Coast to visit San Diego and stayed at the Hilton San Diego. We selected this hotel because of the excellent location to all the area attractions like Sea World, the San Diego Zoo and Lego Land. From the moment we arrived to the resort staff offered friendly and professional service to us. Our guestroom was attractive and comfortable with wonderful access to the entire resort & mission bay area. I would highly recommend this property to family or individual guest traveling to San Diego. The Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa made our visit to Southern California memorable and relaxing. We look forward to a return visit in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great Views & Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: guesswhati
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe the beauty of this property. Great Sunsets from your beachside lanai. A fantastic Pool with Cabanas and a faux Beach entrance to the pool The staff under the management of William does everything to accomodate the guests. No task is too small you are left to ffeel very special and important.

Reviews.Title: “The overall quality and service at this hotel is unbeatable! I can see why groups want to bring their business here!”
Reviews.Author: vthein
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel often and hold many conferences here. The service is excellent! You couldn't ask for a better catering and banquet staff. They anticipate your needs and help you create the perfect event. The sales staff is wonderful to work with. They work with any budget and put together a contract that is win-win for both sides. They are flexible if dates need to be changed and will work with you on any addendums. The hotel is conveniently located on the 5 freeway and is only 15 minutes from the airport. The hotel rooms are new, clean and comfortable. I love the decor! The property is very serene and calming and in a beautiful location in Mission Bay. The executive chef is amazing! The restuarant is upscale and trendy yet reasonably priced. The banquet food is just as great! I can't wait until my next event there this year!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property! Amazing food! Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: nocturnal00
Reviews.Content: We have several conferences at the Hilton San Diego Resort and I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this property. The staff are so helpful, friendly and accommodating. The restaurant has amazing food because Chef Herman prepares delicious and healthy food which can be enjoyed with a beautiful view of the water. The location is right along the bay and has a great running path which goes along the entire bay. I would highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “If you don't have a car don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: jmacnamara
Reviews.Content: If you don't have a car this hotel may not be for you, there is no public transport nearby, we had to take a taxi every day to the transit centre to catch the trolley into San Diego city centre (the roads are far to busy to walk-we tried it) thepublic areas of the resort are lovely, clean and well maintained, the rooms weren't quite the same. Although cleaned to a high standard every day there was chipped paintwork, loose plug sockets that sparked when you tried to remove plugs, lamps with the on/off switches hanging off. the beds are really comfortable and clean. The coffee shop was only open on the weekends although the hotel was busy when we stayed there, the staff in there and in the gift shop were really friendly and helpful, more so than the concierge who only seemed interested in selling trips or car hire. The bar service was great and the food lovely. The location spoilt it for us, we had been told it was a central location, and it is if you drive.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DrTom47
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here for a week. This very special hotel has wonderful amenities (including fine food) and great staff. Its attractive location is easy access to wherever you want to go in San Diego or further up the coast.. We'll book there again without looking elsewhere. It's a Mecca worth discovering!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations - great stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: maryann11
Reviews.Content: My husband & I decided to take a trip to San Diego as our Christmas present to each other and our two children, who are 20 & 26 years old. We booked two rooms at the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa as part of a Southwest Vacation package, and we stayed from 1/1/11 to 1/6/11. Our package included two free nights per room, which turned out to be a great deal. I was completely satisfied with our room accomodations, and would highly recommend the Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa. When we checked in, our room was not quite ready, as it was early in the afternoon. The young lady at the desk asked for our cell phone number and told us they would call when our room was ready. She gave us a key we could use to look around the hotel property, then we headed for Balboa Park. When we got back at 4:00 p.m., we had not received a call, so I just assumed they forgot to call. Actually, the room still wasn't ready, so they upgraded us to a better room! We got a very spacious room on the second floor of one of the wings with a great view of the ocean. We thought it might be noisy, because I-5 is very close to the hotel, but our room was exceptionally quiet. The boys had a room on the first floor which wasn't quite as spacious as ours, but still had a great ocean view. The beds were awesomely comfortable - I slept like a baby. We had one minor maintenance issue (the bathroom door squeaked which was annoying when we had to get up at night), but that was quickly resolved when I told the folks at the front desk. The property was lovely. Even though it was unseasonably cold in San Diego, the boys used the pool (which was heated nicely, according to them) and the hot tub, which they really enjoyed. I used the fitness center, which was nicely appointed with treadmills & ellipticals and weight equipment. I struck up a conversation with a local woman who was on another elliptical, and she told me that she had a membership to the fitness center there. It is pretty upscale. It even had a changing room with a sauna, lockers with digital locks and showers. There were plenty of towels. We did not eat at the hotel, but I did get coffee and danish at the coffee shop by the registration area. I waited in line for about 15-20 minutes to get my breakfast items - that was the only thing I would say could have been improved. There was only one gentleman working behind the counter, and although he was friendly, he seemed a bit overwhelmed. There was a steady stream of people waiting. There was a $25/day fee for parking, but since I knew about it and was expecting it, there was no surprise. Because the hotel was right by I-5, we were able to easily access all parts of the city with our rental car, so we explored from Coronado and points south to Torrey Pines State Reserve to Temeculah and the wine country north of San Diego. We had a wonderful trip to San Diego, and the hotel stay was part of it. I would certainly stay there again, and I would also go back to San Diego. It is a lovely town with friendly people and a more small-town feel to it than other major cities in California.

Reviews.Title: “They tried to make it newer but it didn't work.”
Reviews.Author: oualumni
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was probably one of the best in the hotel (the villas on the waterfront with a firepit.) Although the room had recently been redone, it was obvious that they spent money only on a superficial redo. For one thing they should have revamped the air ducts because it smelled old. Also,as you walked through the hallways, it looked and smelled old and my husband said that he happened to look in an open door of the housekeeping only to see paint peeling off the walls and dirty, dirty floors, etc. The grounds have not been groomed. The palm trees have not been groomed for years. We built a fire in the firepit and roasted marshmallows. (Advice, go to a nearby grocery store to buy firewood, they don't provide any, although you would expect them to for $270/night.) If you must stay here then definitely stay in the waterfront villas, but if you have a choice, don't stay here at all. It is hard to find a hotel in San Diego that is not old and run down, but listen to TripAdisor because there are obviously a few. We will listen to the reviews next time. Three cars got broken into while we were there only two nights. The restaurant was good, and the only bright spot. Hilton needs to invest a lot here or just throw in the towel. We will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and location, but daily parking fee of $25 day was excessive.”
Reviews.Author: gr8deals99
Reviews.Content: I booked hotel on priceline and generally was pleased with the facility. However, it was not until I arrived at the hotel that I learned of the mandatory $25/day parking fee which was clearly excessive. I thought such a large daily fee should be clearly stated by priceline prior to proceeding with the transaction. While I understand the possible need to charge for parking in the summer months, the hotel was dead when I visited and was clearly just a revenue grab by the hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Wished we had stayed one more night”
Reviews.Author: 4ComoxTravelers
Reviews.Content: The room was larger than expected, with a separate sunken kitchenette area by the patio door. We were in a first floor villa which was supposed to be oceanfront, but was set back about 4 rooms from the actual ocean. Still a very nice location. What a beautiful spot and we would have like to stay longer to enjoy the surrounding area more. Beds were very comfy. Bathroom was lacking a fan and there was no separate area to get ready in the morning which is always nice. We didn't eat at the restaurant, although the fire pits outside seemed very inviting. We did order room service which was prompt and quite good. The recommendations on dining locations were excellent. We ate at Caffe Bella Italia, The Broken Yolk, and Perry's Cafe. The free WiFi available in the lobby was not adequate during our stay. It was incredibly slow, however, the fee for in-room internet was a rip-off, especially considering it was per device. With a laptop and 2 iPhones, it was not an option. Luckily the lobby receptionist came to our aid when we were trying to check-in for our flights (thank you!). Parking is also expensive and a definite consideration when staying here. Honestly, I would rather have internet and parking included in the room rate than feel 'nickel-and-dimed' for everything. And considering these don't cost the hotel much, why are they charging for them at all? In Canada, WiFi and parking are usually free which seems more progressive. We enjoyed our stay here and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Need to make some changes”
Reviews.Author: pskart
Reviews.Content: The experience starts out badly when you are informed at check in that there is a $25 per night parking fee. This feels like a low-class scam, not something you expect from a higher end hotel. They also need to join the 21st century and get free Wi-Fi in the rooms. Many devices are no longer able to connect with an ethernet cable. Even cheap Econo-Lodge hotels have this feature. How hard can it be? The free breakfast is nothing special and comes with surly service. On the upside, the rooms are nice and clean and the grounds and pool area well kept and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, 3 Star Motel at best, Older property, Much better places elsewhere/by the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: osharke
Reviews.Content: ALL YOU NEED TO KNOW PROS ===== (1) Good central location for San Diego activities. Easy access to I-5 within minutes. (2) Nice Pool (3) Well manicured grounds (4) Friendly check-in hotel & maintenance staff (5) Parking in front of the room is very convenient (6) Starbucks on resort property is a plus (7) Maid service was first rate (leave a small tip each day, it is the right thing to do) CONS ===== (1) Not a true 4(four) star hotel, 3(three) at best as this is an older place that does show it's age. Bathroom are the worst, mold/grime is clearly visible on the caulking and ceiling; the need to be gutted. Upon room review, make sure to check the bathroom first and immediately request a different room at the first sign of disrepair! (2) Parking is ridiculous at $25 a night. Even if this place had a 24-hour security guard/gate it still would not be worth it. Hilton take note, Disneyland charges $15 dollars a day and they have FULL security with cameras, come on, get with it. Stop gouging us!!!! Had to budget around this cost all week, dissapointing! (3) Restaurant albeit good, WAY too expensive. NOTE: if parking were less, perhaps it could be justified. (4) Extra cost for the exercise room, nonsense for a supposed 4(four) star hotel this should be included. (5) Bay is not that pretty at all; very murky resembles more of a retention pond. Having a bay view just is not worth it....don't pay for it. NOTE: this place is not near the OCEAN, don't be fooled! (6) There were bugs in the rooms, several small spider bugs and pinchers were present. FINAL THOUGHTS =============== (1) Hotel staff during my entire 8(eight) day stay never bothered to call to check in and see if everything was ok. Very poor customer service. Four(4) star hotels are concerned with their guests comfort.....didn't seem like they were interested. (2) If you can get room for $70/80 a night, it is ok, otherwise pass on this place as there are much better places to stay in the San Diego area (Imperial (Cornado), Mission and Solana beaches, LaJolla, Carsbad, Del Mar and or Oceanside. (3) Ask for a Villa instead of the tower, you will be much happier.

Reviews.Title: “So Bad I had to sign up and write a "Trip Report" Hilton DIAMOND Member”
Reviews.Author: upinair42
Reviews.Content: First report I have ever written. I am a road warrior, stay 175 plus nights a year in hotel. A Hilton Diamond member this is the WORST Hilton I have ever stayed in. Had to argue with front desk over my Diamond status (they claimed I was only a blue, although I had Diamond card). requested a King received 2 doubles (so much for Diamond privilege). Room was dirty,old,smelly. Front desk was boarder line incompetent and rude, more than one person. Really...Im not that hard to please but this was the worst, all the way around. Only good was pool and bar staff.

Reviews.Title: “Did the big things right but many little things wrong”
Reviews.Author: MaryBluEyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel gets high marks for many things like it's location (very close to Sea World and close to many San Diego neighborhoods) and it's decor (recently renovated and very large rooms). The pool area and fire pits were lovely as was the beach/park access. However, there were a number of annoying things that keeps me from giving them an above average rating like $25 mandatory (self) parking and $12 internet fees per day. There is nothing around it that justifies the need to pay for parking and you certainly didn't get any security to watch your car. As for charging for the internet (wired at that), come on it's 2010 and you're a "resort". The walls are paper thin and we could hear every step in the hall and floor above plus the adjoining room's tv and phone conversation. Also, the concierge was gone by 6pm daily.

Reviews.Title: “I'm very picky and wouldn't stay anywhere else when in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: skyman511
Reviews.Content: As a San Diego native now living in Houston, It was necessary to travel back to San Diego on October 28 to October 31, 2010. I chose to stay on your hotel during these days and was very impressed from the moment I walked in. Admittedly the entire staff, including those in the restaurant took away the California stigma we Texanâ€™s have on Calif. They even reheated a pizza bought from somewhere else and put it in a box for me. While this may seem trivial, it was not to me. The Manager, Mr. Villarino was outstanding and always checked on us. We felt welcome from the first moment we arrived. He even made sure the bar stayed open late on the evening of our arrival, this is usually unheard of. (There was several people in our party ) The firepits in front of our rooms were cleaned out every evening, I will recommend this Hotel to anyone from now on. Thank you very much for running a business the way it should be run.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not great”
Reviews.Author: WtoCtoTO
Reviews.Content: We ended up staying at this hotel because it was selected for us by Priceline. So overall we can't complain because the price was right - about half the listed rate on their website at the time. We would NOT have been happy if we paid the regular price. This hotel is poorly located within San Diego if you don't have a car. For us, obviously a rental car was a must, and since we had one, we were able to get around easily. However, it is a scam the amount they charge for parking. This hotel is not downtown and has a huge parking lot, so having to pay is ridiculous. The hotel is situated in what seems to be a trailer park area. This is not a high end hotel by any means. It is more like a glorified motel. When we arrived, our room was not ready. They said they would call us, but didn't. So we had to wait. This is likely because we booked with Priceline and were not treated like Hilton guests. The staff at the front desk was a bit stuck up. Most other staff were more polite. The pools were very busy - good luck getting a chair during peak season. But the towels are free and easy to access. We would not stay there again unless the deal was great. There are better places for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: lenglish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so nice for staying at, the food is great, and its in the bay so it has calm waters. The walk along the bay is great too!

Reviews.Title: “Awful, do not waste your money”
Reviews.Author: CarmenD4
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in in my life. We stayed for 3 nights in October as part of a trip around California. If it hadn't have been a non-refundable rate I would have checked out immediately. However I also noticed that there is a $75 per person charge for an early check out so I presume I'm not the only guest that has felt this way! The main reception area is fine and doesn't indicate what awaits you. We stayed in the tower rooms, or the tower block I should say as it looks like a run down block of flats! The lobby area of the tower is disgusting, dirty carpet, scuffed walls and the dreaded pebble-dashed effect roof. There was also a funny hospital like smell which I presume is bleach of some sort. The elevator was very old and dirty looking. The room itself was certainly cleaner and the sheets were fresh but the bedspread looked gross and I dreaded to think of the dirt on it. Needless to say it was discarded immediately. Our 'view' was of the car park. Enough said. The bar/restaurant is souless and uncomfortable with average food. The location is dreadful as you are NOT on a beach as the description implies. It's on an inlet that I personally would never swim in. The pool was ok as an alternative but small. You need a car to get anywhere and the taxis were expensive. They even ripped us off there too as one evening we tried to get a taxi and they told us to take a people carrier van of theirs instead as 'ot costs the same as a taxi' the van cost $20, the same return journey in a taxi cost $13. Also they charge $30 a night to park in their carpark. Again it's a disgusting attempt at extortion. The car park is large and spaces are not in great demand. It was more expensive that car parks in 5* LA hotels we stayed in on the same trip. Would NEVER go back. Its not a hotel, a 2* motel. Give it a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: mgaeta23
Reviews.Content: This Hilton property sits on Mission Bay in San Diego, very close to Sea World and just a few miles from Old Town. The pool area is very relaxing and the walk path just off the property is a great place to take a sunset stroll. The rooms have recently been updated and are decorated with modern furnishings. The only downside to this property is the cost for parking which is approximately $25 per night. As there are no other parking options in the area, all guests are required to pay the fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, good amenities”
Reviews.Author: kneemac4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hilton on Mission bay drive. When our family of 4 (kids ages 7 and 8) checked in, they put us in room 330 (located at the dark far end of the complex) but a quick phone call and we were moved to a room by the pool just as we requested (610). The room was spacious, and the bathroom was fine. There were 2 comfortable queen beds with nice linens, a sitting area with a small bar sink and frig, and a nice patio with 2 recliners. There are 2 pools, one for very young children and the other a nice large pool with zero entry. The water temp in the pool is great. There were also a couple of hot tubs which we all enjoyed. We didn't check out the restraurants. We only went to the coffee shop - the baristas always greeted the kids with a smile when they hung out for their morning cocoa. The kids loved the beach area and the proximity to sea world. Parking was a ripoff but we knew it before we went, so budget for it. The staff was pleasant and helpful. All in all - a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly with lots to do.”
Reviews.Author: SamsM0m
Reviews.Content: From the outside this Hilton property isn't very impressive. But once you get in the rooms, they were recently renovated and some of them have fantastic views. A few rooms even have a balcony w/a firepit and lounge chairs. The pool is wonderful as is the restaurant with a great buffet brunch. This location is great because it is 5-10 minutes to many different attractions i.e. LaJolla, Sea World, downtown. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fur coat & no knickers, costs a fourtune...”
Reviews.Author: GSjim
Reviews.Content: Fur coat & no knickers, costs a fourtune and charges extra for everything. Rip off Â£20 for parking but you can't get there any other way. Below average service ( grumpy waiter) food in the returaunt ok but over priced. I I've just toured the Californian coast and this is the most expensive and worst hotel out of seven others.

Reviews.Title: “Should be called HiltonDishonors”
Reviews.Author: Ryost44
Reviews.Content: I made the unfortunate mistake booking rooms at this so called 4 star, category 7 (according to the HiltonHonors website). When we first checked in at 4:00 PM (official check-in time) room was not ready. I booked a BAYFRONT room. What I was given was a BAYVIEW room at Bayfront prices. I am a seasoned traveler and I know the difference between BAYVIEW and BAYFRONT. Apparently the people at Hilton do not know the difference. My room was room 310 in the villas. It was on the side of the building, not the front. The so called bayfront view was blocked by a three foot cement wall so you really couldn't see the bay. The room (310) was a disgrace. Wallpaper peeling the bathroom, toggle on switch missing, lamp not working, tv reception crappy, floors dirty, sprinkler in hallway outside the room leaking, dark rooms. What a dive! They should be ashamed flattering themselves by giving a 4 star rating. I don't like being lied to and deceived into trying to convince me that room 310 is a BAYFRONT room and tried to charge me accordingly. The room is a BAYVIEW. After arguing with the front desk for a second time, the manager was called and also tried to lie and deceive us into believing this was a BAYFRONT room. He finally agreed to give us the room at bayview price, but still insisted the room was bayfront. To quote Judge Judy "Don't pee on my leg and tell me it's raining." The last night we were there we were upgraded at no charge to a Bayfront room. It was too little too late, since I was aggrevated from the start by their lies and deceitfullness. I don't think I will stay at a Hilton again. So much for their loyalty program, HiltonHonors. More like HiltonDishonors. What a bunch of liars and dishonest people. The only good thing about this dive is the location. Have since cancelled my American Express Hilton DIshonors card. Do yourself a favor and stay at either a Marriott or the Best Western on Harbor Island. Nice rooms, honest people and have more respect for their guests. Their rooms are also bright, clean and updated.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: World-Explorer81
Reviews.Content: At the beginning of October I spent only one night at this luxurious hotel just right outside San Diego. It is located right at San Diegoâ€™s famous mission bay with direct access to the beach. If you like water sports, the hotel offers a large variety of possibilities such as bots and jet skis. The hotel pool is alo right next to the beach. Right on the beach one can find a public jogging trail with a great view on the bay. The downturn of this hotel is that the parking fee, which was 25 USD per night during our stay. Given the remote location there is no way to get around the parking fee, since parking outside the resort is no option. Another complaint is that the hotel did not offer free internet in the rooms nor in the reception area. Other than that I really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms were quite large and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “By far the worst Hilton I have ever seen..........”
Reviews.Author: charjoejohn
Reviews.Content: I have been a Hilton Honors Diamond member for a long time. In that time, I have stayed at many Hilton properties (Hilton, Hampton, Doubletree, Homewood, Embassy Suites and Waldorf Astoria) in over 20 different states. Over all of that time, I have never seen a worse hotel than the Hilton San Diego Resort on MIssion Bay Drive. First, the hotel appears very old and dated. The carpeting in the common areas appears very worn and dated. The rooms are very small. The bathroon is so small that you could not fall down in it if you tried. The railings on the balconies are rusted. The service we received at the front desk was poor. They also charge $20 per day for parking and you park your car yourself. All in all it was the first time, that I have had this bad an experience at a Hilton hotel. Fortunately, my wife and I were able to move to the Embassy Suites in La Jolla. The service we received was fantastic and our room on the Hilton Honors floor was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Southerntraveler9
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this great Hotel and we were upgraded to a suite on the bay , the view was wonderful and the Hotel staf was excellent. The staff was very informative and the resort was great.All rooms were very nice inside and could not be happier.Except like every hotel we stayed at you had to pay $19.00 parking in a standard parking lot . Oh well you can't have it perfect ...Oh and there is way to many choices in San Diego,could have spent weeks out there and not done it all.. Rock Hill SC

Reviews.Title: “The service was incredible, and the location is perfect for a family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: mamma03
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this Hilton. We loved being right on the bay with all of the activities to choose from, and the atmosphere was resort-like. The fire pits around the hotel made the evening fun, and the kids loved roasting marshmellows by the fire. The service was superb throughout the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hilton I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: GIHK
Reviews.Content: I have stayed over 60 nights in Hilton Properties, this is the worst. Rooms are dull, dirty and badly serviced. We changed rooms to a somewhat better room, but still found we had to ask for clean towels and the room to be cleaned. The pool was dirty and the restaurant and bar way over priced. Parking is also charged. We complained and the manager offered us a free night if we return- No way the Hilton Garden, Marriott and Double tree hotels in the area are far better. I do not recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Views”
Reviews.Author: Hippiechick49
Reviews.Content: We went for a quick 3 day getaway to celebrate our birthdays and this place was perfect! Great location- not too far away from the many things to see and do in San Diego, yet seemed secluded. Our patio had a couple of nice chaise lounges that we used to relax and survey Mission Bay, very comfy beds and nice clean bathroom. Great service at the Acqua restaurant (except for one elderly waiter at breakfast the last morning there- a bit of a prune he was). Only thing I'd change is the exorbitant price of parking. These rooms aren't exactly inexpensive- kind of reminds me of paying for extra bags on airlines. Definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: MauidAmy
Reviews.Content: After we picked up our rental car at Alamo, we were off to the 32nd Street Naval base. I had picked the naval base because we were splurging to stay at the Disneyland Grand Californian later in the trip. My husband is military and this is one of our final trips before he deploys. The are surrounding the base was less than desired and because my husband had just gotten off work when we left for the airport he needed a nap. I decided to bid on priceline for a 4* last minute and was given the lovely Hilton Resort and Spa for only $10 more than what we were paying at the base. I was a little worried as the reviews are mixed. I would definitely give this hotel a 3.5*/4* for its wonderful amenities. We were given a villa in the Remo area which was on the ground floor and had a patio and a HUGE lawn area that our son could burn off steam. He didnâ€™t need to do this as the beach was right there and he rather spend his time playing in the sand. The beach looked like it was racked every morning and there was a pathway that went up and down the beach and many people used for running. The pools were wonderful too. There was a kiddie pool and bigger pool with a zero entry. There was a also a spa, with a wonderful view of the beach. Some areas of the hotel could have used a better cleaning (i.e. the waterfall and pools and wine glasses sat by room for 2 days), but they were not that bad. The room was an average room, with a refrig. The room had some areas that were worn as the other reviewers had stated, but I found them good enough. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was updated with granite countertops. We were not in the room that much as we utilized the beach a lot. We used the refrig to store milk and drinks for breakfast. The front desk attendant also mentioned that if we needed a microwave that we could rent one for $20 a day or I could just ask the restaurant to heat up my sons toddler meals. There was free wifi in the courtyard area and happy hour from the bar is everyday from 5-7pm. They will even give you a drink in a plastic cup so you could sit outside by the pool. The parking was the only outrageous thing at the resort ($25 a day) and to be honest we are not even sure they went around to look for the ticket hanging in the window. I had left it off most of the time and we didnâ€™t have one problem. All and all, I would highly recommend this resort for anyone with little ones (our son is 2 1/2), looking for a hotel on the beach (although I wouldnâ€™t swim in the water-too cold), a wonderful pool area, especially with the zero entry and a kiddie pool. I would also like to mention that EVERY staff member at this resort had a smile and their face and were so pleasant. I find that refreshing these days as it is hard to come by. My only regret is that we didnt have more time to stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: resortlover99
Reviews.Content: From the staff, to the service, to the location directly on Mission bay, to the pool, grounds and our suite, THIS RESORT EXCEEDED ALL OUR EXPECTATIONS ON OUR ANNIVERSARY WEEKEND. And, it feels so funny to say, but the bed was so comfortable! I rarely wake up in a hotel bed where i don't have some kind of kink in the morning, but the king bed I slept in at this Hilton (along with the pillows) put me to sleep so easily and I woke up refreshed. It was AWESOME! We've traditionally stayed at the Marriott on Coronado for our anniversary, but I can guarantee you we'll be back to this specific Hilton from here on out ... and for years to come. We were THOROUGHLY SATISFIED and the weekend proved to be relaxing, and a time of renewal and reconnection for us personally. I know there are plenty of options to choose from in San Diego, and we've been to a lot of nice resorts throughout the west coast, but I strongly suggest you stay at this particular Hilton ... there's just something special about it and you will not be disappointed. In fact, there's a great chance it'll become your favorite spot ... just like it has for us. Troy - Poway, CA

Reviews.Title: “the resort was absolutley breathtaking and made our weekend very memorable.”
Reviews.Author: bonnienichols99
Reviews.Content: our weekend was so fabulous!!! From the room to the grounds to the service of the staff, it was above and beyond all that we could have expected. The resort was layed out perfect and attention to every detail was clearly paid attention too. We will be visiting this resort many times a year for sure. It was absolutely perfect!

Reviews.Title: “A return stay”
Reviews.Author: Abeyta_CLD
Reviews.Content: This is one of my all time favorite hotels. Perfect location on the bay and located to so many great destinations in San Diego. I have stayed here easily half a dozen times over the last 10 years. It has been a few years since i was last here and i was glad to see the growth. When I lived in Vegas, we had brought family and friends down on a couple of occasions. Now that i live in Carlsbad, I still bring the family down there for an escape from NC. There is now a bar (on the boardwalk) and an expanded recreational rentals store front on the water. Our room was fresh and clean. The refurbished decorations were comfortable and sophisticated and solid. Not sure how long ago these changes were made, but definitely nice. The beds were comfortable and the pillows were great. Nice large flat screen TV. $11.95 for the internet. We went and rode our bikes along the great bike / walking path. Had a great relaxing time. We ate at Aqua and sat outside in the teardrop pods. We had the prosciutto and goat cheese appetizers. The ham selections were delicious (Italian Parma; duck; & Austrian) - serviced with slices of Parmesan, pickles and olives (the pickles weren't that great). The goat cheese wasn't as good as i had hoped but the fig confit helped make it tasty. The only two complaints were 1) (and this is more because of the HHonors program) the price for parking is now $25 per night. If it were a downtown location were parking was at a premium, i could swallow it better. I talked to the MOD (Nick) and lodged my complaint and there was little he was willing to listen to. I work in the resort business so, I definitely understand his stance but that didn't cure the bad taste in my mouth about it. Regarding the HHonors, i would have hoped after being a loyal HHonors member for 20 years, that there would be some perk for my loyalty. I didn't even get offered a room upgrade and i know the hotel wasn't 100% filled up. 2) the second complaint is that we stayed at the far south end of the property in room 501. In that room, we were right next to the property facilities (assume laundry and maintenance). At about 10pm, we started to hear sounds from a party going on. As i looked outside, i discovered that the party was actually coming from the hotel facilities. I didn't mind the noise so much (although it was pretty loud) and i had fallen asleep with the door open. At about 2:30 am, the party was still going on. I couldn't go to sleep at that point and i finally closed the door. Despite issues 1 & 2, i definitely recommend this property if you are looking for a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your Money!”
Reviews.Author: TrishTucson
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to San Diego and what a disappointment.
