Room was not clean...examples: paper coffee cup had been used previously but had been put back for use again (doesn't get nastier), no liner in our ice bucket, the bottoms of our feet turned black in just a few passes across the tiled floor, our patio came with two of the most uncomfortable bar height stools and one low table so there was no way to get comfortable or sit on the stool and set a drink down, the propane tank in the fire pit (couples retreat area) had no gas after the first night and was never filled the rest of the week and the towels weren't stocked daily for the spa in the same area - just got to look at a heap of used towels for a few days. Asking for assistance - forget it - very rude. The very worst is that they had our parking area marked off limits for three days and made you walk a very long walk to your building - why were we paying $25.00 a day for parking and then we learned it was off limits to us because there was an "event" on Saturday (after we checked out!) and they were using our area for valet parking for event attendees. What????? What a nice time - listening to all the guests in our building complain for the same reasons! OK - the pool area was nice. Would we return? Absolutely not!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not 4 *”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travelalways
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice enough, the room we stayed in was clean and had just been updated, very spacious. pool area was lovely, great for children. The hotel had a film night around the pool and handed out popcorn for all the children. Dining wasa little pricey, but there was a small coffee shop selling coffee and muffins for breakfast. One disadvantage was location, you needed a car to get into downtown. Old town was not too far away, so we did hire a taxi that evening. Tour bus collects passesngers each morning at 9 and 10.00, but the return was far too early, returning between 4 - 5.30. Although a nice hotel, I wouldn't stop there again, preferring something closer to the amenties and restaurents of San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Not good enough”
Reviews.Author: ron_elvins
Reviews.Content: It tries hard to be a four star hotel, but many aspects fall short. The location is fine - nice beach and walk behind the hotel, but it is a long way from Downtown and the more holiday active area of West Mission Bay. You need a car, and to have a car they charge you $25 a day to park which is nothing other than a rip-off and a significant supplement to your bill, especially if you are staying for several nights. the other area of rip-off is the charge for internet services, which lets be honest most places now provide free of charge. Rooms were good and spacious and the housekeeping was faultless. I agree with an earlier reviewer who said about the smelly corridor - it smelt of dead animals to me! Likewise you heard everytime anyone near your room went to the toilet. If you are in the tower-block you are definitely in the 'cheap-seats', whilst the 4/5 star guests have access to the beach fronts, restaurant and pool. Pool was nice and well used, shame they charged you (rip-off culture again) to use a cabanna. We used several hotels in California during a prolonged holiday and this was the worst - we were glad to get out of there. Not untypically eating when compared to retaurants outside of the hotel was expensive. American hotels do seem a little obsessed with 'musack'. The Hilton's was particularly gruelling and constant everywhere you went - we do not want to hear this rubbish!!!

Reviews.Title: “I saw used condoms in the bushes next to the adult jacuzzi *after* having soaked in it. Disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: Danean
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to stumble upon a wonderful, quiet spot for "adults only," nestled away in the less-frequented portion of the hotel grounds. It has a small fire pit, comfortable seating, a wonderful Jacuzzi, and large eucalyptus trees which create a relaxing environment. (See photo.) I was a little concerned about soaking in a public Jacuzzi, but my friend assured me that it was well-maintained and would be fine. I soaked Friday afternoon, then again Sunday morning before checking out. Sunday morning, after having been in the Jacuzzi for about 30 minutes, I got out, dried off, and when I went to put my towel in the basket, I found one used condom and two condom wrappers in the bushes adjacent to the Jacuzzi I had just soaked myself in. DISGUSTING! (Was the other used condom floating around in the water with me?!) I told the front desk supervisor, William, about my experience and how disgusted I was. He offered no apology and would not compensate me in any way. It was 11:30, and check-out time was at noon. I asked him if I could have a little extra time to take a longer shower in my room. He told me I had until noon to shower, pack and be out of the room. I went back to my room, literally nauseated by the thought of having soaked my body in that water. I showered as quickly as possible, though I wanted to stay in the shower much longer in order to get all of the umm...bodily fluids off of me. I called William at the front desk at 11:50 and asked him if I could have an extra 15 minutes. "That will be a problem. We have another guest checking in and need to clean the room." (Check-in time is at 4:00.) I reminded him that I was the lady who had just soaked in someone's ___. He grudgingly gave me until 12:30, after which time, he assured me, I would be charged an additional $75.00. (I wasn't asking for a lot of time; a mere extra 15 minutes to get the other person's bodily fluids sufficiently washed off.) Anyway, I went down at 12:10 and spoke with William's boss, Josh. He was much friendlier. He apologized for the condoms and for William's behavior and assured me the used condom would be picked up and William would be spoken to. I'm genuinely saddened that this happened. Before this ordeal, I was really enjoying my stay, the staff and the grounds. William's behavior was completely unacceptable. He should have at least apologized, if not offered me an extra 30 minutes to shower without me having to beg for it. Because of this, I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirtiest Room I have ever be in anywhere in the world”
Reviews.Author: gpiccininno
Reviews.Content: I never imagined that a carpet could be as dirty as room 516. 15 minutes after my sonâ€™s took baths, there feet where black. To test how dirty they carpet was, I wet a towel and rubbed the carpet for 5 seconds and it came up dark gray. I wanted my wife to video this since I believe seeing the filth is the only way to understand the level of filth. Location was great, service is average at best and at times, they seemed understaffed (at least that is what they told me when I wanted to get a bite to eat at 8 pm at the restaurant (I was a party of one) The hotel was the only negative of a great family holiday. It is a real shame because the location is great for doing all the SD located theme parks and the small beach and bay is just right for our 4 and 6 year olds. Taking out the filth of the hotel, I can't imagine topping this family holiday with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Everything in our room was broken”
Reviews.Author: cstrom
Reviews.Content: The first night we stayed at this hotel our toilet broke. At four in the morning it made this horrible honking noise. It kept us up all night. The next morning we went to call the front desk and the phone in our room didn't work! The sliding glass door in our room was broken, and the remote for the TV didn't work. The walls were very thin and you could hear what the people in the next room were doing! It was awful. Worst money I ever spent. I will NOT be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but inconvenient without a car”
Reviews.Author: sci01
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation for the hotel through Priceline. I have had great experience with Priceline in the past but this was my least favorite experience. The staff were nice. The room was very nice and generally clean (with the exception of the cabinet containing the small fridge). Unfortunately, my room was right off the parking lot (even though the hotel was not very crowded) so I could not enjoy a view or the patio. Internet in the rooms was expensive. The biggest downside to the hotel is the lack of bus or shuttle service near the hotel. There was a livery/car outside each morning -- convenient, but the rates were even higher than a taxi. If you drive, you have to pay $25 for parking. It would be nice if the hotel operated a small shuttle or made a deal with a livery service. Particularly without a view, I felt this turned out to be an inconvenient location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, comfortable, and delightful resort - close to everything San Diego has to offer”
Reviews.Author: bimmerhappy
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a wedding and stayed a couple extra days to relax with family and friends. This hotel/resort was a fantastic decision. We had an amazing time, the on-site restaurant was delicious, my favorite was the 5 spice butternut squash soup with lobster drop over the top of the soup. Even though the wedding we attended was in the central part of La Jolla, I was glad we stayed here! The location is close to everything and is also very easy to get to from the airport. Relax and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but not four *”
Reviews.Author: stayfree
Reviews.Content: It seemed to me that the hotel was in two parts - the rooms which were more like 3 star and then the main part of the hotel/pool/restaurant which was 4 star. The pool and the restaurant (both outdoors and in) were lovely, the ambience in the evening was very relaxing - loved the fires, and I guess in some respects you pay for the setting. We thought the breakfast was very good, and an evening meal though expensive was enjoyable, we decided it was worth the extra for the ambience. However, we stayed in the two storey rooms on the corridors overlooking the gardens and the corridors were quite shockingly tired, the corridor we walked through to get the hotel (100's I think) was very smelly, rather like a sewer and reminded me of a youth hostel - definitely not 4 star, more like 2. Had we stayed on that particular corridor I would definitely have asked to be moved. The rooms themselves were nice, but so dark and very damp. The beds however were very comfortable and the housekeeping was good. The bathroom was tiny for an upgraded lanai garden room. Overall, a nice stay but we felt a little ripped off, the $25 daily parking charge is not really justifiable at all and is offputting when reflecting on your stay. Also when we ate in the restaurant one evening, the waiter added on $10 gratuity after we had signed the bill (without our knowledge) and we had already left him a tip! We noticed this when checking out and queried the bill. Not really acceptable, although the Manager apologised profusely. I wouldn't say don't stay there, just lower your expectations of a 4* slightly.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the Value Minded”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine103
Reviews.Content: It was nice but not worth big bucks. Our room was huge for a hotel room (a definite plus)but somewhat dated and in need of some general maintenance (bulging wallpaper, tub could use a regrout and the place could generally be updated). Pool umbrellas fading etc... It could be that I just prefer value but I really hated being charged for every single basic service that is typically included in a 2 star range. Parking $25 a night, internet also outrageous (I guess they don't want you Googling for nearby restaurants lest you not pay $13.50 for the basic burger â€“cheese is extra - that your kids wouldn't appreciate anyway). Grown up meals start about $40. Maybe it's just me as there we're plenty of folks partaking. It was nice on many levels but for the prices I would have expected much more. Also, don't expect early check-in. On the bright side, they happily allowed us in the pool area early with a temporary key and said they'd call when our room was ready. That turned out to be 15 minutes prior to when was contracted (4:00). Great location near Sea World right on the bay. Only a few minutes drive to all San Diego attractions. Don't plan on using the internet unless you want to swipe your credit card. As of July 2010 use was $8.16 minimum for the first 15 minutes and .54 a minute after that. Bring snacks and don't plan to eat there at all - crazy expensive. There are plenty of places within driving distance that are worth a try. We loved Su Casa near La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: taeyasmom
Reviews.Content: The thing about this hotel is that it is literally in the middle of no where. You are about a 5 or ten minute drive (by highway) from restaurants, etc. definitely too far to walk. The restaurant at the hotel was good, but expensive. We got the room for $139 a night which was fine, but in my opinion, it is not at all worth what they normally charge to stay there (upwards of $200). The room was nice, but not spectacular and the pool area was pretty. I probably would not stay there again simply due to the location--too isolated.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment for a beautifully situated property”
Reviews.Author: Tailhuntress
Reviews.Content: Amazingly situated on Mission Bay and close to many major attractions in San Diego. That is about the only thing the Hilton had going the four days we were there. The pool area and jacuzzi was dirty and completely overrun with underaged and un-chaparoned young children. The rooms and hallways were loud and it seemed that they were putting twice the maximum in some many of the rooms. The pool and pool bar area and staff was not able to accomadate the guests. One afternoon the local football team had a preseason game which the hotel had promoted as being shown in the lounge of the main restaurant. (physically separate from the formal restauran). The place was packed with guests eating lunch and wishing to watch the game. The staff refuesed to turn the volume on. The management came out and apologized and said the chef would not allow it?? We had a table of six and it took the kitchen three tries to get our food order correct and we finally gave up and ate what was served the third time which was not what was ordered. Many other issues, but these were typical...

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTE PERFECTION!! Our entire stay was exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: tomtristen
Reviews.Content: The weekend was a non-kid weekend with my husband for my 39th B-day. We were in room 327 which I highly recommend to anyone planning to visit, it was amazing and the views all around were perfect-the view from the private patio at Sunset is beautiful. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left our stay was a great one. The employee's were all very friendly and accomodating. The General Manager personally checked on us to see how we liked our room and if there was anything they could do to let them know. The grounds of the hotel are beautifully landscaped and well maintained, it was nice to walk around and relax. Overall the weekend was terrific, we will definately be returning to this Hotel in the future. THANK YOU TO EVERYONE AT THE HILTON

Reviews.Title: “Have the best time of your life”
Reviews.Author: jasonsueart
Reviews.Content: As a family, we have been coming to the Mission Bay Hilton for 25+ years and have always enjoyed our time at the Hotel. From the moment we drive in we see the same familiar smiling faces of the bellmen, to the ever so courteous reception at the front desk, to all the phone operators including Penny, Marc, and Becky who are happy to assist you in any way possible, to the best and friendliest housekeepers, and to Justin who is always there to lend a helping hand. The mornings would not be the same without our daily trip to Aqua for breakfast.. All the waiters and waitresses have become part of our family including, Maria, Terry, Mariano, Luis, Ernie, Nacho, Nemma, Roberto, Carol, and Tony. We look forward to seeing all of them. Lastly we can not forget the resort. They make us feel right at home. The bartenders by the pool at Frescos are the best. We do not want to forget to mention are friend Chris, the building engineer who makes a point of visiting us at least one time during our stay just to get the latest family updates. The hadest part of the trip is saying goodbye to the front desk staff including Josh, Ramon, Edit, and William. Sincerely, Jason, Sue and Art Rosen

Reviews.Title: “Great location for families, but details are”
Reviews.Author: Tripster101
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in the tower section of this hotel and found it to be comfortable with nice clean rooms with balconies. The walls are a bit thinner than you'd expect from a hotel of this class, however. The overall feel of the resort is good, with lots of open areas and seating. The pool area is nice but becomes a bit crowded during the day, but the beach is just a few steps away so it's easy to find a spot. It's along Mission Bay which has a great walking trail. As for location, it's great for what it is. You're not in the middle of everything but Mission Bay is beautiful and offers lots to do. If you're looking for nightlife or shopping you'd be better served to look elsewhere. We have 2 small children and they had a great time at the pool and at the beach, and unlike at some other properties we did not feel uncomfortable having our children with us. That said, the service leaves something to be desired. There were a number of little issues that left us feeling like this is a 3 star service hotel, not a 4. A few examples: some of the restaurant service was quite slow, although the waitstaff was uniformly friendly. Also, the bathrooms in the restaurant were not well maintained. Of 3 sinks, 2 did not have any soap in the dispensers, and my wife informed me that the waste baskets in the women's restrooms were overflowing (and not during a particularly busy time). The food was very good to occasionally exceptional, however, though quite expensive. As for other staff, they were mostly helpful with an occasional exception. For example, a linen cart deliveryman was at the the elevators and occupied the 1st to arrive without offering it to waiting guests. It was not like there was an endless stream of people waiting, either. It's things like this that can make people paying premium rates feel less than valued as customers. If the resort were to fix these small but quite important details it could, given its location and otherwise good offerings, be considered a true 4 star resort. And of course, no review would be complete without a complaint about the ridiculous charges assessed by most hotels in this class. No free Internet in the rooms? $25 to park when this is not a downtown location? These things leave one feeling as if Hilton is picking one's pockets. Coupled with the overall level of service, I would have to say this is a 3 star, not a 4. Good, but not great. We would only return if we were paying a good bit less than what we paid (which was north of $275 a night).

Reviews.Title: “Nice complex, but showing signs of wear and not worth the costs.”
Reviews.Author: brian_burch
Reviews.Content: I've been staying here for over 20 years and have seen many changes. Some good, some bad. New owership in the past years as well. I feel the costs are above what the hotel has to offer. It has a beautiful pool and surroundings, but our just recent stay was of poor service at the pool area and restaurant. The people at the front desk were very helpful and accommodating. Stayed in the 400 level with firepit and was OK, but somewhat musty and wore for a $450.00 room. $25.00 PARKING IS A JOKE. MUSIC BEING PLAYED LOAD ALL THE TIME IS ANNOYING. Still a nice stay and if you can get a good price, won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for our needs”
Reviews.Author: 65Mustangman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very expensive as most goods and services are in California. Our son was married in the San Diego area and the Mission Bay area was a good central location. The pool, bike and jet ski rentals were a nice option.

Reviews.Title: “Try glorietta bay inn... If u think the Hilton rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Lissethp
Reviews.Content: This place doesn't provide any type of breakfast... The restaurant ... Location is bad, theres nothing In walking distance...Internet is $11 a DAY!...( most places provide it for free).... Parking is $25.00 at the DAY... We stayed at glotietta bay Inn( here in San Diego) Where breakfast is included and is THE BEST... FREE Internet.... FREE parking.... Exellent location.... What a mistake to come to the Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “MORE LIKE A MOTEL NOT A HOTEL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Scotland021
Reviews.Content: This was our last hotel to visit on our two week holiday to California and what a disappointment. Location is terrible it is on the outskirts of San Diego and unless you are visiting Sea World there is nothing else close by. There are no restaurants in walking distance except the Hotel restaurant which looked nice but cannot comment as we did not eat in it. Our room was very dull and musty smelling, our balcony had two ridiculous high chairs and a high table which were not inviting to sit on. Parking was 25$ a night to park your own car. The two previous hotels we had stayed in were beautiful hotels with valet parking which were the same price. The positive about this hotel is the pool is nice. Hope this review is helpful to people who like to be in the centre of places do not book this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Musty loud room with leaky tub”
Reviews.Author: Kytraveler57
Reviews.Content: Our room was ground floor and musty smelling. Went and used the bathroom, and toilet seat was wet, with what I don't want to know. Leakey tub and nasty looking faucet on sink. Our room was right next to the outside door and we could hear it slam everytime someone would go in and out. We could also hear everyone in the hall coming an going. Thank god we booked with priceline and didn't have to pay full price! I can't believe people would pay over 200 for that. Just an old hotel that has been updated but needs to be taken care of better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: RenNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at the Hilton. We tried to check in early and the the room wasn't ready, but we were able to freshen up in the spa's locker room. All our request were met at check in. Only problem was we were on the second floor in the Villa's and there was no elevator, so my husband had to carry all the suitcases up himself. The room and bathroom were both a nice size. The view from the balcony was a nice garden view with a partial view of the bay. The grounds are beautiful. When driving up to the Resort it reminded me of some of the Hotels in Hawaii with it's open air tropical lobby. We also enjoyed the gym and tennis courts. They will supply you with tennis racquets you just have to pay five dollars for the balls or bring your own. I would definitely stay here on my next trip to San Diego if the price is right. I really don't understand why such the terrible rating. I almost stayed some place else and I'm glad I didn't!!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego's Best Vacation Getaway”
Reviews.Author: IZZYCROWES
Reviews.Content: I am a resident of San Diego who was looking for a weekend getaway and chose The Hilton San Diego Resort & Spa because of its coastal location. Boy am i glad i did! The experience was phenomenal. The resort itself is beautiful. The staff are all extremely kind and helpful and the room was great with really comfortable beds. I was just feet from the bay and was able to watch the fireworks across the bay at Sea World. Killer place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome pool, and good service at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: Chicago2SD
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend at the Hilton with our 2 young children. Check in was quick and easy. Our room was ready and had a beautiful courtyard and view of the bay. Our children loved the pool and also enjoyed playing in the sand/beach area by the hotel. Our family enjoyed the private firepit outside our patio. The gift shop had firewood available. We ate dinner on the private patio with a fire on a beautiful San Diego evening. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and look forward to returning soon.

Reviews.Title: “Family Event”
Reviews.Author: MarineFather
Reviews.Content: `My daughter, son in law and myself needed to travel to San Diego to attend the graduating ceremony of my son from the Marine Corp boot camp. I am a hilton honors member and chose this hotel due to the great location to the MCRD. What a wonderful experience. Everything was perfect and the staff could not have been more helpful in providing directions, allowing a late check out so we did not have to go through the security check on base with luggage etc etc. The view of Mission Bay was great and the pool area wonderful. We will be back and I highly recommend this to anyone who wants a great location, easy access to the airport and wonderful San Diego setting

Reviews.Title: “We cannot wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: mgousha
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa was phenomenal. We needed a roll away bed and it was delivered immediately. We had several appointments in the spa and each was delivered professionally and beautifully. Relaxation at its finest. Our incredible room was perfect for us because we had six ladies sharing a suite...plenty of room to enjoy being together and having plenty of space to fully enjoy our weekend. Access to the pool was convenient and we loved having towels provided. Additionally, our dinner on Saturday night was delicious! On the way out, we stopped to buy a souvenir and loved the gift shop. Everything we needed. We look forward to a return visit soon!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway for leisure and activity”
Reviews.Author: pjstlo
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, friendly and attentive staff, great food - relaxing, yet a perfect location easy access to entertainment. A definite repeat destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: KatyMomof2
Reviews.Content: My room overlooked Mission Bay with outdoor seating. The location is awesome, right on the water. There is a walking tract along the beach the runs right next to the hotel, so you can just leave your room and begin walking. The breakfast buffet was excellent; plenty to choose from and the service was good. I had lunch and dinner at the restaurant and bar which was very good. There is an adult retreat area, which included a hot tub. The pool was clean and they had a bar attendant for your orders. I loved the fire pits outside the pool area at night while I drank cocktails. I also enjoyed a massage at the spa. I would definitely return and recommend this hotel. The entire staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation at Mission Hilton”
Reviews.Author: vicfrac95
Reviews.Content: Drove down to Mission Bay Hilton from the OC with spouse, and two small children in tow. The Hotel is newly renovated and has a very nice feel to it. The staff is friendly and the grounds are very nice. The kids spent all day in the pools and we couldn't get them out. There is a small shallow pool that was perfect for my 2 year old and the main pool is fantastic and very user freindly. There are numerous enterances with stairs and benches, making it very easy to hang out with the kids while they're swimming. There's even a sloped enterance that both my 6 and 2 yr old could play together. The wait staff poolside was awesome too. They made sure that we had everything we needed. The property sits right on a bike path and we took the kids on a ride and had a great time. The hotel is really close to Sea World and you can even see the fireworks from the hotel property, which is a bonus. All in all a great place for a family vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great escape for both the adults and the kids”
Reviews.Author: Wheaton60189
Reviews.Content: I traveled from Chicago with my wife and two children to visit family. We are familiar with the L.A. and San Diego area and thought it would be nice to stay in a nice hotel for a few days. Our purpose was to relax and explore the San Diego area. We arrived early and our rooms were not ready. They took our cell phone numbers and said they would rush one of the two rooms we reserved so that we could get settled. My phone rang within 20 minutes which was a pleasant surprise. Our rooms were great. 1st floor, large, and walked out to a patio that had a fire pit and looked over the bay. When you have kids... the first thing is the pool. The pool was gorgeous and had a zero depth area which was great for kids. For the adults... two hot tubs and prompt pool side service. That night, we were so excited about the fire pit that we did S'mores. That evening fireworks went off at Sea World beyond the bay which was a perfect end to the night and way to start our time in the San Diego area. During our stay we rented a Catamaran, hung out at the pool, took walks on the bay, and went site seeing. One of the more relaxed trips I have been on in a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Geffrey25
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay with the family. This was our third time staying at this location and have never been disappointed. The Hotel is located close to Seaworld and the Zoo reducing travel time in the car for the kids. The pool area was great for the kids after a day at the Zoo. We spent the extra money and got a bayfront view with a fire pit which enabled us to roast marshmellows and watch the Sea World fireworks every night. The spa prices were resonable and I was able to get an appointment without any problems. The location is easily accessable to the highway for eating and exploring the surrounding areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: vrcuc0329
Reviews.Content: Very Clean and well rounded hotel. Has alot to offer in terms of amenities for both kids and adults. Location is fabulous too; easy freeway access, close to the ocean beaches as well as the city. You will not be disappointed to stay here. We've tried other hotels in the area for our trips to southern california and won't choose any other.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat dated, but I liked it”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1070
Reviews.Content: This is an older hilton, but it reminds you of what a "nice" hotel was in the past. We were given a room in the one story area of the hotel. There were two comfortable chairs out front for lounging. The room was clean, with updated furnishings, but nothing to get excited about. There was a pool (not large) with a seperate children's pool, but it was too chilly in June to try it out. We didn't eat at the restaurant(s) so I cannot comment on the food. The best part for me was the location. Very close to Sea World and the Interstate for getting around. Also, there is a sandy area along the Bay and it is in walking distance of a playarea (park) for children. The atmosphere of the hotel was quiet and relaxing. We could see the Sea World fireworks from our hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely mother's day weekend retreat”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamilyGal
Reviews.Content: I was delighted when my husband surprised me with a quick weekend trip to San Diego. We stayed at the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. Our suite had a private patio that faced mission bay. It was also next to a public park, which made for some interesting people watching. There were people walking dogs, rollerblading and enjoying the bay. The first night we had a romantic dinner at Acqua restaurant onsite. The appetizers were to die for! Tuna tar-tar and a summer squash soup garnished with lobster. For dinner my husband had the risotto and I had angus sliders. The next morning we took a quick drive to La Jolla beach. We returned to the resort in the afternoon and spent the day at the pool. The pool area was beautiful and relaxing. The drink service was a bit slow, but overall it was a nice experience. That night we ventured out to Old Town for some mexican food. When we returned to the resort, we enjoyed the view of fireworks from our patio. I'm guessing they were from Seaworld. Our final morning we enjoyed the room service breakfast on our patio. Everything was just perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: rmvilla
Reviews.Content: We went for forth of july weekend! My family loved it! They had smores on the beach!!!!!!!! The assistant manager came over to us twice over the weekend to ask us how everything was and if there is anything more he can do for us! We had so many things planned but ended up just enjoying are stay at the hotel! Cant wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: RealtorRita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a total of 8 nights. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The hotel is very nice, recently renovated rooms. Like most resorts they do charge for parking $25/day and Internet $12.day, but otherwise don't nickel and dime you. Beautiful pool area right on the beach/bay, bike and boat rentals right here, great food in their main restaurant (pricey of course). Grounds are gorgeous and well kept. Plenty of grassy areas for kids to run around. Hotel is right down the street from Sea World and only 10 mins to Balboa Park, the Zoo, Old Town, etc. If you like quiet don't get a room near the pool--loud music all day. One plus is you can watch the fireworks from Seaworld every night at 9:50 pm. This is a really nice hotel and location, and we had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprise”
Reviews.Author: rioja45
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at the Hilton hotel at Mission Bay San Diego. My husband was attending a Photo Seminar. I was sightseeing. The hotel was refurbished a couple of years ago. Our room was large, tastefully decorated and very quiet. The bathroom had everything a five hotel might have. I liked the room very much. We had dinner at both restaurants in the hotel. Acqua, was the restaurant we went for lunch and some nights for dinner too. Lovely outside dinning area overlooking the bay. In the evening they had outdoor fireplaces to keep the chill away. We like the menu, the food was very good. Nicely presented and great service. The Starbucks cafe in the hotel is a big hit for breakfast. The pool is lovely. Unfortunately, it is rather crowded with children and music playing non stop which I found annoying. Great for families with children, groups and girlfriends, but not a relaxing place. A plus is that you can take long walks and cycle by the bay. The hotel is not close to San Diego's amenities, but the concierge will very happily arrange any sightseeing trip for you. I was delighted with the service and the trips she recommended. I would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised”
Reviews.Author: JonCllns
Reviews.Content: Wow, the breath-taking shot on the Hilton San Diego Resort website make this place look like it's right off the ocean. It actually feeds into a smaller bay area. So, that was a disappointment. I gave this hotel a 2 mainly on value. These are Holiday Inn or Hampton Inn type rooms for resort prices. No free wi-fi, no free breakfast, and parking is $25 per day. It was also noisy there during our stay. We stayed four nights and there were disturbances on two of those nights. The final night, a drunk group of people wandered onto the property from the nearby beach around 11pm and a fight nearly broke out in the parking lot. On the good side, the staff is friendly and helpful. The Acqua (I forget how it's spelled) restaurant is fantastic. It's expensive, but the food is first class. Overall, I think I would have rather stayed at a hotel where I didn't have to pay bloated prices for things I could have gotten for free or cheaper at a non-resort hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: DoveLuv
Reviews.Content: Loved our bay front view room!!!!!! Great way to get your mind off of everything and just relax. However, the staff at the front desk made us wait for hours until we got our room and they were really rude. We also had to carry luggage to the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff, average stay”
Reviews.Author: coguy72
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights with spouse and 3 year old. Be advised parking is $25 per DAY you stay, cost me $100 to park my rental car in the hotel parking lot. My fault for not checking this, but this was an expense I had not anticipated. The staff was friendly and helpful. Location to I-5 and Sea World is very convenient. About 10 minutes from Mission Beach, water in front of hotel is small inlet. We went to the Acqua restaurant one evening for a drink and snack. My wife had two glasses of wine, I had two martinis and we ordered a seared tuna dish from the 3rd course menu, it cost us $92 with tip, a bit expensive for a few drinks and what was really a snack, not much food. Had to pay about $12 per day for ethernet internet access in room, free WiFi available in lobby area. Room was clean for most part, it is an older facility and it shows in the rooms. All in all it is OK I probably would not stay here again, I would look for something closer to the open ocean, and that did not nickel and dime you so much.

Reviews.Title: “OK BUT NOT A 4 STAR”
Reviews.Author: shortpockets
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the tower are not a 4 star not even a 1 Star. Floor was not clean? sink didn't empty right, lamp didn't work ! Room concerns were fixed promptly, but a finer Hotel wouldn't have these problems. The grounds are very nice. The bar was nice. Staff was very friendly especially the resturant manager who went all out to help us. One server who brings the coffee, told us he didn't handle water request!! Buffet breakfast was the standard fare. Toaster was to small for the size of bread and there was only one toaster available. Weekdays no Buffett and if you have the room with the breakfast you order from the menu with the $21.99 price of the buffet as a limit. We knew about parking fees in advance, but its still a ripoff. The location was perfect for us and I might even go back there but would try to get an upgrade. HHilton Honers card didn't work for upgrade this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, tranquil, peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Jfamilyof8
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say this place is centrally located to everything!!! With a rental car, seriously, you are 5 minutes from all San Diego tourist attractions. We went to Old Town, Coronado, Ocean beach, Seaport village, Pacific beach, La Jolla cove, Cabrillo National Monument etc.. and were able to be back to our hotel super quick!! Upon checking into our room, we received a room in the tower.... SCARY!!! The balcony had a group of seagulls nesting, and was covered in bird poop...GROSS!! I returned to the front desk and was shown a room that I could pay an additional $50 to upgrade to which had a bay view... not worth the price of the upgrade. I returned again to the front desk and was given a room (for an additional fee/night) in the Triana villa. It was beautiful!! Nice views, lovely landscaping, quiet, perfect. The front desk staff was very helpful, and friendly. Ramon was patient and kind. Bummed that others received a free upgrade, but I had to pay additional $$$. The housekeeping staff was excellent, and very friendly!! We stayed a week, and our room was always cleaned and smelled nice when we returned. Every staff member we encountered was very customer service oriented. The walking/running/biking paths were great which followed along the bay all the way to Sea World. The poolside fires, as well as the hot tubs at night were great.... here is a tip that we discovered, when the pool closes @ 10:00 pm, go to the adult hot tub in the adult retreat area it is open later. Plan on eating one night at the restaurant Acqua, very, very, very good!! The risotto with truffles is amazing!!! Probably the best meal I had in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but somewhat impersonal”
Reviews.Author: cmsinc
Reviews.Content: This location was very nice the restaurants, the lounge, as well as the pool were as you would expect very comfortable and tastefully apportioned. The young lady who served us for 8days poolside was wonderful, and very deserving of recognition, in addition there were several others who made a very warm effort to make us feel special, HOWEVER, the air and overall experience was impersonal and dismissive. There was some sort of a convention there and I felt as if we were relegated to nuisance status by the bulk of the folks especially several folks at the desk. Overall that was disappointing, the Internet service is horrible! Poolside I had good reception but was told, "we don't have any codes until summer", really, what if your customers need it, and the wireless you tout is only useful within 20' of the front desk. Service in the room ibahn through eithernet which is useless to my iPad. I would still stay here as the beach access and amenities are very nice, but I would not expect to be treated as special or as if Hilton, was honored to have me and my wife come for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DeeLee11
Reviews.Content: First of all, we booked through Priceline and got a ridiculously low rate. So, with that in mind, I can say that I really enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Resort. I had originally requested a quiet upper floor room, away from the elevator. The first room we got was on the 8th floor in the Tower. It was right next to the elevator, overlooking the freeway and was very noisy! I immediately contacted the front desk and requested a different room. They moved us to a lovely bay/garden view room in the Villa Triana building. Compared to the first room, it was much, much better. Very quiet, nice view of the bay and the room opened up to its own patio and to the lovely gardens. The walking path along the bay was conveniently located a short distance away. Each morning I took an very enjoyable stroll along the bay. The room itself was very nice with updated decor and comfortable beds and pillows. The room was a little musty-smelling but not unbearable. The resort is a little outdated, but again, it wasn't too bad. It is centrally located within the San Diego area. My biggest complaint is the $25/nite parking fee. But most 4-star hotels in San Diego charge for parking, so I expected it. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Resort. It was definitely worth the low rate we paid. If we had to pay full price, I might have had a different opinion. I would definitely stay there again IF we got the same rate and a similar garden/bayfront villa room.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and Poorly Maintained, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GeyserWhitewater
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days in the middle of April.The hotel is in a great location for Sea World and Mission Beach. Front desk staff was helpful with directions and checking to see if there was an extra phone charger I could borrow. For the cost though the hotel is very dirty. Entering hallways you notice an off smell, the tiles throughout the resort are filthy and the restaurants are unacceptable. We ate on the outdoor terrace several times and with the overpriced and uninspired menu you also get poorly maintained floors and eating area. There were boogers on the plaster walls and again the tile floor was gross. Restaurant staff was generally below average.

Reviews.Title: “Money, Money, Money...”
Reviews.Author: amedway
Reviews.Content: It's all about the money at this hotel. First of all we booked through Hotwire and the price was pretty good at $95 per night. This is an old hotel that has been renovated some time ago and it's starting to get shabby again. While the rooms are clean, that old musty smell still lingers in the room and in the bathroom the paint was peeling from the the shower ceiling. it's not a bad thing but it just tells me they don't have a very good maintenance program there. Now about the money. The hotel is located pretty central to everything but the cost of taxi's to anything is minimum $15 each way, these start to add up so you'll be spending a hundred dollars a day on them. We rented a car to save on the taxi cost. Hilton charges $25 a night to park your car there. This is an absolutely outrageous cost for a parking space especially when we came back a little later at night and there were no spaces close to our room and had to park quite far away. I was also dismayed to find I had to pay for internet in the business centre, I just wanted to pre-check in for our flight home and found you have to swipe your credit card to get acces. No way. The restaurant is also quite expensive but all resort restaurants are. All in all, next time I'd probably stay at different hotel, one that offers breakfast included and one that doesn't charge for parking or internet.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT waste your money here; poor facility, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: wildcat567
Reviews.Content: I have been craving a beach vacation for years, and even though I used Priceline to book the room, it was still splurging. However, once I booked it, I had a feeling this wasn't going to go well before we even got there. The hotel didn't return my calls for starters, then we got there and were given a single King when I had requested a double Queen. They brought a rollaway instead - after we waited quite a while for it. (Granted, I did get a call from the front desk asking if it had been delivered yet, which it hadn't). They didn't even bring it IN the room; they knocked and presented it to us (I was traveling with a friend), and WE had to roll it into the room, move furniture around so it would fit, and set it up, which then made a desk and chair unusable because it was too tight. When we checked in, I asked for a manager to call me in the room to discuss the parking situation. They charge $25/day for parking (ridiculous, given they have plenty of room for guest parking). I am disabled and have a disabled parking permit. I wanted them to reduce or waive the parking fee. The manager never called me. I ended up with a "supervisor" being brought out to speak with me as I checked OUT (not a manager). He did halve the parking fee and said "next time" I stayed there, they would be sure to "take care of me" - shouldn't they be "taking care of me" from the moment I make the reservation?!? I even told him we were not done with our vacation but were so disappointed by the room and service that we had decided to stay our prepaid 3 nights because I couldn't get a refund, but that we were going to stay at another hotel for the 4th night. That was an opportunity for him to comp a room for our last night, but he didn't make that choice. My travel buddy had breakfast there one morning: $22 for a measly meal. And I had martinis at the bar one night - $14 each! Crazy! Even the bartender recommended not ordering certain desserts because they were "the size of a MINI Reese's peanut butter cup". MINI, mind you. Peace and quiet? Only rarely - on the one hand, seeing the SeaWorld fireworks every night might have been fun, but they didn't even mention it on check-in, so we were startled every night by the booming noises from across the bay and didn't get out in time to see the whole show. Not to mention the "young adults" who were running around our small building of units, outside our door, and knocking plates and glasses over on the room service tray we had set outside by our door. Oh, don't forget: there is a fee for EVERYthing. Parking, wi-fi, gym access, etc. A total ripoff. The room was dated, very dark. There was a floor lamp that I couldn't figure out how to turn on; ends up it has a foot switch, but it was so dark on the floor in the corner where it sits that I couldn't see it. Why didn't someone come and orient us to the room? We did have "Doug," a kind of shabby but nice older man unload the bags from our car but that was it. There was also mildew all over the shower curtain. The positives? The king bed was comfy, the linens clean, the towels big and thick, and the big oval, cushioned lounge chair on the patio was very comfy to lay on when outside. Oh, and their location is good, but there are better places to be, especially if you don't plan on doing Seaworld (we didn't).

Reviews.Title: “This motel masquerades as a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: rbinsydney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights at this excuse for a Hilton Hotel. On arrival we were informed that we would be charged $25 per night for parking and were told to 'just park ourselves' (just likje the local motel - only much dearer!). The room was quite nicely decorated & spacious, but the service was woeful. The web site says tea & coffee making facilities - there is a coffee maker only & no tea bags or fresh milk. I rang & was told to ring room service for a cup of tea. The in-room booklet says there is a mini-bar - there is not, only a small noisy little fridge (empty) in the wardrobe. I spoke to the Concierge (who tried to be very helpful) and said she would get room service to bring hot water, tea bags and fresh milk to our room - an hour later, she gave up and bought a cup of Earl Grey tea at the adjoining coffee shop and brought it up to our room with sachet milk. Half an hour later, room service finally turned up with hot water only. How hard can this be!!! We went out between 10am & 2.30pm - no maid service - there is a notice in our room on whilch you can request a servicing time - we requested 5pm. When we arrived back at 11pm - no room servicing - we rang and asked for fresh towels. We noticed also that the top sheet had stains on it. I went out the next day and purchased my own tea bags and fresh milk. Full marks to the concierge lass for trying so hard to please - she must be awfully frustrated workiing in such a pathetic establishment. Wireless internet is also available at a cost of $13 per day - most reasonable hotels don't rip off their guests these days - even the cheaper motels include internet. Travel tip - pay half the price and find a decent motel - the only difference will be the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Warm, Bayfront Room is a Must!”
Reviews.Author: jhuting
Reviews.Content: I booked on Hotwire.com and got a rate of $105 per night. Upon check in I mentioned it was our anniversary and was upgraded to a bayfront room on first floor. It was AMAZING - Best view / back yard for a hotel room every. The back yard walked out to our own private patio with comfy lounge chairs, and steps from the boardwalk and the soft sand and bay. The ocean is always very windy; the bay which this hotel is situated on is much calmer and the boarwalk much less busy. It all adds up to peace and quiet, calm breezes and a whole different vibe than Mission Beach, which is 10 minute drive away. I complained that parking spots were hard to find at night and the parking fee was comped. I did not eat at the restaurants but its close to downtown and the beach, so why bother eating at a hotel? Overall, if you can get a good rate, and stay in a bayfront room, you will leave relaxed and very impressed. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Run!”
Reviews.Author: Capeguy24
Reviews.Content: Completely overprized, no value for money at all. I paid USD 450 for a socalled King Room Lanai Sea Facing ... its a big joke. No valet parking, nobody that takes your bags to the room. They don't even tell you where to go. Building work and one actually expects the Griswalds to show up any minute. The bathroom is about 1.5 x 1.5m ... they managed however to get a bath, a toilet and a basin in there. No space to get a person in too ... except of course if you leave the door open to stretch you legs. Restaurant ... so so ... food is ok, service is not existing. Their socalled hostess kind of demands "your roomnumber!", "your surname" ... the word PLEASE is not part of her vocabulary. And while you eat, a bunch of hungry guests steers at your plate to hurry up so that they can have a table too. All in all ... Never ever again. For that amount of money, you get much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleMooses_Mom
Reviews.Content: Just found bed bugs! Noticed someone else in the exercise room with the same kind of marks on their leg so it is more than just my room. There are no restaurants within walking distance other than the hotels. The food is way too expensive and high calorie. Should have stayed closer to town where I could have walked to activities. Exercise room is nice but there is a daily fee.

Reviews.Title: “Older property with pluses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: mosh
Reviews.Content: The San Diego Hilton in Mission Bay is really an older hotel and probably a misnomer to call it a resort; it's really an average 3* older hotel with some resort amenities. You get the sense that the owners know their location is great for families and they do just enough upkeep to keep people interested in staying there. There are definitely pluses: the beds are very comfortable, staff tries to be accommodating, and it has a pool, spa and conference center. Plenty of hot water and good water pressure, in room safe and refrigerator were all pleasant surprises. Great access to I-5, Sea World, downtown and coastal beach towns. The property sits right on the beach with a large (cement) "boardwalk" walking/biking path running alongside the bay. If you like taking a walk/riding a bike on a scenic path right outside your door this is perfect. Mission Bay is beautiful and very peaceful on winter weekdays. The pool looked very nice, and the conference center seemed to be in better shape than the rest of the facility. Free wifi connection was sporadically available in that lobby and in the registration area. The minuses are significant. First, as others have noted the buildings are older, rooms and halls are dark. Several rooms had a musty/mildewy odor as did the halls. Our building's outside door locks didn't lock at night so it didn't feel very secure knowing anyone could walk into the building at night from the nearby parks or walking paths. The recent renovations in the rooms are attractive but we tried several rooms due to musty odor, malfunctioning phone/TV, or absurdly poor location of the parking lots right up to the first floor patio door. There's a huge tent sitting in the parking lot which is used for special events. If you are in the tower building on the first floor be prepared for the intrusion of car lights shining right into your room. The 2 story villa buildings have no elevators so they assume everyone is ok hauling your bags to the 2nd floor room or being in the tower. The worst is indeed the noise. The doors must be hollow since we couldn't escape any hallway noises of housekeeping carts and personnel shouting to one another in Spanish or the heavy footsteps above our room which awakened us each morning. The bathrooms were renovated but the paint is chipping, and there's a panel over the tub area that is reminiscent of a 1970's era apartment. The halls and rooms are dark, and they only illuminate the ceiling hall lights and not the wall sconces, despite the unappealing dark appearance. The front desk staff are impresseive since they appear to be doing everything. The Hilton charges $25 a night for parking, plus $12 a day room (ethernet) internet connection. There is no concierge on duty for this "resort" ; which even 3* hotels frequently have, so to call this a resort seems outrageous for what you are getting. Overall, it is challenging to stay here, but the accessibility of the parks and paths, location right on the bayfront, hard-working front desk staff personnel, and general location made it a better experience. If you have patience and a patient front desk staff it has the potential of being a good vacation spot.

Reviews.Title: “We had fun and relaxed”
Reviews.Author: SoCalGringo
Reviews.Content: I think this place flies a bit under the radar due to the $25 parking fee. It seems like every post mentions the parking fee so I guess I will start off with it. Yup, you may have to park your car a bit far away from your room (far being up to 100 yards away, last night I had to park at the end of the lot). We knew this going in and in hindsisght I have been ripped off many ways that I consider far worse and it really wasn't an inconvenience to me. My final thought is factor this cost into your budget. We picked the resort because it seemed like a good place for families. The pool is nice, the grounds beautiful and the park awaiting your workout. We utilized the hotel's dock renting a paddle boat and also a bike with training wheels for my son. My son met some kids from another country and was playing with them in the pool. The tennis courts looked nice although we didn't play this time. There are no court fees. We spent most of our time around the pool, in the hot tubs, and exercising around the hotel. We had a garden lanai room. The room was decent. If you expect to be waited on hand and foot I doubt this is the place for you. However, we enjoyed the hotel and the area very much.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy...literally”
Reviews.Author: annemurphey
Reviews.Content: Crappy service, rooms, ammenities, cleanliness, and oh yeah, the ducks and their crap in and around the entire pool area. We got this hotel when stupidly doing one of those, priceline.com hotel requests. (which we'll never do again) We put in our price and area expecting a 4 star or better hotel, and this place did not match that. It looked great upon arrival, but then we went out to the pool area and it was completely full of duck poop, and a maintenance man that was trying to chase the ducks out of the pool. Figuring we'd just head back to our room and get settled we were greeted by a dark and smelly hallway, and mediocre room. We tried to get wireless access to get online and find a spot for dinner and were told that they only provided wireless in the common areas, which ordinarily would be fine, but our many attempts to log on were futile, as we could barely establish a connection at any spot, and were too busy swatting swarming flies that were everywhere to sit for very long. The staff made every request seem ridiculous and refused to provide what we would consider, 4-star service. A few other things that bugged us; Horrid, blaringly loud and unavoidable music in the pool area and bar area, rooms that still hadn't been cleaned by 4pm, $25 parking. DO, however, go here for the restaurant, Acqua. We had a phenomenal dinner here really out of this world with food and ambiance (sans the annoying music) It's definitely 4 star dining and service in there, just need to figure out a way to incorporate that into the rest of the resort. Don't stay here either unless you have a rental car, and the desire to spend most of your vacation driving from place to place. Really disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “MEDIOCRE”
Reviews.Author: Traveler201085
Reviews.Content: stayed at the san diego resort for a seminar. Got in 11 pm dead tired. couldn't find my room as the directions the lady drew was on a tiny map for about 10 minutes. You have to drive to your room no bellman service. Was walking around the parking lot in the rain. Not fun. The hallway and room smelled bad. rooms are old and run down. At the seminar I spoke with a employee and told her the bathroom stalls were out of toilet seat covers. the trash cans was full and there was no soap, she said she would take care of it. 2 hours later, the problem was still not taken care of. Fortunately, the seminar was over. $25/night parking charge! for a run down small resort with limited amenities. Hotel is run down. I wouldn't advertise as 4 star. no way. accomodations were not 4 star. 3 star at best. would not recommend this hotel at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location and pool”
Reviews.Author: Lexidove
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel in a great location. The pool area is really well designed and kitted out. The rooms are spacious and trendy. Watch out for the antequated hairdryer. It looks like someone stole it from 'Grease'. I could have blown on my hair quicker! I really didn't understand that. Lovely trendy modern rooms and then a hairdryer from the 1950's that has the gentle hum of a mild breeze! The reception were unable to assist and I had to trail along to the Spa to dry my hair in the changing rooms. That aside this is a large hotel and has a very business feel to it. It felt very impersonal. The rooms were reasonalbly priced but we were in a tower block opposite the main hotel which looked like a cheap block of flats from the outside. One side of this block overlooks the main road and could be noisy. We enjoyed our stay but I might feel differently if our stay had been any longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Chilling out.”
Reviews.Author: UnitedFansKent
Reviews.Content: After a poor stay in a Las Vegas hotel when we arrived at this hotel i thought i had fallen into paradise. The weather helped it was glorious, within a short time of arriving we were by the pool relaxing. The pool area is well layed out and there is an adjacent area to sit with a small man made stream stocked with koi and ducks. Even when the sun went down you can sit by a fire pit and keep warm. All the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was very nice and clean with balconey. The food in the restaurant was delightful and very well presented. Free internet in the lobby could be extendid to the rooms and maybe the parking fee is a bit steep when its not secure but these are the only downsides.Sea World is only 2 miles away. We could only stay for 2 nights before flying home but i would love to return sometime for a longer stay and be able to visit more of the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your wallet -”
Reviews.Author: whitegerman
Reviews.Content: This was a nice enough hotel, but everything was expensive (parking, coffee, food, amenities, etc). Renovations were nice, but still seemed a bit "tired" (popcorn ceilings, very small bathroom, noisy toilets). The grounds were beautiful (on Mission Bay) and the location was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “All around Great Resort Except Parking Fee!”
Reviews.Author: MartyArizona
Reviews.Content: Great 4 Star Service from the moment we arrived Christmas Week. Loved the location, within yards of sand & water. Easy commute to Sea World & Ocean! There really wasn't anything we didn't like except the per day $25 Parking Fee! We knew about the fee going in, and was the only downfall of this resort for us. Rooms were nice with a welcome feel. The heated pool had a great layout and looked out to the bay. The Staff was very professional, curteous and made you feel welcome. I loved the Free Internet in the lobby as i'm used to paying for it in the room. This was our 1st Trip to San Diego & Overall our experience was a 9 out of 10 with the parking fee the only downfall.

Reviews.Title: “PHM Society Conference and Symposium”
Reviews.Author: LouR2
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...great facilities and well positioned for short taxi trip to Down town, old town, ets. It is also right on the beach....food great too

Reviews.Title: “Lovely grounds but the hotel has issues”
Reviews.Author: GrantParish
Reviews.Content: My experience during my three night stay seemed to be better than has been reported by other Trip Advisor reviewers. But I am willing to guess that is because I was here for business so I was gone most of the time, didn't have much interaction with the staff, nor did I use the resort amenities. I was in the main tower which seemed to have been recently renovated, so my room had new furniture, a very comfortable bed, and fresh paint. However, fresh paint can't remedy structural issues and this was clearly an older (70s? 80s?) hotel with low ceilings and tiny bathrooms. The maintenance appears to have been deferred in some areas . I noticed several places in the common areas where paint was chipped and walls were scuffed. Some colleagues and I ate at the restaurant and were surprised to find the quality of the food much better than we expected. We were on the patio at sunset overlooking the water and it was a nice experience. The hotel is isolated so if you don't have your own transportation you will be stranded. There is no retail or restaurants within walking distance. Had I come here thinking this was an upscale resort, I would have been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Narlo_Schiesser
Reviews.Content: The friendly environment and th Hotel features are the MUST! Lay down by the pool was great, everything runs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay for our anniversary.”
Reviews.Author: SCTraveler864
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the Hilton San Diego Resort and Spa. We were celebrating our anniversary and were upgraded to a large view room. I'm not sure what people mean by "dated interiors," perhaps they don't understand the "retro" look of the freshly upgraded rooms. We were thrilled that it wasn't the standard hotel decor. The property is large, the pool area is wonderful (unlike prior reviews, we LIKED the music, nice touch). There is a hidden "adults retreat" with a tucked away hot tub and waterfalls. We had dinner the first night and breakfast both mornings and it was great (try the crabcake benedict for breakfast... wow!). We also had massages at the spa, very nice. Once you figure out how to get here, the location is very convenient to the attractions of San Diego. The only drawbacks we saw are minor: the $25 parking fee is odd since this is a self-contained property, we did have a little bit of surly service one morning for breakfast but it was a delight the prior morning (perhaps the guy was having a bad day), finally if you are looking for ocean crashing waves... this is not your place. We knew what to expect being on Mission Bay NOT the Pacific Ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Not much WOW factor to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SolarEcoGeek
Reviews.Content: My room was nice -it had a walkout patio overlooking mission bay. Mission Bay is a great place for running and biking, but it is Definitely not my favorite beach. I wouldn't stay here if you want a great beach vacation. I also liked the pool and the grounds were landscaped nicely. But there just isn't much of a WOW factor with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Old, tired hotel that's perfectly pleasant. Great location and good value.”
Reviews.Author: Buzz3434
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel, but the rooms were clean and fine enough. We got a good rate, so the value was there. All in all, a great location and a fun time.

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep on a park bench!!”
Reviews.Author: wutsurnim
Reviews.Content: It's all in the title. This place was absolutely atrocious. They have the most unprofessional staff I have ever dealt with. I travel between 25-30 weeks a year and I can tell you I will never stay at this hotel, nor any other Hilton or Hilton affiliate again!!! Dirty room, busted fridge that never was replaced, hallway reeked of urine, I think I'd rather eat McDonald's over the crap they serve at the restaurant, and $15 for a well martini?!?! GTFO! To top it all off, it is terribly located, parking sucks and they charge $25 a night for parking! Wow! I didn't know I was staying in downtown San Francisco. This place is putrid.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Review...great time...mostly pros...some cons”
Reviews.Author: jobean2002
Reviews.Content: I think I must have stayed at a different hotel than some of these reviews!! Pros: From check-in on we recevied excellent service - even some above and beyond! The room was very clean with nice ammenities and a nice balcony. We probably received the worst location since I booked on hotwire and the hotel was 97% full but we were still pleasantly surprised. The beds and pillows are wonderful. Location was far away from everything but there were alot of activities to do just near the hotel. Great bike path and a great pool. Pool was packed...lots of kids and families. One of the pool guys - Dan - tried to help us find lounge chairs (towel wars - saving of chairs). He tried a couple of times - great service!!! The pool was cool and refreshing. One morning we had bloody marys at the pool (great ones!). They don't start bar service until 11:30 which was kind of late (need that bloody mary on a sunday morning!!) but you can walk to the very nice Olive Bar (very funny bartender) and they will give you a pool drink. The beach out front on the bay (it is not on the ocean) was really pretty. They have public fire pits so we bought a bundle of wood (which they sell at the resort) and sat on the beach with a fire - it was very beautiful. They also have really nice little conversation areas throughout the hotel - and a gas firepit they light at the pool until 10:00. Cons...(minor) there was rust around the bottom of the toilet, hallways and elevator were HOT, paying $25.00 for parking, asked for a wake up call one morning and it never came. Overall we had a great time, enjoyed the grounds, the pool and the people!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, family friendly”
Reviews.Author: HoustonBusyMom
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very toddler friendly, good proximity to Sea World, located on Mission Bay, our room faced the bay and we watched the fireworks from our patio every night and had a bon fire on the beach; loved the $99 spa treatment; water & bike rentals on hotel property; short walk to mission beach playground Cons: $25 daily 0parking, hotel very busy and room service is slow, patios needed cleaning and had old patio furniture, breakfast buffet is good but $20pp, room was not ready at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay ... once again”
Reviews.Author: ValleyMom
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at this property with my husband seven years ago and was impressed then by what a lovely hotel it was. The property has since undergone a renovation and I'm pleased to say it's even more beautiful today. Our room, on the sixth floor of the tower, was a bit smaller than I would have expected (two queen-sized beds didn't leave much floor space). And the bathroom was REALLY on the small (almost cramped) side. Nevertheless, the room seemed very clean. We had a great view of Mission Bay from our balcony and were able to watch the fireworks at nearby Sea World each night of our stay -- a big plus when traveling with young children. We spent quite a bit of time at the pool, which did not seem to be heated (though it should have been -- it gets chilly both day and night in San Diego). There's also a 1-foot-deep "kiddie" pool that was nice (though not lit at night and also not heated). The two spas were very busy in the evening hours. Only one minor pool problem (not the hotel's fault): The pool was shut down beginning in the mid-afternoon on a Sunday due to an, um, "human waste" issue. It did not reopen until the next morning. That it was unexpectedly closed was a real bummer. The staff throughout the property was extremely friendly. EVERYONE we passed in hallways and around the grounds greeted us with a friendly hello and offered to assist us with whatever we might need. The concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable in giving us directions to area attractions and eateries. Same goes for a parking valet who gave me step-by-step directions to a restaurant one evening. We dined two mornings during our stay at Acqua, the hotel's casual dining restaurant. The breakfast brunch offered a decent number and variety of dishes, most of them very tasty. My only complaint: There were a lot of flies buzzing around the food because of the many open patio doors in the restaurant. I also took issue with the resort charging $25 per night for parking (which is pretty scarce in the evenings on weekends). It would get one thing if it was valet service or if the lot was secured, but neither is the case. It seemed very expensive. Overall, though, we had an outstanding stay at this property. It is very luxurious and comfortable. Can't wait to visit again. We were genuinely sad to leave on the last day of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great”
Reviews.Author: Hollykutty
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice in this hotel but the common areas weren't very clean. It's a short drive from all the sites in San Diego, which is a pain if you don't drive, but it is California and you have to drive everywhere anyway... The spa was having a $99 special, but they still tried to charge us full price afterward. It was a nice hotel but I thought they charged a little too much.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: wr943
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are actually nice and clean. The location in Mission Bay, however, is not great it was loud and not really that close to anything we like to do. If you want to go to sea world it is ok. To be sure, I can't stand the Mission Bay area of San Diego and will never stay around that area ever again. That is why I give this a two based upon location, location and location. Stay either in downtown or la jolla - Not Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for Biusiness”
Reviews.Author: norwayChicago
Reviews.Content: I generally liked the hotel but found it difficult to get around. The staff was great and the rooms were good. All in all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Smoked Out”
Reviews.Author: Momster4
Reviews.Content: Liked: spacious, clean room and the location. Disliked: "upgraded" room with fire pits directly below. Imagine yourself getting ready to go out to dinner...your hair is done...your dress on and what's that smell? Oh, yes! You get to smell like a campfire the entire night! You can't enjoy the cool, crisp air because no one bothered to let you know that the hotel would provide firewood to those who wanted to light fires right outstide your room. And it doesn't matter if you keep the door closed the entire time...you will still smell like a fire pit. Don't think that you will get to open your door in the morning either...you will just smell the ash. Please don't think that the staff will help you with this at all....they won't even offer to move you to another room. We thought it odd that only one staff member even bothered to smile at us during our entire stay. With the exception of the gentleman who will assist you in renting a bicycle, not one staff member was courteous or personable. It's almost as though the entire staff has been instructed to ignore guests. We experienced this at the pool, the restaurant and the front desk. Considering how much we spent to "enjoy" the property, we expected more. We don't think that responsiveness from the front desk, a "hi" and smile from staff on the grounds, or decent service for a meal that cost well over $200 for a family of 4 was too much to ask. Apparently, the staff at this hotel believe otherwise. So if you can live with unfriendly and poor service, smelling like a fire even after a shower and spending quite a bit of money on dinner that is average at best and served at a snails pace, then this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: chad44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about 4 years ago and it was not good! But with the renovations the hotel seems 1000 times better we had a room that was amazing and just had a great time and we will be back! It was a great Fathers Day weekend!

Reviews.Title: “all around great hotel for couples or families”
Reviews.Author: Phillyflygirl62
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was nervous about our "Hotwire" find. Turns out this hotel is fantastic. The staff was very friendly, the hotel was clean, the rooms VERY comfortable, the amenities were awesome. We used the spa, the fitness center, the tennis courts, the kayaks, the pool, the restaurant and found all outstanding. We came away after three days there extremely rested. My only complaint is that the spas were not that clean and small children were allowed to go in and out. We will go back with our teenage sons.

Reviews.Title: “A Stop for the Roadies”
Reviews.Author: TripInsider
Reviews.Content: We comparison-stopped at a series of Hiltons while driving from N. CA to Houston, TX. This hotel reads better in the brochure than it actually appears. The guest rooms( on higher floor with balcony) are furnished in heavy, dark decor--this struck me wrong; i was expecting airy and light or bright. The bathroom was extremely small, perhaps the smallest Hilton hotel bath ever. The room had been made up, but was lacking washcloths, bath mat and bath soap. These items were received promptly and a call was made to ensure i had received the items. On-site Acqua was nice, had outdoor seating with fireplaces and heat lamps, genial waiter, but the menu items were not appealing after a day of driving.(Big entrees with big prices, cream soups, complex appetizers-i wanted light and vegetarian) We finally settled on scallop appetizers and salads, which were nicely presented and also tasted good. Paved walking path is accessible from hotel. Pretty pool, but ducks were also in it! Strip of beach on inlet, but wear shoes. We spent one night, so i don't know if a longer stay would have provided more of a resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tropicana373
Reviews.Content: On arrival, hotel is very scattered and you are charged $22 a night for parking. Staff are quite rude and we found this all through-out our 3 night stay. We were disappointed to find that many rooms are "villa types" with the front door and patio doors being outside directly into public areas. Very poor security - pool only gated area, homeless people on beach and we got huge fright 1 of the nights when someone was lurking on our patio at 3am. Servicing of room is poor enough, kept having to call reception for more toiletries supplies. Towel quality is poor. Room decor is nice but hotel still appears dated. Main issue was security and rude staff. Well located if going to Sea World, Mission Beach and Pacific Beach. Would not return as there is much better available for same price.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money....”
Reviews.Author: colieanders
Reviews.Content: Booked on Priceline & was excited to stay at this "4-Star Resort". Although the grounds were beautiful the hotel itself looked old & worn (even after a multi-million $$ renovation). Parking was $22, staff was rude, not convenient to San Diego attractions. Even after paying 1/2 price through priceline we were disappointed...would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: srat
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week at this hotel and did not want to leave. I really don't understand all the bad reviews. All of the employees at the hotel were extremely friendly, always speaking whenever I passed one of them. The pool area is beautiful and the location on the bay is wonderful too. Our room was cleaned everyday by the time I got back from the pool and the room was very nicely decorated. We stayed in the tower and did not have a view, but I was hardly in the room...I spent all of my time at the pool or we were out sightseeing in the evenings. I can understand that if you don't have a rental car it might not be that convenient, but I enjoyed the park and path along side the bay. We will definately stay here again the next time we are in San Diego!
