Reviews.Title: “great location for sea world vaca, but not overly impressed w/hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CAmommaluvs2travel
Reviews.Content: Our family of 3 initially booked a 2 night stay, but unfortunately had to cut our stay to one night only. The original room we were given (garden view villa) had a terrible smell (dog or mildew) so we were given another similar room free from any offensive smells. The reason we couldn't stay another night is because the walls were so paper thin that next door we heard a newborn baby crying every hour the entire night. It was as if the baby was in a crib wailing in our own room. It truly felt as if we were sharing rooms! Maybe it was just our run of bad luck with the room situation, but I don't think it's convenient for anyone (including those with young children) to play musical rooms. The front desk hotel staff was surprisingly hostile when I innocently "reminded" them we had free parking included in our hotel package. Apparently I spoke too soon because the attendant said she was "getting to that!" I was also a little stunned that 2 of the front desk women wore Pro Union buttons as part of their uniform. I thought it was pretty offensive and shocked that Hilton would allow that. On a very positive note, we spent some time at the pool area and they had a great kids pool-very separate from the big pool, so i didn't feel as if the young single couples lounging were disrupted. The restaurant/bar food had excelent service and the free breakfast was a plus and surprisingly tasty. Overall i am glad we were so close to Sea World, but i would stay elsewhere next trip around.

Reviews.Title: “An unfortunate place with unfortunate service”
Reviews.Author: damonandtina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lots of potential and very little delivery. The primary problems with the hotel, although there are a good number of them, seem to pale in comparison to the bad service rendered at the hotel. I guess the best way to look at it if you're considering a stay is this: Why is a waterfront hotel and resort run by the Hilton company with TONS of amenities in a great location rated SO LOW in Tripadvisor ratings for the city?!?!?! Think about it. First off, some of the positives: -Nice bay location that's up against a nice city park with a great jogging path and lots of room to play and relax, whether it's water or land you wish to play on. -Good coffee and lighting in rooms, and having a mini-fridge is always a nice touch. -Pool area is nice and complete with lush landscaping, bar service, hot tubs, plush towels, security, and firepits that make for a really nice area. -Good, comfortable beds and quality air conditioning that truly works! Now, a dose of reality about this hotel that makes you feel it's all facade, and no heart. -Poor housekeeping. My room featured a kleenex and an India Palace or some such restaurant's receipt UNDER MY PILLOW! -While rooms have nice furnishings, they seem to be getting old and a bit worn down around the edges. My room featured some chips on the wall, a shower curtain coming off the rod, an inconsistently flushing toilet, and a remote control for the tv that only had part of the buttons working. -OUTRAGEOUS prices in the snack shop! Let's just put it this way,...THREE DOLLARS for a 12-ounce container of milk. -Overpriced parking for $22 per night when it's nowhere near downtown and is set next door to a park with HUNDREDS of free spots. MONEY GRAB!! Also features an overpriced restaurant, overpriced bar, and overpriced internet for your overpriced web-surfing pleasure. Lastly, and most important of all, this place simply has disgustingly poor service, particularly at the front desk. I checked in with a supervisor and had some questions about my benefits as a frequent stay member. Because he was unable to satisfactorily answer my questions, he suggested we call the main answer line for Hilton. After several minutes of holding, a lady came on the other end, and after hearing my questions and concerns offered a statement I'll never forget,...."Sir, we appreciate your loyalty to Hilton and would like to offer you and your family a weekend to look at one of our Hilton Grand Vacations destinations!!!" NO JOKE,she was trying to sell a customer with a question and a complaint a TIMESHARE CONDO!! My question was never answered, the guy at the desk kept shaking his head and smirking, and they had a customer whose stay had been ruined before it began. I'm sure with the right manager and staff that this hotel could rise up and be great. Unfortunately, it appears that will not happen anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: Bow_Wineaux
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip and I was so pleased with my experience at the Hilton Mission Bay that I wanted to leave a comment on Trip Advisor. After reading the last few reviews, I feel it is important that I leave a review to offer another perspective: We were not traveling with children, we had a rental car, we had no intention of being in a gym on a beautiful sunny day and I intentionally left my laptop at home. If that more or less fits your travel profile, there is nothing not to love about this place. It is "isolated" if you don't have a car, but it is 10 minutes to every beach in SD if you do. There is a beautiful park next door, and biking/running/walking trails right out your front door, along with bike and water-sport rentals. The staff was excellent in all regards. We did have a problem when we tried to check in early and were assured they would put a rush on having our room cleaned so we could check in. By 4:00 they still did not have our room ready so they upgraded us to a Garden Front Villa which was tastefully furnished and very comfortable. The towels were fine - don't know what to say about "sharp edges" review. And, yes - it costs $22 to park your car but I am from Seattle and this is common there, too. Being from rainy Seattle I have a thing for palm trees, and the beautifully landscaped grounds at the Hilton feature many. For only a 2 1/2 hour flight, I felt I had left the states for a tropical paradise when I arrived at the Hilton Mission Bay. The ambiance and decor throughout the property is very appealing - trendy and a touch retro but very well done. I highly recommend this hotel and the experience it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Everything You Need to Know - Good & Bad”
Reviews.Author: SSWilliams
Reviews.Content: Everything you need to know; the Good and Bad: Good: Family - This is a great hotel for families. A kid program ($12/hr), Swimming pool and Little Kid pool, Kid and Adult bike rental, Right on the beach of Mission Bay. Front Desk, Bell Hop, Kids Club, Housekeeping, Pool Staff - GREAT! Location: On Mission Bay across from SeaWorld. Watch SeaWorld's fireworks each night while you relax at the pool. Bad: Cost - You will be charged for EVERYTHING. Need to get on the internet from your room? There is a charge! Want to go to the Gym? There is a charge! Kids participate in the kid's program? There is a charge! Want to utilize one of the hotel's bikes? There is a charge! Want to make Smore's (which are highlighted in the hotel's advertisements)? There is a charge! Coffee Bar - This is not Starbucks; but they sell Starbucks coffee. Plan to stand in line for a long time to get your morning latte. Be careful, there is a female staff member that will not be only rude but will talk about you when you leave (yep she gave me her full opinion on a previous customer's outfit). Coffee Bar also closes early; so if you need a jolt after 1pm you are out of luck! Gratuity - Watch out! Gratuity at the restaurant and bar are normally automatically included in small print line item. However in bigger letters the bill ask you to write in a Gratuity amount; yep they want gratuity 2xs! Take a moment and review your bill at the restaurant and bar - there is a good chance you will find the gratuity already included. Party - Weekends are a BIG party time for local college kids to come to San Diego and party. Good chance you will wake up to some loud kids having a good time. Isolated - This hotel is on 17 acres with only 1 restaurant. Too far to walk to another restaurant. So if you don't have a car and don't want to pay too much for taxis; then you will need to eat at the resort. Breakfast is around $15 per person; Dinner is around $25 per person. Concierge - Nice group but are not too knowledgeable on local attraction costs and hotel policies. Activity brochures are hidden around the corner from the Conciergeâ€™s desk. Worth looking for the brochures and doing your own research. If you are a AAA member; call AAA directly to get their pricing for tickets to local attractions; they are normally less then what you can get from the concierge - yet the conceirge will always state they are less. Priceline - If you received your room thru Priceline (minimum bid is $80/night) then you will get the lower rooms in the tower. These rooms are fine; however your view will be of the parking lot. You can pay to have your room upgraded. Internet - In room cost money. Wireless in the comman area (by pool or lobby) is spotty. Rooms - Are dated and may have broken items (door handles, lamps). More of a 3 Star then a 4 Star; but it was not dirty and house keeping did a good job on keeping it looking nice. Transportation - While this hotel is on 17 acres; they still charge a huge parking fee - $25/night. Since it is out of the way; taxis charge a premium for usage. A trip to the zoo or airport is around $25 each way. To Sea World is around $15 each way.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely remodeled”
Reviews.Author: mciordan
Reviews.Content: Location: On the far E side of Mission Bay, right of the highway, in the middle of a very popular area of the park.Lots of people walking in close proximity to the villas..The pool area is gated, but the villas are not.The are homeless people camping around . This was the first time I did not feel safe staying at a hotel. One night, while on the patio, we could clearly see someone hiding in the bushes. The villas are remodeled, beds are comfortable, rooms are spacious with refrigerator and coffee station with Lavazza coffee.There was a damp smell that we could not get rid of; it must have been there for a long time.:-) The grounds are beautiful, unfortunately, we did not get to take advantage of all the seasonal activities - mostly available during the summer season. I would return if not for the safety issues. If you decide to go, try and get a centrally located villa, maybe closer to the pool area and not on the property edge.Also, be prepared to pay an outrageous parking fee for self parking...I believe it was over $20/ night.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: FresnoFunTraveler
Reviews.Content: When we got to the hotel, we found out about the $22 per night parking fee. The registration staff was rude and unpleasant. One party in my group discovered that thier room was not made, and had to go back to get another room far away from the rest of our group. We had requested cribs before our arrival, and the cribs were not in the room when we arrived that night. We booked our rooms on Priceline.com, and our $99 plus taxes "bargain" rooms were on the first floor directly across from the registration parking area. Finally, upon check out, one party in our group had a bar charge that took 30 minutes to resolve. On the positive side, the room had nice furnishings, and the hotel is in a good locataion near Mission Bay and Highway 5.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort in Good Location”
Reviews.Author: travelbuggie47
Reviews.Content: Unlike some prior raters, we had incredible service. (Maybe management pays attention to TripAdvisor?!) This is a resort on San Diego Bay with a huge pool and lots of water sports available. It also is adjacent to park areas with lots of updated playgrounds for kids, a walk/bikeway that is several miles along the bay, and bay shoreline where you can swim (no waves--good for kids) and have campfires. The hotel has been updated with new linens and flat screen TVs. We asked for a quiet room so had no trouble with noise. It is a good resort for families so I don't know if being next to a young family would have been a problem. Since it was off season, there were a limited number of children and the hotel was fine for couples as well. The location is close to Old Town and freeway close to other San Diego attractions. We were able to get a discounted hotwire.com price so it was a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mare2teach
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on Hotwire for my daughter, it was a belated birthday gift. I called the hotel and spoke with Lisa. I am a Hilton Honors member and so is my daughter. I was alittle concerned as I had booked this on a third party site. I made a few simple requests. I was pleased to hear that they were honored and even though Lisa did not check her in, she had honored my requests. I was very impressed . My daughter stayed in the tower rooms and shared that the location was excellent. The hotel was central to so many things they had planned to do: Zoo, Balboa Park, Mission Beach etc. She loved the pool and beach areas, rooms had modern clean lines with a nice flat screen TV. We travel quite a bit to California:(San Diego,L.A & Anaheim).I am so happy to know we can add this resort to our San Diego list! For me, it's all about service.so I wanted to tell Greg Fracassa, the G.M.at this property, how much I appreciated Lisa and the rest of his staff. Thanks for making my daughter's trip a memorable one! Mrs. W.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be stupid to stay here”
Reviews.Author: hiltonsucks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my anniversary and was astonished at the level of incompetence and terrible location. It is absolutely nothing like the pictures illustrate on all the websites. We stayed in their Lanai villa bayfront room priced at $320 per night. What a joke of room and waste of money. If you're looking for a nice romantic weekend with the one you love look elsewhere to spend it as you will be completely disappointed. Our room faced out toward the "bay" which was actually more like a swamp without trees. Its located on a public park with a bike path nearly 15 feet from your sliding glass door with constant people walking, running, biking and/or skateboarding from sun up until about 11 pm at night. Their noise can easily be heard even with the sliding glass door shut and no windows open. The furnishings in the room are all mismatched and look like they were picked up the day before at a consignment store and thrown in to make it a "room" including hanging wires to the tv and internet connection (of course you have to pay to use the WiFi) visible and dangling there under the table they set the tv on. There was not even a coffee maker even though in their description it states there is one. We ordered room service which came after 45 minutes (it was a pizza and chicken sandwich, yes seriously 45 minutes later) and both were cold and almost inedible had it not been for our hunger. The beer was the best part of that dinner and that was because it was bottled beer they couldn't screw up. You have to PAY $22 A NIGHT TO SELF PARK YOUR CAR BECAUSE VALET ISN'T OFFERED. On Sunday morning, we were woken up by two sets of crew teams rowing and yelling down the swamp, err i mean bay, at 830 am. To top it off and yes, i'm not joking about this, YOU HAVE TO INDIVIDUALLY TURN ON AND OFF EACH LIGHT BECAUSE THERE IS NO LIGHT SWITCH IN THE ROOM. I mean, is there any other word to use here besides simply, unbelievable. The best part of our weekend was when we weren't wasting time at this awful, awful hotel. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone as I regret having wasted the amount of money we spent on our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service...Chris Liano is the best”
Reviews.Author: reallysatisfied
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Hilton on a 2 day business trip. The rooms were clean, new and spacious and the staff was great...especially Chris Liano. He really took care of me. I would stay here again and reccomend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: happytanner
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay on Hotwire. My stay was determined by price and ratings. I attended a workshop at another 4 star hotel nearby The posted rate for the other hotel was $130 avg per night. I paid $99 per night, plus $22 per night parking fee and $10.95 per night internet connection which I was told is not wireless because the hotel is too old and the cost to install wireless in every room is prohibitive. The other hotel didn't charge for parking or internet nor did a local 2 star hotel where one of the other attendees stayed. Also, you could hear people using the toilet in adjacent rooms. My 'bargain' room overlooked the freeway which could be heard at all hours of the day and night. I think it is time for some soundproofing. On a positive note, the staff is great, the grounds are beautiful, beds very comfortable and the food delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Remodeled”
Reviews.Author: draudio
Reviews.Content: I am a HHonors Diamond VIP, so I used some points to take my family to San Diego for the weekend. We had stayed at this property a couple of years ago and were not impressed. We had debated whether or not to re-visit this time. We were very pleased with the remodel that has been completed since our last trip. The room was an upgraded lanai room on the 2nd floor. The extra floor space and vaulted ceiling made the room feel spacious. A large flat screen TV was nice, but the programming selection was pretty sparse. (Not that we watched much TV...). Bathroom fixtures were nice and new, not fancy. Beds and linens were comfortable. The staff was pleasant and efficient. As this was a rewards stay, I can't comment on price to value, but we were happy and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great property - rooms are dated”
Reviews.Author: pm85
Reviews.Content: This Hilton has beautiful grounds but the rooms are dated. I stayed in 543 in a roomy villa room. I am enjoying a nice view of the bay, but the room just feels dated. Also, you will need to dirve to any restaurants. They also charge $20/day for the car and $11/day for internet. It's just OK and I won't rush back. The good news is that it is very convenient to I5 and it is very close to both Sushi Ota and the original Rubios. There is also a nice walking path connected to the hotel and the pool is very nice. It you get a very good deal, then this is OK. If not, then I would hesitate to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: KC_travels08
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton Resort for a short conference in January, 2009. My room overlooked Mission Bay and Seaworld in a newly renovated guest room located in one of the villas. I was able to check into my room before noon. Accomodations and grounds (including pool) were beautiful. I didn't have time to use it, but the hotel also had a great workout facility with a steam room. The only problem with this resort, if there is one, is it is not located close to any restaurants, so you are captive to the hotel's dining facilities unless you have a car. Also, parking will cost you $22/night if you do have a vehicle. However, to keep that in context, a short cab ride to Old Town or beyond will cost you about $15 plus tip for each way, more than offsetting the parking cost. A taxi to the airport is $25 plus tip one way. The good news is the hotel's restaurant food and service is excellent if you choose to eat there. Breakfast and lunch are pricey ($15-$20/person) but dinner prices were very reasonable. I really must compliment every employee I came in contact with at this property . . . from the front desk to the concierce, from the bellhop to the maintenance people, from the housekeeper to the restaurant staff. EVERYONE was professional, courteous and out-going in their hospitality. It was a truly great hotel. Don't let the few negative reviews here convince you otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Tuning”
Reviews.Author: Bonitagranville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a standard room in Nov. through Orbitz with a non refundable, what we thought was a good, rate.for a trip Dec. 30-Jan.2 We were told we could not request a room till ck. in at 4pm.Got there at 3:56pm and were told all the waterfront rms. were taken.We were told they had all been taken by earlier ck. ins. We were told we couldn't ck in early.I asked how this happened, and they simply shrugged and said "sorry." We got stuck in a rm. for 3 nights overlooking the frwy and next to the ice machine and elevator that made noise all night long.Our last night we were talking to a couple at the bar that got a rate $50 less than ours(looking over the Bay). The restaurant was pricey, but very good with excellent service. We will not be going back,especially since there are so many hotels to choose from.I will return to ACQUA though.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families!”
Reviews.Author: Rndthewrld
Reviews.Content: Nice, well-decorated rooms. Good pool area. Lots of on site activity options. If you don't know San Diego and will be at the hotel a lot this is an excellent spot. It is close to Sea World. It is not on the ocean but rather Mission Bay which has no surf. The sailing and jet skiing are great here. One down side is there aren't close restaurants within walking distance. You'll have to drive to eat or stay in the resort which charges a bundle for breakfast and lunch.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay at the San Diego Hilton Resort”
Reviews.Author: rossde
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 straight years here in the 1990s and loved it. They have done a recent remodel and the rooms have been updated nicely. We stayed in a larger "lanai" room which gave a little more room for our two teenagers. I think the best rooms for families open up to the garden and allow young kids to walk around outside the rooms. The beauty of this resort is the setting. You are right on Mission Bay and there are so many activities available on the bay itself from sailing to biking to just walking along the bayfront path. We lucked out with beautiful weather but there is a lot to in town even if the weather is not good. A few glitches that i would be aware of: During our late December 2008 stay the "pizza oven" was broken and apparently had been for a month. It would have been nice if an insert was in the room service menus explaining this if it really was a long term problem.. There are 4 pizzas mentioned on the menu. While we had a nice bike ride and rode in a 7 mile circuit, the rental bikes are all seem to be old cruisers and have seen better days. It would be nice if they updated them as nicely as the rooms are updated. On the plus side, the beds were very comfortable, and the food was delicious. They have a nice spa, tennis courts and exercise facility with nice treadmills.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, wannabe "resort"”
Reviews.Author: mojave_ben
Reviews.Content: I was at this hotel for a conference. I was somewhat worried about some of the lousy reviews I'd read here. There was a labor dispute which seems to have been settled and that may have caused some spam posting. I had a nice room which opened onto a lawn and the bay was 100 feet away. The bay has a nice (public) walking trail and lawns; it is prettier at high tide than low. The room was nice and very quiet, and service was good. Staff in general were very helpful. Nice peaceful location. They groom the little beach. Location is a negative issue as well - there is nothing at all around there; it is in the midst of a large city park, separated from neighborhoods by the 8 lane freeway. If you expect ocean views, forget it. If you expect expansive beaches, forget it. Little kids - the 5 yr old set - will enjoy playing in the sand. Lots of good grounds for kids to run in as well. Parking is an absurd $25 and there is no overnight parking in the surrounding park / street. If you are here for a conference and want to do it on the cheap, stay at the Best Western 1/2 mile away and you can park at the hotel during the day, or walk over. I would come to a meeting here again, but would be unlikely to choose to come here on my own. It's a really nice place, but the combination of distance from off-property restaurants and high parking fees turns me off.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: stooksk
Reviews.Content: Check-in was a breeze; convenient 10 min. parking in front of lobby. We were put in the building directly across from the lobby so parking was super easy. Building looked very historical (re: OLD) on the outside so I wasn't sure what to expect on the inside but the hallway colors were very hip and the carpet very chic. I was very impressed with the size of the room and the room decor. Loved the linens, headboard, lighting, flatscreen tv, giant desk, carpet - it was all very hip and cool. We requested a king and were accomodated. No bay views, unfortunately! Bed was very comfortable. We weren't able to get a free wi-fi signal and didn't want to spend more to get the land line. Bathroom was very neat - loved the light fixtures. Only sour notes were that the toilet was round so a little on the small side and the tile shower/tub didn't get the benefit of the remodel - still looked a little dated. We walked around the property near the bay and it was very nice. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: kariMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the San Diego Resort on MIssion Bay. I was actually running a conference there, which I feel brings a more critical eye to a review, as I had 200 people letting me know what they thought. In one word: amazing. I had been here pre-renovation, and almost didn't recognize this property. The location sure doesn't hurt, but the atmosphere is created by the hotel. Everywhere I went the grounds were well kept, the pool area was gorgeous and relaxing, the fireplaces throughout the public areas were so inviting...I loved the feeling throughout the resort. The food was always wonderful, especially when served in the new restaurant that overlooks the bay, next to yet another fireplace. The final ribbon on this prize is was the staff. They were completely dedicated to making this stay amazing. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for us”
Reviews.Author: BadgerTraveler2
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in the Villas area with connected rooms. The Villas are one and two story. The rooms have a modern decor that has recently been updated. The pool area was very nice. There were no problems with noise. We slept like babies. The staff was very helpful and the restaurant good. We will stay here again when in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: LV_Bob
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and has a beautiful setting. The problem was there was a labor dispute going on with all day demonstrations. If you like being woken up at 7:30 am to screaming outside your room and the pounding of drums all day, then stay here. The problem is the hotel has chosen not to warn people of the labor dispute and allow you to be surprised when there is a mob outside your room screaming in the morning. When management was confronted, their attitude was we don't have control over the demonstrations and don't feel we should tell people or compensate. Try relaxing around the pool with drums beating and people screaming all day.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Hilton - Above Average”
Reviews.Author: jnpoulos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hilton for 7 nights. At first, we thought the hotel needed some updating despite having a major overhaul. Although very expensive and really only having 1 restaurant which is ok, we still enjoyed our stay. It is in a great location if you want to rent a bike, boat, jet ski, canoe, run a great path. No shuttle and no restaurants close by, but for a 10-15 dollar taxi ride, you can go to Old Town for some great Mexican food or Little Italy for some great Italian food. Yes, this property is not perfect. Decent tennis courts and spa. Two nice jacuzzis. Pool is also nice (watch out for the duck poop . . . ducks hang out in the pool early morning and poop in it - just ask for it to be cleaned). We had a 2 hour protest which was annoying. Rooms are spacious, but not luxurious. The "lanai" is a balcony is you are on the second floor, so don't expect much more. The lanais and fire pits on the first floor are great. The cabanas at the pool are $75 dollars for the day during the week, 120 and 150 for c9 on the weekends. If you have children under 10, the hotel offers pizza, ice cream and movie night outside by the pool on a giant screen. This lasts from 8 - 10, perfect for a nice, quiet dinner at the restaurant with complimentary fireworks from sea world. The restaurant has a great wine selection ad top shelf liquor (from Johnny Blue to Calvados). In all, not the best, but if you want some time with your spouse and a relaxing stay, I would recommend this hotel. We have already booked for next year. BTW - our son loved the kids club which runs from 2 - 4. Another two hours to spend in the hot tub and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced - maintenance issues”
Reviews.Author: greenshoe
Reviews.Content: Contacted hotel directly and then hotel toll free no. to make reservations for a family get together. This was our 3rd visit there and 2nd family get together. Agents and front desk do no know the deals offered by the hotel - you have to tell them and still speak up when checking in. I called directly to try to get 3 rooms close by with extended patio that the cousins might be able to play on and visit other rooms/hang out easily. Told agent that it was important to me and was willing to pay more for a room for my request. With taxes, the rooms were about $400 a night each. Upon arriving to our rooms, which were nicely situated all next to one another we found out that the extended patios were walled in in the back so not easy access among the rooms and also were dusty with pine needles all over and their once nice outdoor furniture grimy. Not inviting at all. Had to call to get it cleaned. Also front desk never told us us that one room only had 1 king bed instead of the 2 queens we requested and needed ( 4 in our family). Strange, since we even requested an extra room key card so our 2 kids could share it. Rooms were fine with the extended section with an small counter top area with frig but a very uncomfortable sofa/chair ? No ventilation in any of the bathrooms so can't see the mirror after showers, lacks storage in the bathroom as well as the room if you are staying there with more than 2 people to a room. On the 2nd to our last night, my husband found a mouse in our bathtub. Also found (perhaps same mice - he threw it out the back patio somehow) mouse in room next door right outside the sliding glass door. We never opened the slider door to patio after that. Called (before 10 AM ) to ask to have the bathroom cleaned really well - never came until mid afternoon (4 pm ?) even after going to the front desk in person at 2 pm to ask why no one had come to clean the tub and bathroom. and I think they only did the standard cleaning job. Can't say I want to ever go back there anymore. Other than that...the hotel is nice with it's own dock for water sport rentals, Mission bay view, and close location to Sea World. If you go there don't pay for an extended patio room unless you make sure you are getting the flat extended patio looking out at the bay and also avoid the height of summer. The hotel becomes too crazy crowded. Nice fitness facility and tennis courts. Spa was average but adding an automatic 20 % tip for the customer's convenience is a questionable practice to me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: CatpawParkville_Mo
Reviews.Content: We have three children and were excited for a fun family vacation. The resort is beautiful. The problem was it had no close restaurants or anyting else walking distance. We did not rent a car so we had to eat at the one restaurant that they had and it was expensive. the pool restaurant closed early. The kid club that they had was not good. My kids did not want to participate, it was a tiny room and the activities seemed lame. We ended up moving hotels downtown to embassy suites by the harbor and loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “this was absolutely rdiculous”
Reviews.Author: hulahey
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with my fiancee and honestly have to say i have never been treated with such disrespect. were both young and hispanic and i felt if i had a complaint there was no one to take care of it. my phone was stolen by housekeeping and after going to the front desk and speaking with the head manager numerous times i was finally sent to security and after going back and forth another couple times they told me there was nothing they could do. i didnt want to accuse the young lady but the following day my mother and best friends receieved calls from my phone, which had been taken. in addition while i was at the front desk to check out i had seen an older white female complain about something she admitted to losing and the very same manager assured her they would do their best to help her find it. the staff was rude because they assumed we had no money, very wrongly assumed. The hotel was not anything i had hoped it to be, considering it was a resort and spa, and with the name Hilton. i was extremely disapointed and i would never recommend this hotel to any young couples.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed at!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Barone7783
Reviews.Content: We arrive after a long flight from New York (5 1/2 hour flight). We get to the hotel and some how between the travel agent and the hotel, my reservation was all screwed up the hotel only had me down for 3 nights but the travel agent voucher had 4 nights. The hotel said they would fix it wasn't a big problem. We had to wait about an hour for our rooms couldn't wait to relax but we get to the room and it's not the room we wanted. They upgraded us to a bigger room and told us to enjoy our vacation and that they would take care of the mixup...so we did. About the fourth day we get a bill slip under our door saying we were checking out today. Called the front desk they need us to come down A.S.A.P. After wasting a morning on the phone with my travel agent, the front desk tells us everything is okay we spoke to your travel agent everything is ok. We get back from the zoo and our room keys don't work. They locked us out of our room because there was no communication between the morning manager and the afternoon manager. The best part of this whole vacation was seaworld which is only 5 mins away.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: qwsmith
Reviews.Content: Hotel offers no shuttle service. That means no shuttle service to Seaworld and no shuttle service to the airport. Hotel offers no laundry facilities. That means if you want a t-shirt washed, it will cost you $6.95, ouch! Hotel offers major hotel worker protests. All day on 8/16/08 the hotel union workers had protests. They beat the drums, had loudspeakers and were really obnoxious. I felt sorry for all the vacationers including myself that had to listen to them protest all day long. Hotel offers unattentive staff. Was at the pool for 2 hours and no waitstaff. Finally had to go to the bar to get a beer. Additionally, called the concierge (which was not available) left a message and it was 4 hours before I received a returned call. I could go on and on (and am even still at the hotel), but will get right down to the point, I do not recommend this hotel to anyone and will NEVER return....

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Terrible Terrible!! Left After One Day!!”
Reviews.Author: HonestTravels
Reviews.Content: Hilton's new ad says "be hospitable". Well this resort is the exception. We stay at Hiltons all the time and are HHonors gold members. We've never had a problem, anywhere in the world. This resort advertises being child friendly. Well it depends on the ages of your children. Kids under three may NOT swim in the regular pool. Even with swim diapers AND vinyl/rubber pants. When I complained, they told me that I could send my four and seven year old in the big pool alone and I could go to the baby pool with my one year old. They suggested I send a four year old in a big pool, unsupervised. To make it worse, they actually smiled smugly as they did nothing to remedy the situation. To add to that, the pool manager has never even heard of vinyl/rubber pants for kids to swim in!! They should make that clear when you book the hotel, because my family did not book a "lavish" resort to be seperated during swimming time. In fact, we checked out and stayed at another hilton available in san diego, to which we had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard but what the chargeable extras”
Reviews.Author: david_aldridge
Reviews.Content: As a family of four, we stayed here for a week as part a Californian summer vacation. Overall we had a positive experience. The location in the bay was a big plus, as was the pool area which was clean and well serviced. The room (villa with two queen beds& bay view) was clean and comfortable, our only comment being it was too small for 2 adults and 2 children. The downsides are the chargeable extras. For Example: Charging $22 per day for car parking seems excessive. We used the hotel Water Sports & Bike rental place which was very expensive, with no concessions given to hotel guests (you pay the same as public). We were amazed at the drinks & snacks pricing at the hotel, which in some cases were more expensive than UK prices! We ended up going to the local market (5mins) and stocked the in-room fridge. Also if you need cash don't use the hotel installed ATM, they have a limit of $100 and charge $3.50 for the priviledge. At the local bank there is no limit and they charged $1.50 for a withdrawal. The quality for all meals (breakfast & dinner) in the restaurant was good but again we paid half the price for comparable quality outside the hotel. There are many restaurants a short cab or drive away especially in Old Town, which are comparable quality but half the price. Our sense was that the hotel is seeking to charge extra at every opportunity. Based on this we would question whether we would return to the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer Beware! Way overpriced!!”
Reviews.Author: R0sie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the tower portion of the hotel on the property. The halls were very dark and dingy! Room was very, very small. They charge extra $$ for everything except for use of the pool. To park your car in their lot you have to pay $22/day. Major rip-off! Front desk staff very snooty.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton can clearly do better”
Reviews.Author: rickNewportbeach
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this resort on numerous occassions. After many tripa and plain BAD service, we switched to another hotel. However, my wife and I decided to give it another try in June, when we attended a local wedding. Everytime I stay at this hotel, what I am promise and what I GET are two different things. It always turns into a 45 minute hassel. Ironically, the LA Times Travel Editor recently wrote a story on this hotel and had the same problems! In fact when you check in you tend to find a lot of unhappy customers griping about something that was not done or delivered. It is a beautiful site, but the front desk staff are poorly trained and have no power to remedy problems. Once you get in, you will pay $$$ everytime you turn around so that one night "get away" ended up costing over $600. Clealry, you can do better elsewhere. Hilton is a great chain, as a Hiltin Hhonors member, I frequent them in my travels, but striike this one off your list!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: dms193
Reviews.Content: My wife attended a conference there in February. It was a really nice place to relax and unwind. We brought our 1 year old along and she had a great time toddling around the grounds, chasing after the ducks and gulls. The walking path along the bay is beautiful and there are parks at either end. So its in a perfect place especially if you have kids. Seaworld is right down the road. The room was great, but parking was a bit scarce. We had to walk around our building to get to the car. The restaurant and pool were closed while we were there, which was a bummer. They opened it the last day of our stay and it was really nice (though still cold).

Reviews.Title: “"10" It's Not... Maybe 7 or 8”
Reviews.Author: mdelasalas
Reviews.Content: We live in the "North County" of San Diego, so we were at the Hilton for a "Staycation" for 2 nights. We got a garden view room which had a little peek of the bay and a great open area in front for our kids to run around on. The room was nice and check-in (Taylor) was really good. I don't know why they charge $22 a night to park when it doesn't seem like they enforce parking. Also, I think they should give guests a bit of a price break on the Bay activities (renting kayaks, catamarans, boats, etc.) rather than charging them the same price as anyone else walking by. Unfortunately, someone pooed in the pool our 2nd day there, so we were not able to enjoy that. That was a real bummer. They closed it off and the staff didn't seem at all accommodating to the guests for the inconvenience. When we called the front desk the next morning (the morning we were going to check out) they said the pool would still be closed until the afternoon. So then we proceeded to pack up our stuff to head to our next destination up near Knotts Berry Farm, and walked over to the pool area so that the kids could get one last game of table tennis in. To our surprise (about 1 hour after we called), the pool was open, and I guess had been when we called. Takesha (I think that was her name) did not offer much sympathy when I told her at check out and only said, "well, you could go swim now." Obviously she didn't appreciate the hassle of having to unpack everything and get 3 kiddos under 7 ready. So, when I say "not a 10", I mean that this is the level of service they're striving for but didn't achieve in my opinion. This to mean, if I were a teacher grading, 10 would mean "exceeds or is above expectations." Taylor was the only one that seemed to be close... maybe a 9-9.5. All others did not seem overly accommodating or appear to want to go out of their way to please the guests. Next time we may try the Hyatt Mission Bay or go on Coronado or stay at La Jolla Shores. Suffice it to say, we were disappointed. My husband, who is usually very easy going and not very picky even said that he was not impressed with the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation in San Diego- Nice stand alone resort”
Reviews.Author: quickjaunt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in July 2008. We booked on Priceline for $102/night. For the money, this was a very nice hotel. One complaint would be the $22/night valet or self parking fee. Since there is absolutely nothing around this resort, there is no options but to park your car here and pay the crazy rate. Internet is $13 a day but I think you can get free wireless around the pool. The pool area is nice. There are a couple jacuzzi's, a kid's pool and a big pool. There are cabana's to rent for 75/day weekdays or 120/day weekends for the whole day. Overall, the pool area was very nice. Looked at the beach, but its not a beach to lay around and relax but to do water activities or biking. Our rooms were on the 6th floor in the tower. We had a view of the bay as well as the 9:50pm fireworks show at Seaworld. Fireworks lasted around 5 minutes and that was a good fringe benefit of the room. The room came with 2 beds, desk, chair, refrigerator for your things and safe. The bathroom was clean and small but functional. Plenty of towels. We stayed in 2 rooms and one them was not available until 4:30pm. Check in time is 4:00. Check out time is 12 noon. Staff is very nice. If the price is right, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego not Vegas”
Reviews.Author: emt1170
Reviews.Content: Let me start off from the beginning. My wife and I had just spent our first two days of our honeymoon in Vegas at the New York, New York Hotel and Casino where I didn't feel very welcomed or my business appreciated, maybe I'm old fashioned, but if I'm laying down almost two hundred dollars a night, I expect respect and gratitude. I just felt like another dollar bill in there pocket. Anyways after leaving and flying in to San Diego, we arrived a little early at the Hilton and Mark, at the front desk, was very friendly and professional and when he found out I was on my honeymoon upgraded my room to this beautiful room on the bay. As soon as I got there I was treated with the utmost respect and courtesy. I don't ask much of people, but when I'm spending a lot of money on a vacation, this is something I expect. But at the Hilton, all the employees were nice and friendly. If you want a great place to stay where you can get away, this would be it. You can sit by the pool or jet ski, play tennis and you're only about a 10 minute drive to the Beach or Downtown San Diego. It was such a beautiful setting with a relaxed but luxurious feel. I could go on, but I will definitely stay at this Hilton in the future. Thank you for making my honeymoon everything my wife and I had dreamed.

Reviews.Title: “Great remodel job”
Reviews.Author: dancergal
Reviews.Content: Hilton recently renovated and upgraded this property, and the rooms are a great improvement, with with flat screen TVs, better mattresses, and, wonder of wonders, the key cards always worked! [This was a major problem the 5 times I stayed at this hotel for the same business conference.] Unfortunately, their main restaurant still suffers from a limited menu, poor execution, and execrable service. The refurbished public areas, particularly the pool, are excellent. The traffic pattern from the meeting areas to the restaurant and shops has been improved as well [the former arrangement required you to exit the conference wing and reenter by the main entrance].

Reviews.Title: “Loved the new look!!”
Reviews.Author: socalmom77
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic new look! I have been coming to this Hilton Resort on and off for years. They have recently refurbished the pool area/lobby and many rooms. The new look is contemporary and in green and muted browns. We absolutely loved the pool area and programs. We brought two kids that were 13 and 14 and they were pleased with the various programs, foods, pool area. The service was excellent and they even have a starbucks onsite! Great location on mission bay! 5 minutes from seaworld we could see the fireworks from our patio in our room. If you have kids and teenagers they will like some of the events. Movies at nite by the pool area and even a bonfire on the beach roasting marshmellows. Our kids rented bikes...they even have atvs and jet skiis. The food is great and we will be returning to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Depends on what you're looking for and price”
Reviews.Author: CAFamilyRvwr
Reviews.Content: This is hard to review--the location along Mission Bay is attractive, as there are some nice bay views and it's right along a recreational path for biking, running and connects to surrounding parks and even Sea World. However, the hotel is not within walking distance of any other restaurants or attractions, so a car is a must. There is a nice family swimming pool, and rental of bike and water equipment. But rentals were a bit pricey and bicycle selection was limited and condition was not great (squeaky chain, worn handgrips). The 2 Queen room was unusually spacious, as was the bathroom. It had a nice sliding door that opened out onto the path along the bay. I could even see the fireworks from Sea World each evening from the patio outside my room. However, the tub was either in need of re-surfacing or poorly done, as the bottom had an unappealing two-tone look where the top coating had worn through. The most upsetting was being awoken by mosquitoes at night. I killed a few each day before going to bed, and am guessing that they were let in when the room was cleaned. Overall, the service seemed mediocre. When I arrived at around 3:15, I was told that check-in was at 4:00 and my room was not ready. Judging by the constant stream of guests checking on room availability and several others in my meeting group that had the same story, the management of the property seems inefficient. When I tried later, I was able to get a clerk who would switch me to an available room. I agree that it's a secluded location, so if you just want to get away from it all, or have a meeting where you just want to walk around a bit during the day, it would work, and if you had a car it could even serve as a reasonable base for San Diego attractions. So, depends on what you want, and maybe the price you can get a room for.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a girls weekend”
Reviews.Author: tkgn514
Reviews.Content: I thought the Mission Bay Hilton Resort and Spa was fantastic for a recent girls weekend. We stayed in one of the lower level villa rooms and the patio with comfy lounge chairs was great! I also liked the size of the room and the decor. Yes, the hallway and entry to the hallway looks more dated, but this didn't bother me. It seems from other postings that the tower rooms are not nearly as good. The pool area was fantastic, especially the cabanas by the pool. There were plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas during the very warm weekend. The pool bar made some really great drinks as well. It was a weekend in June, so we expected a lot of families and kids to be there and there were. Probably not so great for a romantic getaway, but fine for us. We chose this hotel since we knew we would lounge by the pool all day vs. the beach, but if you are a beach person, this may be inconvenient. The downside to this property is that it is not within walking distance of anything, although it is situated between the beaches to the north (very close), old town, and the airport and downtown (approx. 10-15 minutes away via cab). The restaurant was fair and I like that they offered pool service for drinks and food. Sandwiches and salads were great. All in all, the Hilton Resort & Spa had a good resort feel to it and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money..Checked in and right back out!”
Reviews.Author: brownanm
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take my boyfriend somewhere really nice for his birthday. The hotel pics on their website made it look amazing. Do not be fooled... the rooms (we booked a bayfront villa at $569a night) are nothing like is stated or shown. The bayfront view was disgusting. The balcony had two really uncomfotable chairs, not the lounges like they show. There was a planter on the balcony (which is on top) of another villa's roof had dead flowers growing in it. There were cigarette butts and beer bottle caps all over the balcony. The chair in the tiny room was broken. The bathroom was so small and gross. I would not have even washed my feet in there. The room was also very smelly from a burnt out vacuum they were using all over the floor. We checked in and right back out. We had to ask a manager to give us our money back. Horrible hotel... do not stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quilting4Cats
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel from May 06-11, 2008 for a combined business/vacation stay. Overall the hotel was clean, updated and quiet. The location is secluded, so a car is a must. It was very easy to get to and from the hotel and to all of the major attractions. The bay was a little disappointing as the water level was very low. Everyone that we encountered who worked at the hotel was very pleasant, helpful and attentive to our needs. The only complaint is that we had to drive everywhere. It was less expensive to rent a car and pay the daily parking rate than to take cabs everywhere. I did see one of the trolley tour busses come to the hotel but do not know if this is a standard practice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: octagon18
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Hilton San Diego Resort and only have the best to say! The rooms appear to be brand new (we stayed 1st floor main building, no view). It is a good size with plenty of room for your luggage. A comfy bed, private terrace, in room safe and deluxe bath accessories await you. We came into contact with many of the staff from the front desk, bellman, restaurant, bar, spa and housekeepers and everyone was wonderful. You are treated very well at this hotel. It is a comfortable atmosphere with enough high end to make you feel like you are on vacation and being taken care of. You have to try the chocolate martini from the hotel bar, it is out of this world!! The pool area is expansive with private cabanas and a waterfall. You are right on Mission Bay with views of Sea World and the surrounding areas of San Diego. The bay breeze is a nice thing to come back to after a long day in Sea World or the Zoo. Sea World is only 2.5 miles away and it literally is around the corner. The Zoo is 7.5 miles away and easy to get too. Coronado, Downtown, La Jolla, Pacific Beach and Ocean Beach are close by with most less than 15 minutes on the 5 which is less than a mile from the hotel. The only thing I would ask for are plasmas in the room vs the older square TV.

Reviews.Title: “not my cup of tea”
Reviews.Author: travelgalAvon
Reviews.Content: on tag along business travel with the hubby-our room was upgraded to a suite (due to status with hotel chain) with a fire pit on the back patio and the bay out the back door (very nice) huge bathroom, sunken sitting area but....the entire place has been decorated sixties retro and i just do not like a zebra striped carpet, hanging lamps, the most uncomfortable looking (as well as sitting in) chairs. the place is all brand new yet it looks dated. i hated, hated, hated it and was glad we switched to the hyatt (across the bay) for the rest of the trip (review to follow). but like i said this place is too wierd retro for me and the "oh how cool" effect wears off real fast- the restaurant was awful also-a table was open on the patio when we showed up, we were told to wait for them to set up an outside table (after they tried to get us to stay inside) waited ten minutes constantly being told "table is being cleared" etc.. were shown to the EXACT table that was clean and open when we showed up-ridiculous. food was mediocre and expensive. management did cut food bill in half when we told him of situation at checkout so that was appreciated but i'd rather have had my table right away and some decent food. will not return here

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: testudo99
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last week with my wife and 3 1/2 year old. We booked through priceline for $130 a night. Awesome deal I thought. Very nice and relaxing. Nice pool with bar in pool area. My son didn't want to get out. A lot of kids along with many adults around the pool (also had a kiddie pool for the little ones to hang out in). Rooms very clean and bathroom was on the bigger side. The room had a fridge which was nice. Parking was great, I was able to park right outside of my room. The only negative was the $22 a day to park. Oh well, the hotel made up for it. The grounds were very nice. ***Definitely would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected.......”
Reviews.Author: lisa22Boston
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, our stay here was a nice surprise. With a newly renovated room, pool, and restaurant (both just reopened), it felt more like the 4-star hotel it claims to be. All the staff, including the front desk, our waitress, housekeeping, valet, attendants, and even Starbucks were very willing to offer assistance with everything. We checked in at 1PM and our room was ready. We stayed on the second floor of the 2 story building by the water and entrance to the pool. The pictures shown for the hotel are outdated. Being a bit on the picky side, I found everything clean, nicely decorated, and relaxing. We didn't have any problem with noise as others have stated with thin walls even though there were others next to us. The $22 parking fee per night isn't pleasant but on the other hand, we have experienced that on other trips and charged more. The park next to the property is clean and a great place to take a walk or have a picnic. As I was told, you really need a car if staying here but it is convenient to every part of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Dieog--average at best”
Reviews.Author: Sentinel_Node
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hilton for a conference for 4 days... Good things: Secluded location--good for those who just want to hang at the hotel. Drinks at the bar are pricey, however, ask JV to make them, and they are delicious--especially the Mango Mojito. Undergoing renovations. I forgot my charger there, and they were nice enough to mail it back to me. Bad things: Front desk staff acted as if they were doing us a favor by checking us in--I'm Hilton Gold! We did get the breakfast vouchers though. Rooms are arranged in these odd "villas", some have indoor entries, some have outdoor entries, all are somewhat shabby. Restaurant staff is friendly, but the food is average. Secluded location--had to take a cab whenever we went out for dinner

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Hilton Resort”
Reviews.Author: BordaInc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/30/08 Check in- As I entered the Hilton at 4pm they rude associate checking me in notified us that our room was not ready. Upon hearing this I told him we were only here for one night and was there anyway to get us a room. No was his answer with no regard to the situation. He did inform us that he would call my cell as soon as ours was ready. 2 hrs later no phone call so we returned to the hotel. Our room was ready finally but no one bothered calling us. It was ashame that our check in was poor because the entrance to the Hilton is pretty decent. Room- The rooms we were at were open like a motel not a hotel. The room itself was very nice Pool- Small but decent. Parking- $22 and good luck getting a spot anywhere near your room Location- IMO horrible. It is on the bay which looks more like a dirty lake. I was under the impression that the resort was located on the beach. DONT be fooled!!! It is also to far from the main attractions (bay area, downtown, beachs) Overall- I would never stay here again. Well below avg for a Hilton resort. VERY Disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: need_sun_Denver
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Hotwire and received a great rate. The grounds are nice and the rooms were clean. Parking is $22 per day but can be avoided if you are willing to park on the street and walk to your room. We had to ask three times to check into our room upon arrival and it was not ready until well past 4pm. The concierge was not all that helpful; the Bell Hops had better information. We wanted to go into downtown, the Gas Lamp Quarter, and did not want to drive. The Concierge suggested a cab at $25 each way. When we asked the Bell Hops they helped us to locate the best trolley station to use. We ended up taking the trolley and saved ourselves over $50. Finally, the drinks at the pool are way overpriced. Go to a local convenience store and get some beer or drinks (no glass) and bring it to the pool. It is also worth asking for complimentary continental breakfast coupons. They are worth $12 each and can be applied towards your total bill. It really helps to cut down the cost of a $17 two egg breakfasts

Reviews.Title: “Hilton San Diego Resort... still good, but starting to show its' age.”
Reviews.Author: grram1
Reviews.Content: Overall it's a nice hotel in a beautiful setting. It's loaded with families and kids... so it was good for us as a family. We were in the main hotel facing the freeway. The Good: - Gorgeous setting on Mission bay. - It's only a few minutes from Seaworld. - Lots to do on the sight. - Nice pool area. - Employees were all very friendly. - Plenty of parking spaces by the main hotel. - Larger than average rooms with big balcony. - Nice bath soaps/shampoos. - Bed was very comfortable with lots of pillows. The Bad: - Parking $22/night (way too much for the area... downtown you'd expect this... in the area it is in the parking should be free; or at least no more than $10/night). - While we didn't notice outside noise, we could here EVERYTHING going on inside the hotel. Every step that was taken in the room above us, every time a door would open/close in the hallway, every time someone would open their sliding closet door or even flush their toilet we could hear it... loud and clear. - While the hotel is maintained well, it could use some updating (especially in the rooms... the tile and most of the fixtures in the bath area appear to be many decades old... and there was a bad patch job done above the shower head (like the room above must have leaked onto our ceiling and rotted it at one point)). - The TV was old and the picture slightly distorted. Most 4* (and even quite a few 3*) hotels have already upgraded to large flat-panel TV's... at this level of property I would kind-of expect them to keep up. - Took housekeeping 3 calls and 5 hours to bring us a roll-away bed... albeit the front desk was very friendly and apologetic. Conclusion: If they would update and soundproof the rooms and cut the parking fees I'd give this place the top 5 out of 5 rating it is certainly capable of. We had just a few too many problems to rank it much higher than we did (I would have given it a 3.5 out of 5 if that were an option). It's still a great place for a family get-away (especially if Seaworld is in your plans).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive; poor location”
Reviews.Author: Hans&Serife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here, paid over $300 for a tower room. very nice decorations, but very limited in other amenities. Tennis: nice, but costs $12 to use it Fitness center: nice, but costs $12 to use it Pool: nice, and free Restaurant: only one on site and there are no other possibilities for food or snacks unless you drive into town. For the price, this hotel has very limited accomodations. It is best used for isolated conferences. . . not vacationing family. For same price, could have gotten a nice room at a luxury hotel in downtown San Diego -- with free pool, tennis, and fitness center use.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, exterior still needs work”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: Once you get to your room, I think you will be very happy with this hotel. The rooms are rennovated and very nice. We were upgraded to one of the lanai rooms, which has about 25% more space than the tower rooms. This was great for us since we had our two year old daughter with us she was able ot have more room to run around. The rooms are nicely decorated as is the bathroom. Bathroom has a granite vanity and has a nice look. The only thing about this hotel is that your first time going to your room can be a little unsettling. On the way to your room, the hallways look like something straight out of a Super 8 hotel. This is not an original Hilton hotel and it shows in the way the halls look. Since they are rennovating the proporty I certainly hope they're planning on doing the common areas as well. But other than that I thought the hotel and the room were good. There is lots of construction going on during the day, so be prepared for this if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: samsen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and loved it. We definitely will return again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! We loved it...”
Reviews.Author: wannawazoo
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend in San Diego. My husband made our hotel reservations online at Priceline. I was very, very, very, VERY worried about how it would end. It was PERFECT! We were able to check in super early (11:00 am), we were "upgraded" to a "villa" with two beds (we're a family of 4). The rooms are beautifully decorated. Very zen like. My ONLY complaint is the bathroom. The tile in the shower had mold (ick) and the floor was NOT clean. The entire room was remodeled yet the bathroom shower/tub looked as if it had been there for 25+ years. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We got great recommendations for restaurants. The restaurant on-site was OK. Our kids loved it but we thought it was just OK. The grounds were so pretty. The hotel is being remodeled and I'm sure it will be fabulous when it is done. We'll be back for sure! :)

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & nice decoration”
Reviews.Author: smsteffy
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I've been there about 4 times now and I've never been disappointed. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms are clean, large and cozy. Finally a hotel that pays attention to the decoration! The service was always great, nice surrounding, just next to the golf course. The restaurant is also great, on the beach with outdoor fire pits, great food. I read a review saying that the Paradise Resort was much better... I HATE the Paradise Resort and I don't think that it should a 4 stars hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “great for the price”
Reviews.Author: reds04
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and was a bit scared- but I went in January and didn't care about beachfront bars/dining, construction and water in the shower. It was perfect for my stay - big, clean rooms w/fridge & coffee, place to run, fitness center, AMAZAING staff. I changed rooms immediately - nothing wrong w/it -my choice. Every request was filled quickly and a manager called immediately to confirm it was done. Location was 5-7 minutes from most places - if I didn't have a car, not sure I'd stay there, but otherwise fine. Yes, there is some construction, but it didn't affect my trip - for the really cheap price, it was perfect for me. $20/day to self park is a drag, but same as other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: bbqt123706
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed in this hotel just before Christmas -- a little getaway from the extended family during the holidays. We were very impressed with the hotel grounds and incredible service, which was surprising after reading the reviews on this site. We arrived quite early into the hotel (11am), hoping to check in early and take advantage of the hotel grounds. Because the hotel was not too busy, we kindly asked if we could check in early and for an upgrade. We were surprised to received a lovely bayview room, even though we booked on Priceline. The staff who checked us in was wonderful, she even gave us two complimentary breakfast coupon because we had to wait 5 minutes for her to complete our check-in (which we didn't even mind in the first place because she was trying to upgrade our room). The hotel consists of one set of tall tower rooms and a series of two story cottage-like buildings. We stayed in one of the two cottage-like buildings overlooking the lovely mission bay. The exterior was a bit dingy and dark. The interior, though, has been remodeled recently and looked contemporary and fresh. Great bed, comfortable furniture and large bathroom. Our balcony with cushy furniture overlooked the bay. Very romantic at sunset and sunrise. My fiance and I took long walks on the quiet and private beach area. We had breakfast at hotel restaurant. The complimentary coupon was for 18 dollars each person, which more than covered our delicious meal (large portions, great food). The restaurant overlooked the bay area. I only wished the parking was less expensive (20 dollar a day). Unfortunately if you bring a car, you are pretty much stuck with paying for parking. The adjacent public parking lots do not allow for overnight parking. We saw many cars with warning tickets-- which the owners promptly went and paid for parking. Overall, we had a terrific time.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmoreandmore
Reviews.Content: I was worried about what I would experience at this hotel. I grew up in San Diego and had always wanted to stay here, but when I travel home, I tend to use discount travel sites like Priceline and Hotwire to book my 3-star-plus hotel rooms, and this one had never been offered. So, when I booked through Priceline for $75 a night, I was thrilled when this hotel was on my confirmation. I quickly got on here to check the reviews, and was shocked to find so many negative ones! Well, I have no idea how this hotel could have been the same one that received negative reviews. We arrived at the hotel at 7:15am after driving all night with a baby and a 2 year old. Check in was awesome - although our reservation had gotten messed up in their system, the employee quickly and immediately fixed everything so that it would match exactly how we described the booking to her. Then, while my husband slept, I took the kids to visit with my sister. He reported that the entire time I was gone, he heard no noise from the rest of the hotel. I have to agree. I was not once bothered by anything during our stay. Now, to describe the room: it was GORGEOUS!!! We walked in to a beautiful tile entry, and a completely updated, remodeled, redecorated room. It was cozy, comfortable, everything we look for in a room while traveling. We ended up with a King Size bed, which was great for us, as the baby and toddler usually want to sleep with us while traveling. This hotel gets an "excellent" rating from me because it exceeded every expectation we had. I will definitely be staying here again, even if we have to pay full price - it's worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Priceline for $100/night. When we arrived, we noticed the beautiful grounds and Christmas decorations all around. The check in was quick and the empolyees very friendly. Our room was decent size, with a balcony overlooking the gym area. The bed was very comfortable, probably the best hotel bed we've ever had. A few posters mentioned the thin walls...yes, you can hear the people next to you, but that didn't bother us. We spent very little time in the hotel since we didn't come here to sit in the hotel but to enjoy beautiful San Diego. We were here only to sleep then left for the entire day. The pool area is undergoing construction, but we wouldn't have used the pool anyway in this weather. The area around the hotel is beautiful, with awesome jogging trails nearby. Bring your running shoes. They serve Starbucks coffee in the lobby, but not just coffee as you would normally see. They have almost all the drinks that a regular Starbucks would have. Our only complaint is that they charge for internet and parking. We had our own internet connection, so didn't need to use theirs, but they should offer free wireless. The gym also charges $12/day, but if you sign up for H Honors on their site, you'll get the gym access for free and it costs nothing to sign up. Overall, this is an awesome hotel with friendly staff and a great location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice resort! Loved the Beds!”
Reviews.Author: johnandbilldc
Reviews.Content: This Hilton Resort had the most comfortable beds ever! We really enjoyed the 4 nights of our stay here because we felt like we were on a resort. The decor of our room was top notch and the bathroom was pretty large. It looks like they've been renovating as the pool area was under construction. We were close to Sea World, however, anyone staying at this resort would definitely need to have a car to get around San Diego. It is not walking distance to anything. The good points: - We loved the beds! - Personal care items were nice (Crabtree & Evelyn) - Large Safe - Decor was classy - In-Room refrigerator - Flat screen TV - Resort grounds were nice - Resort gym and tennis courts were nice Things that could be improved: - Better lighting in the room - Heating in bathroom could be improved - In-room internet access should be free (why is there a charge?) - On-resort parking should be free (again, why is there a fee for parking for guests?) - No movie channels.. what?! Overall, we enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bring The Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: bid1nt
Reviews.Content: The upgraded decor was very nice and the hotel has a beautiful Mission Bay location. However, the walls (and floors) between rooms were surprisingly thin. $20 for parking - ouch! Fun place if you like water sports, but not the peaceful romantic getaway I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: scottybound
Reviews.Content: My family and I enjoyed every minute of our stay! Yes, there were a few hick-ups here and there, but that happens everywhere and you should expect it. People that just want to complain about every little thing should just stay home. They have recently remodeled all of their rooms in a very unique style. On top of that, they are planning on remodeling the restaurant, the pool, lobby, gift shop, and eventually adding a new conference center. One of the other reviews does not give Noble House enough credit. To think, in just a few years this will be a brand new resort! It's very exciting, especially for our family since we plan on returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: achen_phx
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews, I was expecting the worst. We stayed in room 566 with a view of the resort tennis courts and Interstate 5. The room was quite large w/ new and modern furnishings. The bed and linens were very comfortable. The bathroom was nice - the majority of it was new (except for the shower). The hotel provides Crabtree & Evelyn amenities. One thing I didn't like was the dark hallways. One side is painted in a cream color while the other is a dark brown, which makes the entire hallway very dark. We only stayed for one night and didn't wander around the resort itself, so the rating is for the room itself. The location of the hotel was good. Highway access is very convenient and it is only a ten minute drive to downtown San Diego. Considering that I paid $100 for the room via Priceline, I was very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: HI808
Reviews.Content: Our family of recently stayed at this "resort" hilton hotel for the first time. Expecting it to be like other Hilton resorts, we planned to enjoy the pool and other featured amenities of this hotel. Therefore, we only went to Legoland on this trip, with the plan of coming back to enjoy the hotel with our 6 and 7 year old girls. The room was nice and clean when we arrived. However, on the second day, when we returned in the evening, we were surprised to find our room had not been cleaned and a message was left from housekeeping. They said we had a sign on our door, and if we wanted our room cleaned to call them. Well, it was 9:00 p.m. and we were checking out before 6 the next moring. So, we just called for fresh towels and for our trash to be emptied. The beds were still in disarray. Lastly, as we were checking out on Oct. 8, we called for assistance with our luggage to the front desk at 5:00 a.m.. At that time we were asked if we had our ticket number for our car validation, so that they could get the car. We waited for 20 minutes and no one showed up to assist with our luggage. So, my husband made two trips to bring our luggage to the front desk area, while I stayed in the room with our two girls. When we finally all got to the valet area, we were surprised again... no car!! It had been 30 minutes, with no one else checking out, they could not find our car!! I expressed my disappointment to the front desk, who were very apologetic. I would definitely not be staying there again. Our friends were planning to stay there next summer, I will convince them to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leavinlv
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews and was a little sacred when I booked this hotel on Priceline. I was pleasantly surprised when I found that most of the reviews were very off base. At check in I asked if they had a room with a view. They did for an upgrade fee of $40.00. I accepted and in return the front desk staff told me he would take care of the parking fee for me ($20.00) and give me a free continental breakfast ($14.00). I know people have complained about the parking fee but if you have ever stayed anywhere in California this is not uncommon and you just have to deal with it. One night, parking was scarce but if you like you can valet and all you have to do is tip the valet when you pick up the car. Your parking fee covers valet. Again, this is California, deal with it. When you visit other states or countries there are customary things you have to deal with. The hotel and grounds are very nice. We stayed in a tower room with a view. The walls are a little thin so if you are a light sleeper beware but I slept just fine. Some people had complained that the bay is dirty. It's a bay, not the ocean. It is not a huge bay either. If you get a room with a view it is pleasant. The people I dealt with were all very nice, always saying hello. If your not nice don't expect someone else to be nice just because they are at work. I wouldn't stay here for the price the hotel charges but that is just me. I paid just over $100 per night on Priceline and I think it was a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: NVbuck
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed at the Hilton in order to visit SeaWorld and Legoland. We were disappointed by the small musty smelling room that we were given. At $259/night I had also expected much more from the property. However, the pool area was not clean and ducks were swimming and pooping in the children's pool. I will compliment the furnishings and linens as well as the fitness center. But overall, this hotel seems best suited for corportate conferences and not for a vacation destination.....not worth the money at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Resort is a little over selling--bad food!”
Reviews.Author: marqule
Reviews.Content: I attended a 4 day meeting at the hotel. I read the Trip Advisor reviews and was prepared for the worst. That probably helped, because it was better than I thought it would be. I didn't have problems with the staff...they were all helpful and polite. The technology didn't work so well, though. Meeting room wireless was spotty. The food is average...and when you consider "average" in the world of hotels, it's not great. I travel a great deal, so my standards may be high, but in southern California, I would expect a lot of great, fresh healthy food. Not so much! It's more like hotel food available in Indiana. No thank you! All in all, it wasn't as bad as I suspected, but except for the views, it's not a real resort where everything is over the top. The weather can't be beat, but you don't have to stay at the hotel to get that!!

Reviews.Title: “"Quality, not like it was when the Hilton actually owned it"”
Reviews.Author: schnookemsmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at the "Hilton Resort" for the past 4 years. Don 't be fooled by the name Hilton, as they do not own it anymore.
