They sold out to the Noble House 3 months ago. If you have ever stayed at there propert Paradis Point in San Diego, you know what a dive the Hilton Resort is resorting too. We had booked our stay in our usual room on the bay. A king room with lanai with a fire pit. Great location, however they recently renovated the rooms and removed the ceiling fans in all there rooms. With an energy crunch, who does this. We no longer could enjoy the cool breeze with our fan as we had done in the past. Instead we had to run the air conditioner. What a waste. When they renovated, they put in some funky type wicker furniture that is not comfortable. The patio furniture is just as uncomfortable. When you are paying 480+ a night you expect better. The stay started out with the staff just completely rude. The young man checking me in was quite unpleasant, wanted to know who had made my reservation for me as they had not done it correctly. Like this is my problem. He did not greet me with Welcome back, Mrs. Smith like they had done in the past. Then the bellman. What a joke. He piled everything up on the cart and knocked over our 200 dollar radio and the speaker cover broke off. He never replied with sorry, he just wanted to know if we had any more stuff. He was rude and obviously did not want to be there. Our second day was suppose to be a relaxing one by the pool. However, someones small child pooped in the pool. My 4 year old is not terrified of swimming in there pool in fear of seeing poop in it again. As it floated right past her. They solution to this was bus everyone to Paradise Point. This wasn't quite working for us. So we swam in the polluted bay along with most people. You would have thought they might offer to bring out some lawn chairs for us. No such luck. I believe the facility has fired all there long time employees who are union. As they were picketing at the hotel during memorial day weekend. I wouldn't waste your money at this place. If I were the owners of Hilton, I would definately take me name off the place. Also, there use to be such fun activities all the time for families, such as samores and volleyball on the beach. Not anymore. And don't spend your money on the Kids Club as the young lady who suppose to be watching the children in the pool, would leave them for minutes at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip, great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: lnmfulkerson
Reviews.Content: Fantastic family vacation! The hotel is just beautiful and the grounds so lush. We booked a room through Priceline and I was a little nervous having read some of the bad reviews here on Trip Advisor. I was pleasantly surprised to find that nothing written about this hotel was true. The staff were more than helpful. From the time we checked in to the time we checked out we were greeted with smiles and "how can we help you?" Even the grounds staff were friendly with a "good morning". On two occasions we asked for more coffee for our room and not only did it come within 5 minutes, the front office called our room a little while later to find out if we had been taken care of. True customer service! The pool is very large and there are plenty of chairs. I especially enjoyed the little kids pool since we had our 3 year old with us. The pool is 1 ft and is perfect for little swimmers. Didn't have to worry about the older kids splashing and horsing around too close to the little kids. The Banana Cabana offers a full bar and grill as well as snacks and drinks for kids. A little over priced but what resort isn't?? We ate dinner at the Bayside Grille and had one of the finest dinners we've ever had. True fine dining. Don't expect fast food when eating at a 4star restaurant. Good quality food takes time but is well worth the wait. Everything was cooked to perfection and beautifully presented. I highly recommend the mushroom crusted halibut! We didn't eat there for breakfast or lunch so I can't tell you if the service is faster at those times but I can only assume so since they never had a wait time. Expect prices to reflect the qualtiy of the food. If you want fast, cheap food try Dennys. I've often said that bad travelers write bad reviews. People who treat other people badly will in turn be treated badly themselves. A little kindness goes a long way and a simple thank you every once in a while tends to get better service than behaving like a horses rear-end. I have learned to take other's bad reviews with a grain of salt and fully believe that people who have nothing nice to say probably NEVER have anything nice to say. Enjoy this hotel, we did!

Reviews.Title: “Was really nice for years... that has changed”
Reviews.Author: Casualfamilytraveler
Reviews.Content: For over $300 a night, they might want to have better customer service. When we checked in and went to our room, we got a huge surprise upon opening the door. Of course it was probably a bigger surprise for the people who had arrived at the room five minutes before us and were already camped out on the beds. One would think that the front desk would respond diligently to such a problem of double booking, but after a curt "we'll do what we can" reply on the phone, the other family called with a little more fervor. After twenty minutes, someone arrived to give the other family key cards to their new room. They didn't help them move, didn't apologize, and didn't offer to tidy up our soiled room. They did manage to deactivate our room keys though. When we went to the front desk for new keys, the lady proceded to give us a lecture on proper key usage like we were kids. While the location is beautiful and San Diego is a magic place for our family, this stay ends a six-year routine we have kept. Something changed drastically in the way the property is managed. The hallway smelled of mildew like we never smelled before. The staff attitude was indifferent and rude, when it used to be very friendly. The kicker is that two months after the fact, I got a form letter from the property manager saying something along the lines of "we appreciate your feedback and will consider your input" or something like that. When I emailed back to say "don't bother," it was clear she had no clue what the problem we encountered was. I got a form response about "improvement and change" with all sorts of corporate buzzwords like "synergy" and "teamwork." It thoroughly explained why we had the experience we had. No one in management listens. The vibe from the staff was one of indifference and being there solely to collect a paycheck. While the property is beautiful (despite the sometimes polluted bay), it is not worth the huge prices they want. To top it off, parking is extremely difficult, because with a full hotel, packed conference rooms, and sections of the parking lot closed off for their storage and events, there are not enough spaces. It was sort of ironic to pay for parking and end up on the street a couple of times. Granted, we always had a space at night. It really is a shame, because the location is great, the building is beautiful, and the rooms are great for beach front. It's just that they semeed to have stopped caring.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing”
Reviews.Author: traveler261
Reviews.Content: priceline misrepresented this place as a 4-star, but it should be a 2-star. very old facilities. my wife called room service for utensils or something; they said they're very busy and we should go get it ourselves. not recommended. parking is 20 bucks per day. this place is worth 40 per night, no more.

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice rooms, very rude staff and too many young children”
Reviews.Author: 1AroundtheWorld
Reviews.Content: Pros - recently renovated, rooms are pretty nice. Cons - staff seemed like a bunch of thugs. they seemed to be intentionally unhelpful. the manager seemed to promote this attitude. Also, status with hilton meant nothing to them. isolated hotel, far from any other restaurants, etc. this hotel is not for anyone but families with young children who want isolation.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on the name Hilton, and too bad for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: heisenhaure
Reviews.Content: After a long day of traveling from the east coast, we were hungry, thirsty and couldn't wait to sit down. They were over booked and had to move our room. poor. Everything closes at 11pm. On a resort with near 500 rooms there should be some sort of vending available anywhere. NADA. One soda machine and it was sold out the entire 4 days we had to stay there. Not even $6 bottles of water in your room! No mini bar, nothing. The best they could do was send us to an all night grocery store a half mile away. They have an area they call an adult retreat, with a hot tub and water fountain, which is nice, except there was never a clean towel available. The hotel rooms are designed like a fancy motel 6. rooms have patios or balconies, but they are open in the entrance way to the outdoors. those floors are disgusting. there was dirty q-tips and a broken glass in the hall way I had to walk through for 3 days. the parking is disastrous. you can use valet for no extra of the $21 a day they charge, but they rarely answer the phone when you call for your car to be ready, and if your coming, they're on their cell phones while taking your car. I have never been more dissapointed with any hotel or for this case, the motel class stay. If I was Hilton, I'd sell this piece of crap property as soon as possible or do some serious management changes. They have beach front on mission bay across from the park. If you want a beach chair, there are 2, yes only 2 and they are first come first serve. if you wanted you could rent them from the beach hut for $5 for the day, except they were stolen and havent been replaced??? (that's what insurance is for...) Any time we complained, we got the shoulders up, head cocked, shrug. Wish they had room at the holiday express. Oh, but they do have a very friendly Starbucks cart in the morning. Yay, Starbucks! BOO Hilton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Noise and indifferent management--the bad reviews are true”
Reviews.Author: jules1700
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed here so many times over the past 20 years and the last experience broke my heart. I asked for a room in one of the "villas" away from the noise. I was given a garden view king rooom that had just been remodelled. During the weekend, they book weddings in the gazebo on the lawn. They started preparing for the wedding (setting up chairs, testing the sound system and bringing out the food) at 5. During the wedding and the appetizers afterwards, there is no peace either on your personal balcony nor in the room. The reggae steel drum band played for all but 1/2 hour during 5:30 to 8:00. The noise competes with your TV in the room with all the windows/doors closed! When I complained about the noise, management told me that they conduct weddings on the property. Period. And it makes no difference if it inconveniences someone like me who wants to read on the deck of the room that they paid for. The next morning I woke up and found an empty case of beer on the hood of my car, chicken bones on the lawn and empty beverage containers all over A number of employees passed by, looked and ignored the mess. When I contacted Hilton customer service, they promised me that the General Manager of the Property would call me back. When I hadn't heard from them, they told me that the General Manager's response was "we conduct weddings on our property." Period.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_consultant
Reviews.Content: I always prefer to stay at Hilton family of hotels being a platinum hhonors member and I was not dissapointed. Room was compact but furnished very contemporarily. The balcony with the bay view in the tower was awesome too esp during sunsets. Service was ok but I have stayed at better hilton properties in orlando. I had requested for a cab one evening..waited 30 min and no show. I recommend this for families with kids. They have a huge pool and also play movies on a big screen by the pool after dark. $20 a day parking is ridiculous and includes valet parking. The fitness center is very outdated and crampy. The breakfast buffet is good but very pricey $20/person.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best of times, it was the worst....”
Reviews.Author: tinabinab
Reviews.Content: I booked my room on the same day of my arrival through Priceline. $80 was definitely a bargain and overall my experience was positive. Checkin: I arrived at about 10:30 in the evening on a Sunday night. I was initially very impressed. There was a live band playing in the background, and it definitely added to the resort feel. Checkin was quick and easy. (Be forewarned if you use Debit to backup your account, they will put a hold on your account for $100 for EACH day of your stay!) The Room: Our room was 377. The hallway had that funky smell that has been mentioned in other reviews. Smelled like fresh paint to me. It was noticable but not too bothersome; I could not smell it in the actual room. My first impression of the room was "WOW". It was very contemporary - not my style, but very nice nonetheless. Also liked the balcony area. Beds were very comfy. The NOISE: This is where the WORST part comes in. I have never stayed in a hotel where the noise was almost unbearable. Light sleepers beware! The noise tended to peak at the 11:30 pm timeframe - about when the Sea World folks were returning and then start up again around 7 or 8 am. You can easily hear footsteps, voices, doors, and of course the unique toilet flushing sound. Sometimes it sounded as if it was several floors above. It was quite obnoxious! I'd managed to wear my 3 yr old out every day of our stay, so luckily SHE slept through it all. Restaurant: We ate breakfast at the terrace restaurant every morning. It was consistently good. I ordered from the menu two days and did the buffet one. Both were good. The buffet had a little of everything and then some. $22-24 for one adult and a child (includes tip) wasn't great, but it was convenient and tasty. The service was excellent. General appearance: The grounds in general were very nice and well groomed. You could see people working each day on maintaining this. The pool area was lovely and had quite a lot of shade in the mornings. It looked like a nice place to just sit and relax even if you weren't enjoying the pool. Parking: As mentioned before, the $20 parking fee is outrageous. We did self park each day as I did not want the hassle of waiting for a valet. We never had a problem parking close to the tower. Overall we had a good visit. The location was very convenient to Sea World and at $80 on Priceline, it was definitely a bargain. I would probably prefer to try something else next time, but wouldn't be terribly upset if I got this hotel again. Just wish they could fix that noise issue.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not great serice”
Reviews.Author: stacStac
Reviews.Content: Although it is a beautiful hotel on a nice property, the service was somewhat bad. When asked where to go dine, the conceige flopped 2 huge books in front of me with a grumble and nothing more. Unlike other hiltons we have stayed in, this one makes you pay for everything, and pay alot. A cheeseburger for lunch was over 12$. Breakfast was 22$. Also on the last day we stayed there, they skipped us on cleaning up the room. After tiding up the room ourselves we called for some towels and coffee. We received some towels with no other ameties, as if they were bothered that we picked up on their mistake. For the $$ that you pay the service was not up to par. We are Hilton Honors members and usually receive great treatment. Not so at this one. Prepare to Pay!!

Reviews.Title: “Worth overlooking the shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: farawayland
Reviews.Content: The exteriors of the buildings are showing their age. Tile throughout the grounds are dirty and cracked, the floor mats in front of room doors are often dirty and glasses from room service (not ours) were not picked up in front of our room for 3 days. The room we stayed in was quite large with two queen beds. Apparently they upgraded us from the normal garden view room to one that was 25% bigger. If you can afford the extra few dollars get this bigger room rather than the cheaper smaller ones. The smaller rooms had their patios right outside their front doors on commonly used walkways rather than on the oppossite end of the room the way ours was. While we could see other people from our location we at least didn't have to worry about people tripping over our feet while they walked by. The room was updated with new carpeting, bedding etc... Beds were comfortable but not as nice as some I've stayed on. The bathroom was loud, you could even hear when neighbors took showers, but had nice towels. The pool and grounds around it were above average, even better than I had hoped based on the rest of the exterior condition of the hotel. There were lots of kids on the weekend however so I wouldn't recommend for someone looking for a quiet get away. The weekdays we were there were very quiet. Some rooms have fire pits outside. I personally did not like this as I don't want to smell smoke when I'm sleeping. We had a family move in below us who liked a good fire so that prevented us from leaving the sliding glass door open in the evenings. The beach that is right outside of the hotel is really nothing special at all compared to the other excellent San Diego area beaches we visited. Still it gave our 3 year old a chance to play in the sand which is all she really cared about. We had lunch and dinner at the hotel multiple times. It is very expensive but was of a high enough quality that we weren't dissapointed. One tip. Ask for the lunch menu if nothing on the dinner menu looks appealing. I could only have steak so many times and discovered that they'll server lunch during the dinner hour. The turkey wrap I ordered while still expensive was excellent. I'm giving the hotel 4 stars simply because I enjoyed myself. For that reason alone I believe it deserves more than 3. It makes it easy to overlook the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: J2meLumi
Reviews.Content: I booked a room through priceline. I named my own price at $129 for the night. I was coming down to stay for one night after seeing John Mayer in concert at Coors. I booked a king size bed, when I checked in I received 2 doubles. My room was also on the ground floor. Not a big deal since I can see out the grounds to bay from my room. The room was recently updated with more modern bedding and bathroom fixtures. The bed was comfortable, no complaints there. There were crabtree and evelyn soaps and etc. The room showed some dirt in the grout, but overall it was clean and comfortable. The TV was older, but fine. The walls are extremely thin. I could hear my neighbors TV go on and I could also hear her talking on her cell phone clearly. I didn't like that I had to pay $20 for parking like other visitiors complained about. I had in-room breakfast. $17 for egg whites, bacon, toast, coffee, juice and potatoes. It was pretty good. Crisp bacon, warm eggs. Toast was cold though. I didn't have a chance to tour the grounds, but from what I can tell, it looked nice. Overall not a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “This place was just fine!!”
Reviews.Author: timbo2003
Reviews.Content: This place was just fine. The grounds are clean, and it's a typical hilton experience. Many of the ground floor rooms have firepits which is nice. It's on the bay and has a nice boat dock, along with all sorts of rentals. The in room coffee is pretty decent. "TC" at the front desk was very attentive and helpful. I stayed for two nights with my wife, and would recommend, so I'm not sure what other people were unhappy about.

Reviews.Title: “What's with all the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: Drewtoo88
Reviews.Content: After reading all the negative reviews on this board I was really scared to see what the place was like when my girlfriend and I showed up Memorial Day weekend. The funny thing was, I don't know if it was my diminished expectations from the reviews, or the fact that I think people like to complain too much and we donâ€™t, but we thought the Hilton was great. The remolding was done from what we could see and our room, which was in the tower on the 7th floor, was very nice indeed. There were new amentias all around with a very comfortable bed and a tasteful modern decor. There were plenty of towels and the place had no oder as some have reported on this site. The staff was incredibly friendly as was the concierge, who recommenced some very nice places to eat. One was in Old Town called the Coyote Cafe that served some awesome Mexican food and the other was the Crab Catcher in La Jolla, which was expensive, but hey, It's La Jolla. The pool was very nice as was the view from our room, which allowed us to see the fire works display every night that Sea World put on. There were a lot of kids, but because I think the Hilton is some what price prohibitive, there were no riff raff or uncontrolled kids around the place. Too, the pool will keep the kids busy for a least half of the day. And if you're not bringing kids, the place was great for couples too. Again, Iâ€™m not sure what people expect in this world sometimes, but I have traveled many places and I can tell you, for a nice get away that is located very conveniently to all the attractions in the San Diego area, the Hilton was very much worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: honeymomarizona
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible drive to San Diego (hail along the way, zero visibility through a mountain pass, antilock brakes kicking in all of the way going downhill out of the pass). I mentioned how glad we were to be at the hotel to the clerk and how horrible a drive we'd had. I didn't expect much of a room because I booked using Hilton Honors points. In fact, we were only able to book a king bed room (we wanted 2 beds) and request the 2 beds. The clerk then told me that she was giving us a room with 2 queens that was 25% larger than their regular rooms. To make things even better, the room she gave us had a bay view. Our room was very clean and definitely renovated. It was in one of the garden wings (not the tower) near the bay. It was very contemporary in style (if previous posters did not have a contemporary room, they may not have had the renovated room that they thought they had). There was an additional area where the bar was, that was down a few steps. It had bamboo or bamboo like flooring. The kids wound up playing down there (it was the area that made the room 25% larger) and we nicknamed it the playroom. We were so tired that we ate dinner at the hotel restaurant. I usually prefer to dine off premises because hotel restaurants are typically not worth the money in places like San Diego where there are so many good restaurants. While it wasn't cheap, it was quite good. The creme brulee for dessert was perhaps the best we've eaten in years and was large for the price. The pool area was large and attractive. However, the water was 12 feet deep in parts. That makes me nervous with my kids swimming. Definitely one of those pools where we joined them a lot and watched them like hawks when we weren't in the pool with them. My only complaint with the hotel (which will be an odd complaint because this seems to be the one thing that other people consistently like) is the hotel's location on Mission Bay. Mission Bay really has at least two different parts to it. The part that the Hilton is on, is the least attractive of the two. It looks more like an estuary than a bay. I didn't really get that great I'm on the water feel that some of the other Mission Bay hotels give me. But, it wasn't horrible either.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Price -- As Long as You Don't Need to Park”
Reviews.Author: lesrion99
Reviews.Content: Like many others, I booked this hotel on priceline. We got one of the newly renovated rooms, which was really nice, but the building next to us and our own patio were still under construction. The big bummer though was the extra charges for everything, namely parking. There is a sign outside saying valet is $20/day, so we self parked. Little did we know that self parking is also $20/day even though the hotel is not in the downtown area so I'm not sure why they have to charge so much. We found a bill under our door at the end of our stay and at the front desk they told me I had agreed to it in some fine print when I signed the check in slip. The setting, however, is on a nice spot on Mission Bay.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but a bit disappointing for a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: shortysnh
Reviews.Content: The grounds are lovely, it is convenient to the freeway, the staff is nice, and the room is large and clean. Also, those typical comfy Hilton beds are there... The property is undergoing renovation, and I believe my room (Tower) was recently done. The only complaint regarding its condition is that the closet smelled of mold so badly that I had to put the ironing board on the balcony to air out, so I could iron my clothes without absorbing that odor. I also could not hang my clothes in the closet for the same reason. I was glad to just be passing through town on business. Had I paid for this place as a vacation I would not be happy. As a Hilton Gold member, I received no complimenty amenities such as free breakfast, or free internet. The fitness center was closed due to renovations, with no comp at a local gym. The bay was lovely to look at from a distance, but too gross to wade into. And $20/day to park? I will be back soon for another biz trip, and probably will look for another Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: 2bigfly1littlefly
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from April 3 to 14 which was over spring break and Easter. I will start with the positive because there isnâ€™t much. The location was great, it is very convenient to any attractions and has easy access to the freeway. Being in the middle of Mission Park was very nice with jogging paths and playgrounds on both sides of the hotel. The pools arenâ€™t bad, if a bit cold and not as well attended as they should be (running out of towels all the time or not having any at all at the other hot tub area). The staff, other than the front desk are very friendly and helpful. We asked for a very quiet room because our son is 1 Â½ and goes to sleep around 7:00pm, we were placed in room 138 and were not very impressed. It had supposedly been completely renovated but the bathtub & tiles in the shower were very old, the shower was very weak, the mattresses were extremely uncomfortable and dirty, the sheets had rips in them and on the last day the towels that were left in the room had blood stains (rather horrifying!). This room was definitely not quiet, if anything it sounded like a head of elephants going through our room all night long with the outside door slamming and the noise from upstairs. The side to side sound proofing is good but the floor above and the doors are a joke, there is absolutely no sound proofing at all. We placed a towel at the bottom of the door to try to muffle the sound a bit. I donâ€™t know if they forgot to put a seal at the bottom of the door or if there never was one, but it sure would go a long way to improving the sound problem. We had asked to be moved but they could only move us to another room that would be just as bad so in the end we didnâ€™t bother. We tried to take it in stride since it was a busy time of year but when your baby is being woken up 6 or more times a night from doors slamming, it is a bit too much to excuse. All in all, we had a great time in the city but would avoid staying in a Hilton again because of this experience

Reviews.Title: “No 4 star hotel, an older property with upgrades, but not luxury quality”
Reviews.Author: nytola
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on this hotel through Priceline but I have to say it was a bit disappointing. While the hotel recently won a 4-star hotel rating and is undergoing renovations, you can tell the property is old with lots of haphazard touch ups. The $20 parking charge is ridiculous given there is plenty of parking and lots of land, and this hotel is NOT located downtown in the Gas Lamp where you would expect to pay a parking fee. There were old used cups by the hot tub, garbage on the stairs walking up to the room, and a stale feel in the room itself. On the positive side, the hotel is right by a nice jogging / biking path and playground if you plan to travel with children. If you are a woman traveling on your own, I do not recommend this hotel. San Diego is booming with new hotels and perhaps 3-star rated hotels that would be better than this one. If you get it through Priceline, it's a steal. Just don't pay more than $130 for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: bourets
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located on the ocean front. The staff is very friendly and professional. The rooms have a lot of space and are very confortable. It is worth to take a breakfast on the patio: terrific view, great food! I definitly recommend it even though it is relatively far from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant, if pricey stay”
Reviews.Author: Pokymike
Reviews.Content: I stayed in late Feb. for a business meeting so the tab was covered by someone. Arrived by taxi from the airport (approx. $20, inc. tip) . I had a spacious 2nd floor room in one of the 2-story villas facing the bay. It was clean, well-appointed, and the bed was very comfortable. The grounds are nice, and adjacent to city parks. The exercise area is a bit cramped, but they have a nice selection of equipment. The nearest bus stop is at least a 20-30 minute walk, and Pacific Beach, a neighborhood with many shops and restaurants is at least 45 minutes north on foot. Old Town is about a $12 cab ride. Meeting facilities were adequate for our small group, and the staff were very responsive to any of our needs. Food service was average. Internet access was an additional 11.95 per day; I was unable to get wireless access. Transportation back to airport was not as arranged, so I nearly missed my 615A flight. Overall, a pleasant stay though having a car or even a bicycle would have made it much more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “This place was great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kaycimay
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews, I was very skeptical but this place was beautiful! We stayed in a garden bay room, I called ahead to request a newly renovated room. Reserved the room on Priceline for $110.00 per night. The room was very big, everything was brand new,( it looked like the T.V. had never been used, the cord wasn't plugged in).We had a great view of the bay and a big balcony. Everyone that worked there was super nice and helpful. The guy at the front asked what we were doing for the day and told us it may rain and gave us umbrellas to use! The $20 parking is crazy, but the location is so convenient for everything. We didn't eat at the resort, (Jack in the Box is my favorite place to eat and they don't have them in OKC). The conceiege recommened a great Italian Restaurant in the Gaslamp District and it was the best Italian I've ever had, ASTI is the name. We went to the Zoo, AWESOME, Solano Beach, AWESOME, Tijuana, AWESOME, Mueseum of Natural History, not so great......

Reviews.Title: “Not that Bad!”
Reviews.Author: Sheg
Reviews.Content: I will start out by saying that for the (Priceline) price this was a very nice place to stay. Yes the hotel and spa are under renovation and we were fortunate to stay in the tower on the 4th floor facing the lagoon. The room was very comfortable, and the bed delicious. I found the staff very accommodating. The grounds are pleasant and the hotel is very conveniently located to the highway and SeaWorld. The spa was terrific. This is NOT a four star resort in my opinion but a solid three. I would be disappointed if I had paid the current room rate. I rated the hotel average but if I had to compare it to a chain like a Days Inn I would go up a notch. There is a park on both sides of the hotel with walking path on the bay side. Very pleasant and the area felt very safe. The hotel locks all outside entrances except for the main gate at night. There is a starbucks coffee cart in the lobby which suited us perfectly in the morning, but the hours were sporadic. The restaurant was the typical pricey kind you find at this sort of hotel. 99% of the staff were very very pleasant to deal with. I was very concerned by the previous reviews and fortunately my experience was very different. We had two rooms and travelled with a 19 yr old. Good time was had by all!

Reviews.Title: “You can do better”
Reviews.Author: Hans50
Reviews.Content: With all the choices avaiable in San Diego, you can do better than this particular Hilton resort. In its favor, it is close to the interstate, easy to get to, is in a generally quiet area, close to running paths, and the public areas of the resort are attractive. However, and it is a big however, this is not what I would consider a quality Hilton property. The room we stayed in (509) was dreary. A very large water spot spread across the ceiling. The ceramic tub finish was peeling off. The daily parking fee of twenty dollars is excessive. The restaurant fee schedule is weird. One day our breakfast of granola and yogurt was less than ten dollars; the next day they charged us for the yogurt. The day before we were told that the yogurt was included. You should also know that the resort is not on the ocean. It faces a backwater lagoon that eventually opens onto the ocean, but the property itself is at least a mile from the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of a rip-off”
Reviews.Author: guerillatraveler75
Reviews.Content: To be fair, this hotel was certainly set in a nice part of SD between La Jolla and downtown and close to the highway. It boasts some decent amenities and a nice pool area. Nothing fabulous that would warrant a 4-star rating other than a small "resort" wing, though. After having stayed at many a 4-star hotel on business in many countries, I must say I was more than appalled at the nickel-and-diming of customers. Parking is $20/day, which is never mentioned on any online site. The worst part is, there are no other parking areas around the hotel, so it is more of a hostage arrangement than an option. They charge you to use the basic gym, internet service, and a few other services that your average 3 star hotel would give you for free. Add a bathroom full of deceptively placed "hotel brand" moisturizers and doodads- all for fee of course-and you get the distinct feeling that you're getting a shakedown that is simply irritating to no end. You start getting paranoid about using the hotel soap and towels lest a fee for that. For a resort, they simply have not understood the concept of including basics into the price and reducing the hassle factor for guests. Raise the price if you must, but for gods sake dont charge for using your own hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, I can't believe all the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: JetSetJeny
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I came to San Diego for New Year's and bid on priceline for a 4-star hotel. We were quite excited to see we were staying at a Hilton Resort for only $90. But then we had to pay $20 per day for parking so our cost was actually more. They say it includes valet parking, but the valet guy was so swamped, it was faster and easier to just park ourselves. The resort looks very nice but we were in the "tower", which is not as nice as all the little villas around the place. I would definitely classify it as a low 3 star. Watch out because they charge you for EVERYTHING, if you have a guest visit, they must pay $20 for parking, internet charges are $12 per day, if you ask for extra bedding it's $30, if you want to work out in the gym it's $12. Personally, I would try another option next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice views, not a resort, and needs major updating”
Reviews.Author: Kimimarc
Reviews.Content: The hilton San Diego Resort is a three star at best. First off, the rooms are in horrible condition. We stayed there for two nights and asked for a new room the second night of our stay. The beds were comfortable and that was pretty much the only good thing. Our carpeting had just been shampooed and our floors were wet upon check-in, there was garbage left unter the sink, cracks in the walls and in the sinks and tub. No fans in the bathrooms, AC did not work very well and the walls were THIN. The second night we were put in a room that was a bit more updated. Bathroom was bigger but the ceiling was sagging with water damage. Also, be aware that the hotel charges 20.00 a day for self parking.

Reviews.Title: “Martha!!! Room Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunynCali
Reviews.Content: I just had bad experience at a previous hotel and checked in with apprehension. The previous hotel was a Hilton as well. My friend Martha from room service was so stellar and kind. She recommended a wonderful dinner and even better she followed up and called to ask me if I enjoyed her recommendation. What an incredible extra effort!! Very impressive!! I know this is not required or the standard of any hotel I stay at, including 5 star hotels!! Of course, I now think Martha is 5 star!! Since I travel so much, I notice genuine customer service. I am not in any way wishing to demean the value of Martha's position. I do head hunting for a living, so I can tell you, from experience, she is such a valueable asset to this company !! Martha needs to be recognized and promoted! She is such a pleasure to speak to and very wonderful!! I even had to comment on how well she articulated the menu with correct pronunciation. I sure hope she stays with your company and one day greets me as the General Manager!! If not, Martha call me, I will help achieve your aspirations!! :) Sandy Jordan, California Traveler!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Poor Poor”
Reviews.Author: nlaw68
Reviews.Content: Came to CA for a special occasion and had a lot of problems with this resort. First off let me stay I am an avid Hilton user because for the most part the service is usually great and the accommodations are usually great. This resort was nice but the service was awful! We got to the hotel at 5pm and there was a problem... I think they gave our room away. We did not get a room until 7pm that night. They tried to give us a room with 2 queen beds but it was our Anniversary and we really wanted a king with an outside lanai. And believe me we paid "BIG" money to have it. They said they had to "finish" cleaning our room. Their answer was to give us a $50.00 gift certificate for a hotel meal. When we did get the room the smell was soooooo bad and the carpet was wet..... They told us they had cleaned the carpet 2 weeks ago. It was so bad we had to move to another room. Our walk out lanai was not a walk out at all. We could go out but if you sat in the chair you could only see the ski and brick. The room itself was very large the bed was ok but not as comfy as I expected. The refrigerator smelled so bad (obviously the last guest left fish in there) everything that came out of it smelled like rotten fish. Needless to say we didn't bring any food back to our hotel. Readers are right $20.00 per day for parking is awful! What is this hotel thinking! The food is very expensive at the hotel you are definitely better off going to the many great restaurants in San Diego. They sure have learned how to nickel and dime you to death. I would definitely not stay here again. I have never been so disappointed in a Hilton before.

Reviews.Title: “Definately worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: cntrustno1
Reviews.Content: At first, I was a bit nervous purchasing a 2 nights stay on Priceline without knowing where we were going to stay. Then I figured, what can go wrong if I choose a 4 star hotel, in a specific area and for the price we want. We were very pleased with the selection of the Hilton San Diego Resort on Mission Bay. Upon arrival, we were given a Villa type room to stay in AND we were lucky enough to get an early check in! The Hilton was in a great location and we didn't have any trouble traveling around. The employees were helpful and the housekeeping staff was great. Saving the best for last, we will DEFINATELY recommend the Dungeness Crab Cake Benedict for breakfast at the onsite Bayside Terrace Grille! I would have to say that my boyfriend and I's first trip together was more than words can say.

Reviews.Title: “MAJOR PARKING FEE”
Reviews.Author: stjustin61
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is AVERAGE. The rooms, the restaurant, the view, the pool, their spa, the grounds itself, etc. For being billed as a "resort" in beautiful San Diego, and for the prices they charge, it's overall a dissappointment. They charge $20 a day for parking. That was most ridiculous. I'm sure you can find better in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: JourneyMaven
Reviews.Content: The Hilton San Diego Resort feels large and spacious, mostly because its buildings are spread over several acres and are no more than two stories in height. Well maintained landscaping connects the buildings and at its core is a main lobby with restaurant and pool. Parking is limited to one side of the hotel, and all the rooms seem to face towards the beach or landscaping on other side, so once you leave your car, you feel like you're really in a resort. Our room was not a suite and yet spacious with its private balcony and cathedral ceiling. The hotel is right on the beach of Mission Bay, so it's an easy walk from even the furthest room. On either side of the hotel are public parks, so you can walk on paved sidewalks for about a quarter mile in each direction, take the kids to a nearby playground, or enjoy a picnic on the grass. Some downsides are that the hotel is close to the interstate highway, so the sound of the traffic is omnipresent if you're outdoors. The beach, unfortunately, is on an inner bay, so no waves--just still water like being on a quiet lake. Great for kids, though, who won't be struggling with waves or an undertow at the ocean. During our stay, however, the water was contaminated and you weren't able to go in for a swim or ride a boat. The biggest disappointment was a $20 charge to park the car--not for valet, but for self-parking in an open parking lot--a ridiculous price considering the high cost of the hotel and a poor welcome to a resort. Hilton should reconsider this. The Hilton San Diego Resort advertises itself as a resort, but it's definitely a mixed bag. Any problems associated with its location on the water or by the freeway can't be easily be overcome by the hotel, but it should certainly warn its guests, especially if they can't take advantage of all its amenities or expect a romantic secluded spot on the ocean. If you're paying this much for a resort hotel, you don't want to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive but nice”
Reviews.Author: lexi731
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very beautiful, but at a price. We paid $280 per night and we used one night of our hilton honors points. When we got there, they said they had a garden room for us, but I said I wanted a room in the tower at the highest floor possible. Ryan got us a room on the top eighth floor with a view of the bay. But everything costs money! Breakfast is a joke with $10 waffles, so we ate at the nearby jack in the box. The highspeed internet in the rooms costs $12 a day (though I was able to tap into their wireless connection for free) and parking is $20 a day! And there were plenty of places to park - don't know why they have to charge for that. They have a basket of munchies set out, but if you eat anything, I'd run to the grocery store to replenish the stock. A tiny Toblerone candy bar was $3.50! And the bottle of Evian water (20 oz) was $5!! They do have Crabtree and Evelyn toiletries, which I asked for extras of. The pillows are down, so you have to call for non-allergenic ones if you are allergic to feathers. But after an hour, a guy brought me up 4. Then they called to make sure I got them. They do have snacks and drinks in the gift shop that cost about the same as you would get in a movie theatre. The pool area is really nice and clean. The pool is 12 ft deep and must be heated a little because it was much more pleasant than the frigid ocean. They provide the pool towels, so you don't need to bring your own. From our balcony, we could see the Sea World fireworks each night up close. We didn't go in the bay, but they have jet skis, wind surfer thingies and a nice wide sidewalk to rollerblade on. The rooms were very comfortable and the beds were awesome. The tv was a flat screen, but once again, anything beyond basic cable will cost you. We have two teenagers and they seemed to really enjoy it. I saw kids playing in a kiddie area where they have arts and crafts. They seemed to be having fun. I would stay here again as long as I had a discount of some sort. I would not stay here for full price. You do get a tiny fridge in the room to put drinks in, and there's not any place close to eat, so you need to bring snacks. If you have a car like we did, it's not too bad to find food, but otherwise you are at the mercy of the Hilton and their outrageous price gouging!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has Changed after years of Return Business”
Reviews.Author: boitano
Reviews.Content: We just visited the Hilton Resort after returning for 6 yrs. Our dissappointment was that there was a sudden change in management service standards and the clientele. First let me say the grounds are impeccable, and so was every service giver maids; pool personnel etc. On this trip we were there for R&R. We visited the pool and it was monopolized by San Diego families that had found a way to use the hotels facilities by getting thru a door by the 400 building. After reporting the issue of the overcrowded pool and security issues, nothing was done. Also, there was an incident with our reservations on hilton.com for which they attempted to charge us a second time, and when we explained we left our confirmation at home they said it was our problem to prove otherwise. I spent an entire day of my vacation trying to straighten it out, away from the pool again! No credits or courtesys were given to my family. I was not suprised, in that it seems with the security issues and billing, and confirmation issues the management has changed their attitude towards guest. The clientelle now is very grunge oriented and younger, and the managements attitude in extending services reflects more to the new clientelle. There were a group of 12 in a single room we noticed, it seems that things have really changed. We are considering never returnning after 6 years of a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: mdfinney
Reviews.Content: We just got back from San Diego. We stayed at the Hilton in Mission Bay. We had a bay front lanai room. The view was awesome. We watched the fireworks at Sea World from our lanai every night. Our girls ran down to the bay to play as soon as they got up in the morning.The pool was beautiful. They even had a kiddie pool for the tiny kids. The hotel was clean. The beds were super comfortable and the staff was very friendly. The only problem we had was at check in. Our room wasn't ready. After a little complaining they comped us the parking fee <which is a rip off, in my opinion> so it all worked out ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LOML
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a beautiful location, too bad that is the nicest part of it. Initially we were sent to a room that was so musty and old smelling I thought I might be in a nursing home. Our "garden view" was a view of the putting green. Needless to say we changed rooms and were given an adequate room in the tower. The rooms are blah, nothing exciting about them.Decent but not exquisite. THERE ARE NO IN ROOM COFFEE MAKERS-very irritating. I will admit that the beds were quite comfortable with nice down comforters and clean sheets. The hotel is located relatively close to other area attractions but a car is needed as taxis are a fortune. BE WARNED - you pay extra to park- $20 a night. The dining selection is limited both in room and at the restaurant. The pool is large but space is limited and shade is a commodity. The pool side menu is sparse but the drinks are nice. The spa and workout room are a joke. There are water sports available right at the bay in back of the hotel. All things considered it wasn't tragic but it was DEFINITELY NOT WHAT I WOULD CONSIDER "A RESORT". The cost was outrageous for what was offered. I would say it was one step up from a budget hotel. I definitely would not stay there again given the multitude of options in San Diego

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a lifesaver the Hilton is! We were booked at La Jolla Cove Suites we were horrified at their conditions! We didn't think during a busy holiday the Hilton would have any rooms for our remaining 6 day stay, but we called and they were more than accomodating to get us adjoining rooms. The beds are "comfty cozy" according to my little ones and our feet didn't get black from walking on their carpet like they did in LJCS. There is ample room in the bathrooms and the staff was very nice. We stayed here last year also and was just as satisfied with our stay. Sure you pay for all the services, but that what vacation is! The pool is wonderful and the kiddie pool is a lifesaver. Cleanliness is key for me and I was very comfortable. We have stayed in the tower and in the garden view 2 story buldings. Both were just fine. Because we stayed at the Hilton, our vacation was awesome. I recommend it highly. The bay is somewhat dirty, but it is a BAY. If you want the beach, go up 5 minutes to Mission Beach. The food is expensive here but they are everywhere. That's what you have to expect on vacation unless you go get subs and some groceries and stuff them in your mini fridge which is what we did.

Reviews.Title: “This is really a mixed bag...”
Reviews.Author: KK-Ltraveler
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-night stay at the Hilton on Mission Bay. What a mixed bag that place is! We've stayed in more than a few properties and I must say this one has me stumped. I'm still trying to figure out why this resort misses and can only put it down to poor management. The feeling of hospitality and service was definately lacking to a great extent. Part of it was due to inexperience and lack of training, part of it was due to the unfriendly demeanor of a few employees. Having said that, it may be that the staff's attitude is a defensive response to the boorish behavior of some of the guests particularly at the check-in desk. I agree with previous comments that your experience at this property will be greatly enhanced by your room assignment and that seemed to be a problem with quite a few people during our stay. If you're paying Priceline prices it's not so bad, but if you're paying rack rates it can be a big disappointment. Ask to see a map of the resort when you're checking in and ask questions about the location of your room in relation to parking lots, freeway, etc. Once you get past the room issue the resort can be enjoyable. The grounds are nicely kept and the pool area is pleasant. But, as other Trip Advisors have noted, it does not have the ambiance of other four-star resorts. As for Gold/Platinum members...you're on your own at this property. The automatic gracious welcome you're accustomed to is definately lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice employees but something is not right at this hotel -managemnt??”
Reviews.Author: wlinwright
Reviews.Content: Restaurant was very nice...good food and service was excellent. The rest of the experience could not be made up. Management decided to change out the locks on several rooms and did not tell me. So I went back to my room for a shower and nap and had to wait a couple of hours for them to finish. The workers were lounging in the chairs on the patio. After the locks were changed, I made seven trips to the lobby because I was constantly locked out of the room. Each time security and other staff came and had to force their way into the room. I came back to the room twice and found it wide open. My confidence and sense of security were shaken to say the least. Apparently cleaning crew did not pull the door firmly to each time. I was locked out of the pool as well when they changed the keys and the new ones were too large for the lock. Was told to just go throught the lobby and out of my way to get to the pool. Next, I was moved to another room and the next day the parking lot was resurfaced and I had to walk from my previous building to get to my room and I was paying $14 dollars a day to park no where close to my room. Ice machinge didn't work either in the new building so I had to walk over to my previous location for ice. Finally power went off the day before I left for a short time. No comps, just sorry about all the inconvience. Me too. I can't help but think there is a very poor facility manager somewhere?? I tried to make the best of things but in all of my traveling I've never been excited to leave a hotel before - I went to the airport and waited for four hours for my flight and was glad to get out of the comedy of errors and back home to privacy, security and a chance to relax.

Reviews.Title: “3 rooms later....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We didn't get off on the right foot with this hotel. I will say firstly that it's in a great location, central to Mission Bay, parks, beaches, downtown, Old Town and Sea World. The grounds are nice, well kept, expansive banquet facilities with weddings, 'proms' and business functions going on, a full building dedicated as a spa, great pool featuring 'banana cabana', resturant right on the bay, guest access direct to sandy beach where there's sailboat and jetski rental. Now for the bad - THE ROOMS. We were checked into a room on the bottom floor located as soon as you walked in the tower door, that faced the lobby, valet, and all the busy-ness of a hotel on Friday night. The screen door opened up directly to the driveway to valet, an inferior room that we wondered was maybe the result of being a 'discount purchaser'. You get what you pay for?! The bathroom was tiny and the tub still had hair and stains in it. So we asked for another room and were given a 2nd floor one in another building. When we went to check the 2nd room out, thinking it was on the first floor because our room number started with '1', the hallway on that floor was littered with room service plates, nats and bugs flying around them, and the smell of sweet-dampness (kind of how bad fruit smells). It was syrup... and fruit... and eggs, pancakes, jam - seen on the many plates outside almost every other room door, that were obviously sitting out from breakfast - at 3pm in the afternoon! Came to find out odd room numbers were on the top floor, made our way up the stairs (no elevator) to our 2nd room. Soon as we opened the door, there was the most terrible PEE and musty smell in this room. We wanted to give it a try anyway (and not be headaches to the front desk), opened windows and turned on the ceiling fan (a plus) but couldn't get rid of the smell. We thought maybe the carpet had been cleaned and not dried properly, but soon found out when we tried to put our kids drinks in the room fridge that it was old, moldy, brown and rusty inside, emanating that old, foul smell. No wonder the room was damp and stinky! We called front desk to complain ... again. And were given a room a few doors down from the second, that was better - new fridge, mildly damp smell (maybe the humidity in San D ). So overall a *decent* stay, but here's the thing - NOT WHAT YOU'D EXPECT OF A 4 STAR by any means. Rooms need a facelift out of their 'floridian retiree' style into something more modern and cheek (beachy can be chic). I guess the only good thing in the rooms - Crabtree & Evelyn bath products. If you don't mind a little 'crustiness' in your room which is made up for in the facilites, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “SKIP THE RESTUARANT. DEFINITELY SKIP THE SPA!”
Reviews.Author: NewMexicoHanna
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 4 nights at this Hilton. I had an excellent rate, so that influences my expectations and opinions of the room and hotel in general. The room was spacious, very comfortable bedding and fine housekeeping services. I chose a room in the Tower because the first room I was offered, which was nearer to the pool, etc., had a strong musty odor. We ate dinner in the restuarant one evening. Although the food is very attractive and artistically presented, everything from the apetizers to the desserts tasted mediocre, at best! Service was slow and inattentive. The whole experience was annoying and over-priced! FORGET THE SO-CALLED SPA! We decided to really splurge and made appointments for massages and pedicures. OUCH! What an extreme disappointment! The facility is absolutely nothing special. There wasn't even a person on-hand to greet us when we arrived. The massages were so-so (Are these therapists trained and licensed?) and the very expensive pedicure was given in an uncomfortable chair. When our services were completed, we were offered the opportunity to sit on the porch which over-looks the tennis courts and the freeway! We spent $400 for these services!!! I'm a teacher, so that's a big chunk of my paycheck wasted on below average treatments. GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a great price via Priceline. For about $100/night we were in the tower. Nice, big clean room. Everyone was so courteous from the valet to room service. We were having a hard time getting on the internet because everyone was trying to watch movies, but the hotel said to try again in 30 minutes and they wouldn't charge us for it. We were able to get on the internet AND watch movies after about 10 minutes and it was all free of charge just as promised! So close to Sea World and the bay! Everything was just perfect! Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay There Again, which is high praise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife, 13 year old son, and I stayed here for three nights (April 9-11.) We got the hotel via an internet site for $100.00 per night. The hotel is a sprawling campus situated between Highway 5 and Mission Bay. We arrived at about 5:30 pm and check-in was smooth and friendly, with no negative mention of our discounted rate. Our request for two queen beds was accepted and my request to be high in the tower was given the 4th (out of 8 floors.) Our room faced toward the Bay, but not quite high enough for a view. However, the room was big, clean and, unlike most modern hotels, it has a balcony so you can get plenty of fresh air. Also, the room was very quiet. We were only 150 yards from the freeway, but I didn't hear it at night. The beds are fantastic...probably the best, most comfortable I've encountered in any 4 star hotel. We didn't try the restaurants, but they looked nice. The pool is huge and heated. The two jacuzzi's situated nearby are "intimate." The health club has several tennis courts and a decent collection of cardio and weight equipment. (There may be a fee to use it, which SHOULD be included.) Parking is $14.00 for self park. (All hotels in San Diego charge for parking, which is crazy.) If I ended up with this hotel again for the same price, I'd be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: yes2travel
Reviews.Content: I think the room you select makes a difference at this Hilton. I was in the Palacio building and my room was fantastic. The 2nd floor balcony was angled to look out towards the water and was very private. You could not see your neighbors on either side. The bed was king sized and very comfy. The carpet appeared to be brand new and there was no "mildew" smell. I was also surprised ot find a HD TV! The room also had a very nice wet bar and an oversized bar refridgerator (for you personal items) in addition to the mini-bar. The bathroom towels appeared to be brand new and I thought very nice. The grounds were lovely and and the pool and hot tub areas excellent. I had breakfast two mornings and although the buffet was a bit pricey at 18$ the items presented were tasty. Extremely close proximity to Old Town. It took me about 5 minutes to drive there for some great Mexican meals. The down side is the parking situation. It is very limited. We were not charged during our 3 nights there, but it took some driving around to find a spot. There were events going on at the hotel (business meetings, a wedding) and those attendees took up many of the self parking slots. I'd suggest that the hotel never charge self parking fees unless they can guarantee a spot for every car. The work out area was nice, but $24 for use of the tennis courts seemed overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had originally booked this hotel through an online travel site - basic room for $200+. Then, I decided to give Priceline a try, requested a 4-star hotel in the San Diego Coastal area for $99/night and, lo and behold, I got the Hilton San Diego (same hotel) for half the cost! So, on that note, for $99 a night, this hotel is stellar! For $200+ a night, I would have had a lot of complaints. First off, you really need to request where your room is. I understand that the Tower is not where you want to be and I can see why from my limited experience with the Tower. It is very tall, cold feeling, like an old apartment building. We were placed in a villa that was one story, side by side rooms (others are two-story). The majority of the rooms in our villa block had arcadia doors that opened in the back onto gorgeous green lawns with putting green, hot tub, etc. Our room was flipped so that the arcadia doors were in the front (next to the front door) and the patio (two lounge chairs) sat right on the parking lot. Needless to say, the patio wasn't used and I didn't feel safe opening the curtains for all of the parking lot to be able to look into our room. So beware. The room itself was very small, barely enough room for two double beds. The room had an old motel feel to it, low ceilings, although the beds and furniture was top-quality. Very tight quarters, I can't imagine spending a lot of time in the room. Would request a bigger room option next time (but for $99 who can complain?) Great bay/beach area, lots of fun stuff to rent (jet skis, etc.), pool area is nice but pool was very cold. Great for families that want to plant themselves at the resort and not go anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better!”
Reviews.Author: Maui Marine
Reviews.Content: Nice property except that that most rooms are a very long walk from the reception area â€“ do not use valet parking unless you are sleeping in the lobby as all rooms are a long walk back to the valet parking area. There are not central walkways from the rooms back to the hotel lobby area â€“ pool - restaurant. Self parking is $14.00 and they do not enforce who pays and who did not pay, on three nights I came back to the hotel after a long day and could not find anywhere to park as they had special events and the attendees parked in front of the buildings where the guest stay. The beach in front of the hotel is not really an ocean beach but part of the Fiesta Island Bay which was built from sewage sludge dumped by the City of San Diego (Google Fiesta Island San Diego and Sewage) â€“ Iâ€™d be very hesitant let my kids play in this water. Also during my walk along the boardwalk I saw several city owned bathrooms that said â€œSewer pumping station # ___â€� - right on the beach area. Pool and spa area here is very nice and stays open late. Beds were not what I expect from a Hilton and I had an ocean front king which should be as good as it gets. Pay a few bucks more and stay at the Hilton Torrey Pines â€“ itâ€™s a much better property just up the road a few miles.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge, Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Priceline found this hotel for us for less than $100 / night. We were a bit concerned about the facilities based upon the previous reviews. The hotel is right around the corner from Sea World, but you will need a car to get almost anywhere. There is a shuttle, but that is not our style. The hotel needs a makeover, but was certainly acceptable. Ali the Concierge was outstanding!!! We would stay here again, just because of her. Good experience, just don't have super high expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Not a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobkatevan
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, nice rooms, beds comfortable, location is right next to Mission Bay, but in my opinion not within walking distance to the ocean beach. If your with a family and don't want to venture out, this is a great location. Park nearby, walking trail behind the hotel. I prefer to be near restaurants and the ocean, this is bay front. I booked through hotwire. Tennis courts on site and very large pool with a childrens pool too. Game area for the kids and during the tourist season a childrens program. They rent boats, ski doos, bikes, and other play items right at the hotel. There is a restaurant on site, but a bit pricey. Didn't eat there. Had to drive to another location, since no other eateries within walking distance. Paid $14 to park my car outside of my room. No parking garage. Just another way to get another buck from the consumer.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in late June, 2005. It is important to note there are two buildings to the hotel-the nice Marina building, and then a "step-child" building. Upon checking in at the main building, I was put in the other building, and told they had a free shuttle, or it was a 2 minute walk. Since I was in a hurry, I walked. It was more like 10 minutes, hauling my luggage and hot and sweaty. The first room I was put in was very nice, however the balcony was inhabited by a family of sea gulls and covered in bird mess. The parent birds stood at the window and squawked at me non-stop, apparently trying to protect the baby bird also living on the balcony. I called the front desk and they said "oh, you're in that room...we'll move you right away." Apparently they all know this room is a problem, but still put people in it. The second room was ok; it was a handicap-accessible room and the towels were frayed, the coffee maker burst a leak the first morning and spilled coffee everywhere but in the coffee pot, however the staff did give me a credit for the inconvenience. Second morning my shower drain backed-up (not a bathtub, a walk-in with no boundary on the floor) and dirty water flooded the bathroom floor. I had just gotten out of the shower and needed to get dressed, do my hair, etc. The staff sent someone up and gave me another credit, however I was late to my morning appt. because I could not use the bathroom to get ready! I was transferred to a third room which was fine, but this was only after much complaining on my part. I would only stay at this hotel if you can get a room in the main building as the other building seems to have a lot of problems and is certainly not the top priority of the management.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hilton!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, the architecture, the location, it was nice! We booked through Hotwire but when we checked in at the hotel, we were upgraded for free to the tower with an awesome ocean, city view and balcony. It was quiet, peaceful and convenient. I got up in the morning to a beautiful ocean view and worked out in their state of the art fitness room. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Facility”
Reviews.Author: Saratogatraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference. Nice place. Clean and well mainained grounds. A bit out-of-the-way if you want to do anything off property. You'll need to take a cab.

Reviews.Title: “nice resort”
Reviews.Author: winterbrrr
Reviews.Content: Our stay in March 2005 was very nice. We received a room in the tower, but it was not on the side of the freeway. We had a great view of the reception building and parking lot (haha). The room was lovely, clean and quite large. Two double beds and they even comped a roll-away for our 3rd child! It didn't have a fridge, but we just kept our drinks on ice in the bathtub!! The housekeeper was great. For a $1/day tip she gave up more soap and shampoo we could ever use! She even left extra coffee packs and towels. Very friendly lady, she inquired about the children each day and asked if we were having a good time. Actually all the staff we met were very friendly, including receptionists. The pool area is beautiful and the pool is large and deep. It was supposedly heated, but too cold for me. Our kids enjoyed it though. At the time we were there, it was cool and rainy so they only swam once. The beach area is very nice and they offer bike and boat rentals. Quite expensive though. There is a Starbucks in the lobby area which we used, but even those prices were inflated. We did not use the restaurant or room service. Overall the resort was a good experience. The price of $64/night (on priceline) was amazing for such quality. The downside was a parking fee of $14/day. Well, it is a resort after all. We visited Old Town for a day and thoroughly enjoyed it. My husband is not into Mexican food so we didn't eat anything there, which is a shame because a lot of places looked interesting. Touring the old buildings was fun and educational. We enjoyed our stay at the Hilton Resort and found it very easy to hop onto the freeway and get to other areas of San Diego. We had a great time in S.D. and hope to return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you're traveling for business”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First things first, this is a resort adjacent to Sea World so it is designed to extract dollars from carefree (or careless) vacationers. This Hilton is in an isolated area, cut off by the freeway from the rest of San Diego. There's nothing within walking distance. If you want a business-friendly hotel, look elsewhere. Nasty overcharges and high fees are everywhere, from the $14/night parking to the $12/night hi-speed internet (in-room, wired, DSL) to $30+/person for dinner. The resort is a very confusing place to navigate, especially at night. The parking lots are poorly lit and hazardous for cars and pedestrians. I had a Villa room (Villa Triana). No elevator in the Villas. They resemble motel-type buildings. The room itself was quite good, with the usual Hilton comforts and conveniences. Work desk was located away from the door (good). TV reception is bad, even for a hotel (probably to encourage travelers to use the resort). Keep an eye out for the refridgerator in the hidden, second closet. Turn it off if you want a quiet night's sleep. There was some hallway and parking lot noise but it calmed down after 10pm...I visited in October, during the off-season for Sea World, so it's probably worse during the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: TahitiGirl
Reviews.Content: We needed a quick getaway since our plans to travel to Cancun were stopped by Hurricane Wilma. This property fit the bill. Check in was smooth and we were upgraded to a full bay view when the staff learned that we were celebrating our first wedding anniversary and that our original trip had been canceled. The room was clean and the bed was heavenly, although after two nights we decided it was just a little too soft for our tastes. We only ate breakfast in the restaurant. We did the buffet one morning, it was awful! The next we ordered off the menu the food was much, much better. My only complaint (and it's a minor one) was that we had to pay for parking, $14 a day seemed a little steep. But that won't stop us from visiting again when we want a quick weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok, but VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: Cornbree
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to San Diego and a weekend stay in the Hilton Hotel. Before that we spent 4 days in the Pacific Terrace Hotel in San Diego, which is much nicer in our opinion. The Hilton Hotel resort is very nicely done (nice reception area, nice pool area, very nice restaurant). We would have liked a room overlooking the bay, but they only had rooms left in the "Tower". We also had a room overlooking the bay from there (7th floor), however this building was sooo noisy. It was the first time in my life that I had to use ear plugs at night. The walls seem to be very thin and you can hear all sorts of noises. In the toilets they use the same system as on airplanes, where it is not flushed, but sucked in instead and you can hear the noise from all toilets around you in your hotel room. Parking is $14, but there is no alternative choice of parking on the road and we thought that is a bit of a "rip off". There is nothing at all around the hotel in terms of bars or restaurants, but we drove to San Diego downtown (Gaslamp district) where you can find plenty and it is only 10 minutes away (app. $20 from the hotel). They also have a "watersport area" at the hotel and we rented a jet ski ($100 for 1 hour) and went out on the bay and that was great fun. There is also a path running along the hotel and you can rent bikes or just go for a walk. Would I stay there again? Probably would, if I could get a hotel room directly at the bay.

Reviews.Title: “This is Not a Resort. And who rated this as a 4 star anyway?”
Reviews.Author: lealealea
Reviews.Content: We booked our room through Priceline and knew we wanted to stay in a 4 star hotel. We bid $100/night and it was taken by the Hilton San Diego Resort. The location was nice bc it was on Mission Bay. Along the drive to the hotel on E. Mission Bay Dr., you can see people barbecuing, flying kites, on their wave runners on the bay, and children playing on the large playgrounds. It was a neat sight to see, especially with the sun shining on the water, making it sparkle! We arrived at the hotel at 2pm to check in. (Check in is actually listed as 4 p.m..) Upon checking in, they asked if I wanted to valet all 4 days I would be there, or if I'd like to self park. The valet parking is $16/day or $14/day to self park. I thought this idea was completely ridiculous! You receive a piece of paper to place on your dashboard to show what dates they are valid from. But... Who really polices this? Parking was very tight and it was nearly impossible to park close by to our building each day. We soon realized people were parking on the street instead. Had we known this, we wouldn't have agreed to the self park upon checking in. Upon checking in, we had no bellhop assist with our luggage, nor offer, even though he was just standing there looking straight at us. Rather than offering to take our bags, he jumps over to another person in line and offers to take their bags, even though I got there first. We have checked in to many 4 and 5 star hotels before and have never received service like this before. Aside from the lazy and unattentive bellhop, service didn't get any better. We requested a room overlooking the bay over the telephone before our trip, and the agent said they'd honor that. Much to our disappointment, the person who checked us in said, "Well, we already have you set up in the room." No big deal. We were on the 1st floor in the building over looking the parking lot. What a view and the noise! Was this not negotiable because I obtained this room through priceline bid? The room was very clean, beds were very well made, and toiletries were stocked every day. Just like in any other hotel, they won't change the towels for clean, new ones, unless you put them on the floor. Towels were so hard and crunchy! For a 4 star hotel, you'd think along with the soft, high thread count sheets, they'd have soft towels. Again, very minor. In the restroom, it had granite countertops, good water pressure, but an ugly sight below the countertop. The front of the counter is actually a faux cabinet door, and is one big piece of wood. It was coming apart and was really ugly. Aside from that, the furniture was pretty basic. The room had a kin size comfortable bed, 2 side tables, a table with a mirror in front of it (which was great when I was doing my hair in the mornings), with a chair, a comfortable arm chair, and dresser drawers with a flat screen tv on it. All in all, we had a great vacation sight seeing, but we're wondering how the heck this hotel has a 4 star rating? This is really not a resort, but just a larger scale hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: segraybill
Reviews.Content: We spent the Labor Day weekend at the Hilton and had a wonderful time. The hotel is beautiful and the property is awesome!! The only drawback is the 14.00 a night for parking. The Beds are soooooo comfortable!!! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the Labor day weekend. This is not exactly a resort but a very good deluxe hotel - wide open spaces, nice pool area, watersports on property, bayside dining with good food at reasonable prices for a deluxe hotel. We had a villa room that was huge and service was second to none. Bathrooms were very clean and beds extremely comfortable. The hotel decor is not ostentatious like some other deluxe hotels, so you stay over there not so much to enjoy the decor but to relax by the bayside and have a little fun around the hotel marina - wave running, kayaking, sailing ..... There is no real beach on the hotel property, just a small strip of sand on the backwaters of the bay. We went to Coronado where you will find a real beach.

Reviews.Title: “What's with all the negative reviews on this place??”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel from Aug. 14-18th and got an excellent 87 dollar a night rate through Priceline. However, after receiving the rate, I went on here and thought that I may have overpaid even at 87...I'm happy to report that's not the case at all. As many other reviewers have already said, the grounds and the pool were beautiful, and the service on the whole was top notch. Two negatives-- Hilton having the cojones to ask 60 cents a minute for internet use at their business center, and 14 dollars a day to self park. On another positive-- even though we got the hotel through Priceline, I was able to bargain with the front desk check in rep. and get complimentary breakfast passes each day due to being a Hilton Hhonors Gold member. All in all, an excellent stay in a wonderful location-- we were 10 minutes or less from everything we wanted to do. Highly recommended if you can get it through priceline for under 90 a night.

Reviews.Title: “hilton is worth it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great place and great prices! We booked on priceline and were expecting them to give us a shabby room but we have a view of the bay and the putting green.
